Theory Preliminaries

(*
Title: Value-Dependent SIFUM-Type-Systems
Authors: Toby Murray, Robert Sison, Edward Pierzchalski, Christine Rizkallah
(Based on the SIFUM-Type-Systems AFP entry, whose authors
 are: Sylvia Grewe, Heiko Mantel, Daniel Schoepe)
*)
section â€¹Preliminariesâ€º
theory Preliminaries
imports Main (* "HOL-Library.Lattice_Syntax" *)
begin

text â€¹Possible modes for variables:â€º
datatype Mode = AsmNoReadOrWrite | AsmNoWrite | GuarNoReadOrWrite | GuarNoWrite

text â€¹We consider a two-element security lattice:â€º
datatype Sec = High | Low


text â€¹@{term Sec} forms a (complete) lattice:â€º
instantiation Sec :: complete_lattice
begin

definition top_Sec_def: "top = High"
definition sup_Sec_def: "sup d1 d2 = (if (d1 = High âˆ¨ d2 = High) then High else Low)"
definition inf_Sec_def: "inf d1 d2 = (if (d1 = Low âˆ¨ d2 = Low) then Low else High)"
definition bot_Sec_def: "bot = Low"
definition less_eq_Sec_def: "d1 â‰¤ d2 = (d1 = d2 âˆ¨ d1 = Low)"
definition less_Sec_def: "d1 < d2 = (d1 = Low âˆ§ d2 = High)"
definition Sup_Sec_def: "Sup S = (if (High âˆˆ S) then High else Low)"
definition Inf_Sec_def: "Inf S = (if (Low âˆˆ S) then Low else High)"

instance
  apply (intro_classes)
                 using Sec.exhaust less_Sec_def less_eq_Sec_def inf_Sec_def sup_Sec_def apply auto[10]
       apply (metis Inf_Sec_def Sec.exhaust less_eq_Sec_def)
      apply (metis Inf_Sec_def Sec.exhaust less_eq_Sec_def)
     using Sec.exhaust less_Sec_def less_eq_Sec_def inf_Sec_def sup_Sec_def Inf_Sec_def Sup_Sec_def top_Sec_def bot_Sec_def 
     by auto
end

text â€¹Memories are mappings from variables to valuesâ€º
type_synonym ('var, 'val) Mem = "'var â‡’ 'val"

text â€¹A mode state maps modes to the set of variables for which the
  given mode is set.â€º
type_synonym 'var Mds = "Mode â‡’ 'var set"

text â€¹Local configurations:â€º
type_synonym ('com, 'var, 'val) LocalConf = "('com Ã— 'var Mds) Ã— ('var, 'val) Mem"

text â€¹Global configurations:â€º
type_synonym ('com, 'var, 'val) GlobalConf = "('com Ã— 'var Mds) list Ã— ('var, 'val) Mem"

text â€¹A locale to fix various parametric components in Mantel et. al, and assumptions
  about them:â€º
locale sifum_security_init =
  fixes dma :: "('Var,'Val) Mem â‡’ 'Var â‡’ Sec"
  fixes ğ’_vars :: "'Var â‡’ 'Var set"
  fixes ğ’ :: "'Var set" (* classification control variables *)
  fixes eval :: "('Com, 'Var, 'Val) LocalConf rel"
  fixes some_val :: "'Val"
  fixes INIT :: "('Var,'Val) Mem â‡’ bool"
  assumes deterministic: "âŸ¦ (lc, lc') âˆˆ eval; (lc, lc'') âˆˆ eval âŸ§ âŸ¹ lc' = lc''"
  assumes finite_memory: "finite {(x::'Var). True}"
  defines "ğ’ â‰¡ â‹ƒx. ğ’_vars x"
  assumes ğ’_vars_ğ’: "x âˆˆ ğ’ âŸ¹ ğ’_vars x = {}"
  assumes dma_ğ’_vars: "âˆ€xâˆˆğ’_vars y. memâ‡©1 x = memâ‡©2 x âŸ¹ dma memâ‡©1 y = dma memâ‡©2 y"
  assumes ğ’_Low: "âˆ€xâˆˆğ’. dma mem x = Low"

locale sifum_security = sifum_security_init dma ğ’_vars ğ’ eval some_val "Î»_.True"
  for dma :: "('Var,'Val) Mem â‡’ 'Var â‡’ Sec"
  and ğ’_vars :: "'Var â‡’ 'Var set"
  and ğ’ :: "'Var set" (* classification control variables *)
  and eval :: "('Com, 'Var, 'Val) LocalConf rel"
  and some_val :: "'Val"

context sifum_security_init begin

lemma ğ’_vars_subset_ğ’:
  "ğ’_vars x âŠ† ğ’"
  by(force simp: ğ’_def)

lemma dma_ğ’:
  "âˆ€xâˆˆğ’. memâ‡©1 x = memâ‡©2 x âŸ¹ dma memâ‡©1 = dma memâ‡©2"
  proof
    fix y
    assume "âˆ€xâˆˆğ’. memâ‡©1 x = memâ‡©2 x"
    hence "âˆ€xâˆˆğ’_vars y. memâ‡©1 x = memâ‡©2 x"
      using ğ’_vars_subset_ğ’ by blast
    thus "dma memâ‡©1 y = dma memâ‡©2 y"
      by(rule dma_ğ’_vars)
  qed

end

(* induction tools, moved up as far as possible *)

lemma my_trancl_induct [consumes 1, case_names base step]:
  "âŸ¦(a, b) âˆˆ râ‡§+; 
    P a ; 
   â‹€x y. âŸ¦(x, y) âˆˆ r; P xâŸ§ âŸ¹ P yâŸ§ âŸ¹ P b"
  by (induct rule: trancl.induct, blast+)
  
lemma my_trancl_step_induct [consumes 1, case_names base step]:
  "âŸ¦(a, b) âˆˆ râ‡§+; 
   â‹€x y. (x, y) âˆˆ r âŸ¹ P x y;
   â‹€x y z. P x y âŸ¹ (y, z) âˆˆ r âŸ¹ P x zâŸ§ âŸ¹ P a b"
  by (induct rule: trancl_induct, blast+)
  
lemma my_trancl_big_step_induct [consumes 1, case_names base step]:
  "âŸ¦(a, b) âˆˆ râ‡§+; 
   â‹€x y. (x, y) âˆˆ r âŸ¹ P x y;
   â‹€x y z. (x, y) âˆˆ râ‡§+ âŸ¹ P x y âŸ¹ (y, z) âˆˆ r âŸ¹ P y z âŸ¹ P x zâŸ§ âŸ¹ P a b"
  by (induct rule: trancl.induct, blast+)
  
lemmas my_trancl_step_induct3 = 
  my_trancl_step_induct[of "((ax,ay), az)" "((bx,by), bz)", split_format (complete),
                 consumes 1, case_names step]
  
lemmas my_trancl_big_step_induct3 = 
  my_trancl_big_step_induct[of "((ax,ay), az)" "((bx,by), bz)", split_format (complete),
                 consumes 1, case_names base step]

end

Theory Security

(*
Title: Value-Dependent SIFUM-Type-Systems
Authors: Toby Murray, Robert Sison, Edward Pierzchalski, Christine Rizkallah
(Based on the SIFUM-Type-Systems AFP entry, whose authors
 are: Sylvia Grewe, Heiko Mantel, Daniel Schoepe)
*)

section â€¹Definition of the SIFUM-Security Propertyâ€º

theory Security
imports Preliminaries
begin

type_synonym ('var, 'val) adaptation = "'var â‡€ ('val Ã— 'val)"

definition apply_adaptation ::
  "bool â‡’ ('Var, 'Val) Mem â‡’ ('Var, 'Val) adaptation â‡’ ('Var, 'Val) Mem"
  where "apply_adaptation first mem A =
         (Î» x. case (A x) of
               Some (vâ‡©1, vâ‡©2) â‡’ if first then vâ‡©1 else vâ‡©2
             | None â‡’ mem x)"

abbreviation apply_adaptationâ‡©1 ::
  "('Var, 'Val) Mem â‡’ ('Var, 'Val) adaptation â‡’ ('Var, 'Val) Mem"
  ("_ [âˆ¥â‡©1 _]" [900, 0] 1000)
  where "mem [âˆ¥â‡©1 A] â‰¡ apply_adaptation True mem A"

abbreviation apply_adaptationâ‡©2 ::
  "('Var, 'Val) Mem â‡’ ('Var, 'Val) adaptation â‡’ ('Var, 'Val) Mem"
  ("_ [âˆ¥â‡©2 _]" [900, 0] 1000)
  where "mem [âˆ¥â‡©2 A] â‰¡ apply_adaptation False mem A"

definition
  var_asm_not_written :: "'Var Mds â‡’ 'Var â‡’ bool"
where
  "var_asm_not_written mds x â‰¡ x âˆˆ mds AsmNoWrite âˆ¨ x âˆˆ mds AsmNoReadOrWrite"

context sifum_security_init begin

subsection â€¹Evaluation of Concurrent Programsâ€º

abbreviation eval_abv :: "('Com, 'Var, 'Val) LocalConf â‡’ (_, _, _) LocalConf â‡’ bool"
  (infixl "â†" 70)
where
  "x â† y â‰¡ (x, y) âˆˆ eval"

abbreviation conf_abv :: "'Com â‡’ 'Var Mds â‡’ ('Var, 'Val) Mem â‡’ (_,_,_) LocalConf"
  ("âŸ¨_, _, _âŸ©" [0, 0, 0] 1000)
where
  "âŸ¨ c, mds, mem âŸ© â‰¡ ((c, mds), mem)"

(* Labelled evaluation global configurations: *)
inductive_set meval :: "((_,_,_) GlobalConf Ã— nat Ã— (_,_,_) GlobalConf) set"
  and meval_abv :: "_ â‡’ _ â‡’ _ â‡’ bool" ("_ â†â‡˜_â‡™ _" 70)
where
  "conf â†â‡˜kâ‡™ conf' â‰¡ (conf, k, conf') âˆˆ meval" |
  meval_intro [iff]: "âŸ¦ (cms ! n, mem) â† (cm', mem'); n < length cms âŸ§ âŸ¹
  ((cms, mem), n, (cms [n := cm'], mem')) âˆˆ meval"

inductive_cases meval_elim [elim!]: "((cms, mem), k, (cms', mem')) âˆˆ meval"

inductive neval :: "('Com, 'Var, 'Val) LocalConf â‡’ nat â‡’ (_, _, _) LocalConf â‡’ bool"
  (infixl "â†â‡—_â‡–" 70)
where
  neval_0: "x = y âŸ¹ x â†â‡—0â‡– y" |
  neval_S_n: "x â† y âŸ¹ y â†â‡—nâ‡– z âŸ¹ x â†â‡—Suc nâ‡– z"

inductive_cases neval_ZeroE: "neval x 0 y"
inductive_cases neval_SucE: "neval x (Suc n) y"

lemma neval_det:
  "x â†â‡—nâ‡– y âŸ¹ x â†â‡—nâ‡– y' âŸ¹ y = y'"
  apply(induct arbitrary: y' rule: neval.induct)
   apply(blast elim: neval_ZeroE)
  apply(blast elim: neval_SucE dest: deterministic)
  done

lemma neval_Suc_simp [simp]:
  "neval x (Suc 0) y = x â† y"
proof
  assume a: "neval x (Suc 0) y"
  have "â‹€n. neval x n y âŸ¹ n = Suc 0 âŸ¹ x â† y"
  proof -
    fix n
    assume "neval x n y"
       and "n = Suc 0"
    thus "x â† y"
    by(induct rule: neval.induct, auto elim: neval_ZeroE)
  qed
  with a show "x â† y" by simp
  next
  assume "x â† y"
  thus "neval x (Suc 0) y"
    by(force intro: neval.intros)
qed

fun 
  lc_set_var :: "(_, _, _) LocalConf â‡’ 'Var â‡’ 'Val â‡’ (_, _, _) LocalConf"
where
  "lc_set_var (c, mem) x v = (c, mem (x := v))"

fun 
  meval_sched :: "nat list â‡’ ('Com, 'Var, 'Val) GlobalConf â‡’ (_, _, _) GlobalConf â‡’ bool"
where
  "meval_sched [] c c' = (c = c')" |
  "meval_sched (n#ns) c c' = (âˆƒ c''.  c â†â‡˜nâ‡™ c'' âˆ§ meval_sched ns c'' c')"

abbreviation
  meval_sched_abv :: "(_,_,_) GlobalConf â‡’ nat list â‡’ (_,_,_) GlobalConf â‡’ bool" ("_ â†’â‡˜_â‡™ _" 70)
where
  "c â†’â‡˜nsâ‡™ c' â‰¡ meval_sched ns c c'"

lemma meval_sched_det:
  "meval_sched ns c c' âŸ¹ meval_sched ns c c'' âŸ¹ c' = c''"
  apply(induct ns arbitrary: c)
   apply(auto dest: deterministic)
  done

subsection â€¹Low-equivalence and Strong Low Bisimulationsâ€º

(* Low-equality between memory states: *)
definition 
  low_eq :: "('Var, 'Val) Mem â‡’ (_, _) Mem â‡’ bool" (infixl "=â‡§l" 80)
where
  "memâ‡©1 =â‡§l memâ‡©2 â‰¡ (âˆ€ x. dma memâ‡©1 x = Low âŸ¶ memâ‡©1 x = memâ‡©2 x)"


(* Low-equality modulo a given mode state: *)
definition 
  low_mds_eq :: "'Var Mds â‡’ ('Var, 'Val) Mem â‡’ (_, _) Mem â‡’ bool"
  ("_ =Ä±â‡§l _" [100, 100] 80)
where
  "(memâ‡©1 =â‡˜mdsâ‡™â‡§l memâ‡©2) â‰¡ (âˆ€ x. dma memâ‡©1 x = Low âˆ§ (x âˆˆ ğ’ âˆ¨ x âˆ‰ mds AsmNoReadOrWrite) âŸ¶ memâ‡©1 x = memâ‡©2 x)"

lemma low_eq_low_mds_eq:
  "(memâ‡©1 =â‡§l memâ‡©2) = (memâ‡©1 =â‡˜(Î»m. {})â‡™â‡§l memâ‡©2)"
  by(simp add: low_eq_def low_mds_eq_def)

lemma low_mds_eq_dma:
  "(memâ‡©1 =â‡˜mdsâ‡™â‡§l memâ‡©2) âŸ¹ dma memâ‡©1 = dma memâ‡©2"
  apply(rule dma_ğ’)
  apply(simp add: low_mds_eq_def ğ’_Low)
  done

lemma low_mds_eq_sym:
  "(memâ‡©1 =â‡˜mdsâ‡™â‡§l memâ‡©2) âŸ¹ (memâ‡©2 =â‡˜mdsâ‡™â‡§l memâ‡©1)"
  apply(frule low_mds_eq_dma)
  apply(simp add: low_mds_eq_def)
  done

lemma low_eq_sym:
  "(memâ‡©1 =â‡§l memâ‡©2) âŸ¹ (memâ‡©2 =â‡§l memâ‡©1)"
  apply(simp add: low_eq_low_mds_eq low_mds_eq_sym)
  done

lemma [simp]: "mem =â‡§l mem' âŸ¹ mem =â‡˜mdsâ‡™â‡§l mem'"
  by (simp add: low_mds_eq_def low_eq_def)

lemma [simp]: "(âˆ€ mds. mem =â‡˜mdsâ‡™â‡§l mem') âŸ¹ mem =â‡§l mem'"
  by (auto simp: low_mds_eq_def low_eq_def)

lemma High_not_in_ğ’ [simp]:
  "dma memâ‡©1 x = High âŸ¹ x âˆ‰ ğ’"
  apply(case_tac "x âˆˆ ğ’")
  by(simp add: ğ’_Low)

(* Closedness under globally consistent changes: *)
definition 
  closed_glob_consistent :: "(('Com, 'Var, 'Val) LocalConf) rel â‡’ bool"
where
  "closed_glob_consistent â„› =
  (âˆ€ câ‡©1 mds memâ‡©1 câ‡©2 memâ‡©2. (âŸ¨ câ‡©1, mds, memâ‡©1 âŸ©, âŸ¨ câ‡©2, mds, memâ‡©2 âŸ©) âˆˆ â„› âŸ¶
   (âˆ€ A. ((âˆ€x. case A x of Some (v,v') â‡’ (memâ‡©1 x â‰  v âˆ¨ memâ‡©2 x â‰  v') âŸ¶ Â¬ var_asm_not_written mds x | _ â‡’ True) âˆ§
          (âˆ€x. dma (memâ‡©1 [âˆ¥â‡©1 A]) x â‰  dma memâ‡©1 x âŸ¶ Â¬ var_asm_not_written mds x) âˆ§
          (âˆ€x. dma (memâ‡©1 [âˆ¥â‡©1 A]) x = Low âˆ§ (x âˆ‰ mds AsmNoReadOrWrite âˆ¨ x âˆˆ ğ’) âŸ¶ (memâ‡©1 [âˆ¥â‡©1 A]) x = (memâ‡©2 [âˆ¥â‡©2 A]) x)) âŸ¶
         (âŸ¨ câ‡©1, mds, memâ‡©1[âˆ¥â‡©1 A] âŸ©, âŸ¨ câ‡©2, mds, memâ‡©2[âˆ¥â‡©2 A] âŸ©) âˆˆ â„›))"

(* Strong low bisimulations modulo modes: *)
definition 
  strong_low_bisim_mm :: "(('Com, 'Var, 'Val) LocalConf) rel â‡’ bool"
where
  "strong_low_bisim_mm â„› â‰¡
  sym â„› âˆ§
  closed_glob_consistent â„› âˆ§
  (âˆ€ câ‡©1 mds memâ‡©1 câ‡©2 memâ‡©2. (âŸ¨ câ‡©1, mds, memâ‡©1 âŸ©, âŸ¨ câ‡©2, mds, memâ‡©2 âŸ©) âˆˆ â„› âŸ¶
   (memâ‡©1 =â‡˜mdsâ‡™â‡§l memâ‡©2) âˆ§
   (âˆ€ câ‡©1' mds' memâ‡©1'. âŸ¨ câ‡©1, mds, memâ‡©1 âŸ© â† âŸ¨ câ‡©1', mds', memâ‡©1' âŸ© âŸ¶
    (âˆƒ câ‡©2' memâ‡©2'. âŸ¨ câ‡©2, mds, memâ‡©2 âŸ© â† âŸ¨ câ‡©2', mds', memâ‡©2' âŸ© âˆ§
                  (âŸ¨ câ‡©1', mds', memâ‡©1' âŸ©, âŸ¨ câ‡©2', mds', memâ‡©2' âŸ©) âˆˆ â„›)))"

inductive_set mm_equiv :: "(('Com, 'Var, 'Val) LocalConf) rel"
  and mm_equiv_abv :: "('Com, 'Var, 'Val) LocalConf â‡’ 
  ('Com, 'Var, 'Val) LocalConf â‡’ bool" (infix "â‰ˆ" 60)
where
  "mm_equiv_abv x y â‰¡ (x, y) âˆˆ mm_equiv" |
  mm_equiv_intro [iff]: "âŸ¦ strong_low_bisim_mm â„› ; (lcâ‡©1, lcâ‡©2) âˆˆ â„› âŸ§ âŸ¹ (lcâ‡©1, lcâ‡©2) âˆˆ mm_equiv"

inductive_cases mm_equiv_elim [elim]: "âŸ¨ câ‡©1, mds, memâ‡©1 âŸ© â‰ˆ âŸ¨ câ‡©2, mds, memâ‡©2 âŸ©"

definition low_indistinguishable :: "'Var Mds â‡’ 'Com â‡’ 'Com â‡’ bool"
  ("_ âˆ¼Ä± _" [100, 100] 80)
where 
  "câ‡©1 âˆ¼â‡˜mdsâ‡™ câ‡©2 = (âˆ€ memâ‡©1 memâ‡©2. memâ‡©1 =â‡˜mdsâ‡™â‡§l memâ‡©2 âŸ¶ âŸ¨ câ‡©1, mds, memâ‡©1 âŸ© â‰ˆ âŸ¨ câ‡©2, mds, memâ‡©2 âŸ©)"

subsection â€¹SIFUM-Securityâ€º

(* SIFUM-security for commands: *)
definition 
  com_sifum_secure :: "'Com Ã— 'Var Mds â‡’ bool"
where 
  "com_sifum_secure cmd â‰¡ case cmd of (c,mdsâ‡©s) â‡’ c âˆ¼â‡˜mdsâ‡©sâ‡™ c"

(* Continuous SIFUM-security 
   (where we don't care about whether the prog has any assumptions at termination *)
definition 
  prog_sifum_secure_cont :: "('Com Ã— 'Var Mds) list â‡’ bool"
where "prog_sifum_secure_cont cmds =
   (âˆ€ memâ‡©1 memâ‡©2. INIT memâ‡©1 âˆ§ INIT memâ‡©2 âˆ§ memâ‡©1 =â‡§l memâ‡©2 âŸ¶
    (âˆ€ sched cmsâ‡©1' memâ‡©1'.
     (cmds, memâ‡©1) â†’â‡˜schedâ‡™ (cmsâ‡©1', memâ‡©1') âŸ¶
      (âˆƒ cmsâ‡©2' memâ‡©2'. (cmds, memâ‡©2) â†’â‡˜schedâ‡™ (cmsâ‡©2', memâ‡©2') âˆ§
                      map snd cmsâ‡©1' = map snd cmsâ‡©2' âˆ§
                      length cmsâ‡©2' = length cmsâ‡©1' âˆ§
                      (âˆ€ x. dma memâ‡©1' x = Low âˆ§ (x âˆˆ ğ’ âˆ¨ (âˆ€ i < length cmsâ‡©1'.
                        x âˆ‰ snd (cmsâ‡©1' ! i) AsmNoReadOrWrite)) âŸ¶ memâ‡©1' x = memâ‡©2' x))))"

(* Note that it is equivalent to the following because the 
   programming language is deterministic *)
lemma prog_sifum_secure_cont_def2:
  "prog_sifum_secure_cont cmds â‰¡
   (âˆ€ memâ‡©1 memâ‡©2. INIT memâ‡©1 âˆ§ INIT memâ‡©2 âˆ§ memâ‡©1 =â‡§l memâ‡©2 âŸ¶
    (âˆ€ sched cmsâ‡©1' memâ‡©1'.
     (cmds, memâ‡©1) â†’â‡˜schedâ‡™ (cmsâ‡©1', memâ‡©1') âŸ¶
      (âˆƒ cmsâ‡©2' memâ‡©2'. (cmds, memâ‡©2) â†’â‡˜schedâ‡™ (cmsâ‡©2', memâ‡©2')) âˆ§
      (âˆ€ cmsâ‡©2' memâ‡©2'. (cmds, memâ‡©2) â†’â‡˜schedâ‡™ (cmsâ‡©2', memâ‡©2') âŸ¶
                      map snd cmsâ‡©1' = map snd cmsâ‡©2' âˆ§
                      length cmsâ‡©2' = length cmsâ‡©1' âˆ§
                      (âˆ€ x. dma memâ‡©1' x = Low âˆ§ (x âˆˆ ğ’ âˆ¨ (âˆ€ i < length cmsâ‡©1'.
                        x âˆ‰ snd (cmsâ‡©1' ! i) AsmNoReadOrWrite)) âŸ¶ memâ‡©1' x = memâ‡©2' x))))"
  apply(rule eq_reflection)
  unfolding prog_sifum_secure_cont_def
  apply(rule iffI)
   apply(blast dest: meval_sched_det)
  by fastforce

subsection â€¹Sound Mode Useâ€º


(* Suggestive notation for substitution / function application *)
definition 
  subst :: "('a â‡€ 'b) â‡’ ('a â‡’ 'b) â‡’ ('a â‡’ 'b)"
where
  "subst f mem = (Î» x. case f x of
                         None â‡’ mem x |
                         Some v â‡’ v)"

abbreviation 
  subst_abv :: "('a â‡’ 'b) â‡’ ('a â‡€ 'b) â‡’ ('a â‡’ 'b)" ("_ [â†¦_]" [900, 0] 1000)
where
  "f [â†¦ Ïƒ] â‰¡ subst Ïƒ f"

lemma subst_not_in_dom : "âŸ¦ x âˆ‰ dom Ïƒ âŸ§ âŸ¹ mem [â†¦ Ïƒ] x = mem x"
  by (simp add: domIff subst_def)

(* Toby: we restrict not reading to also imply not modifying a variable.
         This is done mostly to simplify part of the reasoning in the
         Compositionality theory, but also because reconciling doesnt_read_or_modify
         forcing also not reading the variable's classification in the case
         in the case where it would allow non-reading modifications proved
         to get too unwieldy *)
definition 
  doesnt_read_or_modify_vars :: "'Com â‡’ 'Var set â‡’ bool"
where
  "doesnt_read_or_modify_vars c X = (âˆ€ mds mem c' mds' mem'.
  âŸ¨ c, mds, mem âŸ© â† âŸ¨ c', mds', mem' âŸ© âŸ¶
  ((âˆ€xâˆˆX. (âˆ€ v. âŸ¨ c, mds, mem (x := v) âŸ© â† âŸ¨ c', mds', mem' (x := v) âŸ©))))"

definition
  vars_ğ’ :: "'Var set â‡’ 'Var set"
where
  "vars_ğ’ X â‰¡ â‹ƒxâˆˆX. ğ’_vars x"

lemma vars_ğ’_subset_ğ’:
  "vars_ğ’ X âŠ† ğ’"
  by(auto simp: ğ’_def vars_ğ’_def)

(* Toby: doesnt_read_or_modify now implies that the classification is not read too *)
definition 
  doesnt_read_or_modify :: "'Com â‡’ 'Var â‡’ bool"
where
  "doesnt_read_or_modify c x â‰¡ doesnt_read_or_modify_vars c ({x} âˆª ğ’_vars x)"

definition 
  doesnt_modify :: "'Com â‡’ 'Var â‡’ bool"
where
  "doesnt_modify c x = (âˆ€ mds mem c' mds' mem'. (âŸ¨ c, mds, mem âŸ© â† âŸ¨ c', mds', mem' âŸ©) âŸ¶
                        mem x = mem' x âˆ§  dma mem x = dma mem' x)"

lemma noread_nowrite:
  assumes step: "âŸ¨c, mds, memâŸ© â† âŸ¨c', mds', mem'âŸ©"
  assumes noread: "(â‹€v. âŸ¨c, mds, mem(x := v)âŸ© â† âŸ¨c', mds', mem'(x := v)âŸ©)"
  shows "mem x = mem' x"
proof -
  from noread have "âŸ¨c, mds, mem(x := (mem x))âŸ© â† âŸ¨c', mds', mem'(x := (mem x))âŸ©"
    by blast
  hence "âŸ¨c, mds, memâŸ© â† âŸ¨c', mds', mem'(x := (mem x))âŸ©" by simp
  from step this have "mem' = mem'(x := (mem x))" by (blast dest: deterministic)
  hence "mem' x = (mem'(x := (mem x))) x" by(rule arg_cong)
  thus ?thesis by simp
qed

(* Toby: not sure whether this implication should just be made explicit in the
         definition of doesnt_read_or_modify or not *)
lemma doesnt_read_or_modify_doesnt_modify:
  "doesnt_read_or_modify c x âŸ¹ doesnt_modify c x"
  by(fastforce simp: doesnt_modify_def doesnt_read_or_modify_def doesnt_read_or_modify_vars_def 
               intro: noread_nowrite dma_ğ’_vars)

(* Local reachability of local configurations: *)
inductive_set 
  loc_reach :: "('Com, 'Var, 'Val) LocalConf â‡’ ('Com, 'Var, 'Val) LocalConf set"
  for lc :: "(_, _, _) LocalConf"
where
  refl : "âŸ¨fst (fst lc), snd (fst lc), snd lcâŸ© âˆˆ loc_reach lc" |
  step : "âŸ¦ âŸ¨c', mds', mem'âŸ© âˆˆ loc_reach lc;
            âŸ¨c', mds', mem'âŸ© â† âŸ¨c'', mds'', mem''âŸ© âŸ§ âŸ¹
          âŸ¨c'', mds'', mem''âŸ© âˆˆ loc_reach lc" |
  mem_diff : "âŸ¦ âŸ¨ c', mds', mem' âŸ© âˆˆ loc_reach lc;
                (âˆ€ x. var_asm_not_written mds' x âŸ¶ mem' x = mem'' x âˆ§ dma mem' x = dma mem'' x) âŸ§ âŸ¹
              âŸ¨ c', mds', mem'' âŸ© âˆˆ loc_reach lc"

lemma neval_loc_reach:
  "neval lc' n lc'' âŸ¹ lc' âˆˆ loc_reach lc âŸ¹ lc'' âˆˆ loc_reach lc"
proof(induct rule: neval.induct)
  case (neval_0 x y)
    thus ?case by simp
next
  case (neval_S_n x y n z)
  from â€¹x âˆˆ loc_reach lcâ€º and â€¹x â† yâ€º have "y âˆˆ loc_reach lc" 
    (* TODO: can we get rid of this case_tac nonsense? *)
    apply(case_tac x, rename_tac a b, case_tac a, clarsimp)
    apply(case_tac y, rename_tac c d, case_tac c, clarsimp)
    by(blast intro: loc_reach.step)
  thus ?case
    using neval_S_n(3) by blast
qed
    

definition 
  locally_sound_mode_use :: "(_, _, _) LocalConf â‡’ bool"
where
  "locally_sound_mode_use lc =
  (âˆ€ c' mds' mem'. âŸ¨ c', mds', mem' âŸ© âˆˆ loc_reach lc âŸ¶
    (âˆ€ x. (x âˆˆ mds' GuarNoReadOrWrite âŸ¶ doesnt_read_or_modify c' x) âˆ§
          (x âˆˆ mds' GuarNoWrite âŸ¶ doesnt_modify c' x)))"

(* RobS: The same property, but for an individual evaluation. Note it doesn't rely on mem! *)
definition 
  respects_own_guarantees :: "('Com Ã— 'Var Mds) â‡’ bool"
where
  "respects_own_guarantees cm â‰¡
  (âˆ€ x. (x âˆˆ (snd cm) GuarNoReadOrWrite âŸ¶ doesnt_read_or_modify (fst cm) x) âˆ§
        (x âˆˆ (snd cm) GuarNoWrite âŸ¶ doesnt_modify (fst cm) x))"

lemma locally_sound_mode_use_def2:
  "locally_sound_mode_use lc â‰¡ âˆ€lc' âˆˆ loc_reach lc. respects_own_guarantees (fst lc')"
  apply(rule eq_reflection)
  apply(simp add: locally_sound_mode_use_def respects_own_guarantees_def)
  apply force
  done

lemma locally_sound_respects_guarantees:
  "locally_sound_mode_use (cm, mem) âŸ¹ respects_own_guarantees cm"
  unfolding locally_sound_mode_use_def respects_own_guarantees_def
  by (metis fst_conv loc_reach.refl)

definition 
  compatible_modes :: "('Var Mds) list â‡’ bool"
where
  "compatible_modes mdss = (âˆ€ (i :: nat) x. i < length mdss âŸ¶
    (x âˆˆ (mdss ! i) AsmNoReadOrWrite âŸ¶
     (âˆ€ j < length mdss. j â‰  i âŸ¶ x âˆˆ (mdss ! j) GuarNoReadOrWrite)) âˆ§
    (x âˆˆ (mdss ! i) AsmNoWrite âŸ¶
     (âˆ€ j < length mdss. j â‰  i âŸ¶ x âˆˆ (mdss ! j) GuarNoWrite)))"

definition 
  reachable_mode_states :: "('Com, 'Var, 'Val) GlobalConf â‡’ (('Var Mds) list) set"
where 
  "reachable_mode_states gc â‰¡
     {mdss. (âˆƒ cms' mem' sched. gc â†’â‡˜schedâ‡™ (cms', mem') âˆ§ map snd cms' = mdss)}"

definition 
  globally_sound_mode_use :: "('Com, 'Var, 'Val) GlobalConf â‡’ bool"
where 
  "globally_sound_mode_use gc â‰¡
     (âˆ€ mdss. mdss âˆˆ reachable_mode_states gc âŸ¶ compatible_modes mdss)"

primrec 
  sound_mode_use :: "(_, _, _) GlobalConf â‡’ bool"
where
  "sound_mode_use (cms, mem) =
     (list_all (Î» cm. locally_sound_mode_use (cm, mem)) cms âˆ§
      globally_sound_mode_use (cms, mem))"

(* We now show that mm_equiv itself forms a strong low bisimulation modulo modes: *)
lemma mm_equiv_sym:
  assumes equivalent: "âŸ¨câ‡©1, mdsâ‡©1, memâ‡©1âŸ© â‰ˆ âŸ¨câ‡©2, mdsâ‡©2, memâ‡©2âŸ©"
  shows "âŸ¨câ‡©2, mdsâ‡©2, memâ‡©2âŸ© â‰ˆ âŸ¨câ‡©1, mdsâ‡©1, memâ‡©1âŸ©"
proof -
  from equivalent obtain â„›
    where â„›_bisim: "strong_low_bisim_mm â„› âˆ§ (âŸ¨câ‡©1, mdsâ‡©1, memâ‡©1âŸ©, âŸ¨câ‡©2, mdsâ‡©2, memâ‡©2âŸ©) âˆˆ â„›"
    by (metis mm_equiv.simps)
  hence "sym â„›"
    by (auto simp: strong_low_bisim_mm_def)
  hence "(âŸ¨câ‡©2, mdsâ‡©2, memâ‡©2âŸ©, âŸ¨câ‡©1, mdsâ‡©1, memâ‡©1âŸ©) âˆˆ â„›"
    by (metis â„›_bisim symE)
  thus ?thesis
    by (metis â„›_bisim mm_equiv.intros)
qed

lemma low_indistinguishable_sym: "lc âˆ¼â‡˜mdsâ‡™ lc' âŸ¹ lc' âˆ¼â‡˜mdsâ‡™ lc"
  apply(clarsimp simp: low_indistinguishable_def)
  apply(rule mm_equiv_sym)
  apply(blast dest: low_mds_eq_sym)
  done

lemma mm_equiv_glob_consistent: "closed_glob_consistent mm_equiv"
  unfolding closed_glob_consistent_def
  apply clarify
  apply (erule mm_equiv_elim)
  by (auto simp: strong_low_bisim_mm_def closed_glob_consistent_def)

lemma mm_equiv_strong_low_bisim: "strong_low_bisim_mm mm_equiv"
  unfolding strong_low_bisim_mm_def
proof (auto)
  show "closed_glob_consistent mm_equiv" by (rule mm_equiv_glob_consistent)
next
  fix câ‡©1 mds memâ‡©1 câ‡©2 memâ‡©2 x
  assume "âŸ¨ câ‡©1, mds, memâ‡©1 âŸ© â‰ˆ âŸ¨ câ‡©2, mds, memâ‡©2 âŸ©"
  then obtain â„› where
    "strong_low_bisim_mm â„› âˆ§ (âŸ¨ câ‡©1, mds, memâ‡©1 âŸ©, âŸ¨ câ‡©2, mds, memâ‡©2 âŸ©) âˆˆ â„›"
    by blast
  thus "memâ‡©1 =â‡˜mdsâ‡™â‡§l memâ‡©2" by (auto simp: strong_low_bisim_mm_def)
next
  fix câ‡©1 :: 'Com
  fix mds memâ‡©1 câ‡©2 memâ‡©2 câ‡©1' mds' memâ‡©1'
  let ?lcâ‡©1 = "âŸ¨ câ‡©1, mds, memâ‡©1 âŸ©" and
      ?lcâ‡©1' = "âŸ¨ câ‡©1', mds', memâ‡©1' âŸ©" and
      ?lcâ‡©2 = "âŸ¨ câ‡©2, mds, memâ‡©2 âŸ©"
  assume "?lcâ‡©1 â‰ˆ ?lcâ‡©2"
  then obtain â„› where "strong_low_bisim_mm â„› âˆ§ (?lcâ‡©1, ?lcâ‡©2) âˆˆ â„›"
    by (rule mm_equiv_elim, blast)
  moreover assume "?lcâ‡©1 â† ?lcâ‡©1'"
  ultimately show "âˆƒ câ‡©2' memâ‡©2'. ?lcâ‡©2 â† âŸ¨ câ‡©2', mds', memâ‡©2' âŸ© âˆ§ ?lcâ‡©1' â‰ˆ âŸ¨ câ‡©2', mds', memâ‡©2' âŸ©"
    by (simp add: strong_low_bisim_mm_def mm_equiv_sym, blast)
next
  show "sym mm_equiv"
    by (auto simp: sym_def mm_equiv_sym)
qed

end

end

Theory Compositionality

(*
Title: Value-Dependent SIFUM-Type-Systems
Authors: Toby Murray, Robert Sison, Edward Pierzchalski, Christine Rizkallah
(Based on the SIFUM-Type-Systems AFP entry, whose authors
 are: Sylvia Grewe, Heiko Mantel, Daniel Schoepe)
*)
section â€¹Compositionality Proof for SIFUM-Security Propertyâ€º

theory Compositionality
imports Security
begin

context sifum_security_init
begin

(* Set of variables that differs between two memory states: *)
definition 
  differing_vars :: "('Var, 'Val) Mem â‡’ (_, _) Mem â‡’ 'Var set"
where
  "differing_vars memâ‡©1 memâ‡©2 â‰¡ {x. memâ‡©1 x â‰  memâ‡©2 x}"

definition 
  differing_vars_lists :: "('Var, 'Val) Mem â‡’ (_, _) Mem â‡’ 
                           ((_, _) Mem Ã— (_, _) Mem) list â‡’ nat â‡’ 'Var set"
where
  "differing_vars_lists memâ‡©1 memâ‡©2 mems i â‰¡
     (differing_vars memâ‡©1 (fst (mems ! i)) âˆª differing_vars memâ‡©2 (snd (mems ! i)))"

lemma differing_finite: "finite (differing_vars memâ‡©1 memâ‡©2)"
  by (metis UNIV_def Un_UNIV_left finite_Un finite_memory)

lemma differing_lists_finite: "finite (differing_vars_lists memâ‡©1 memâ‡©2 mems i)"
  by (simp add: differing_finite differing_vars_lists_def)


fun makes_compatible ::
  "('Com, 'Var, 'Val) GlobalConf â‡’
   ('Com, 'Var, 'Val) GlobalConf â‡’
   ((_, _) Mem Ã— (_, _) Mem) list â‡’
  bool"
where
  "makes_compatible (cmsâ‡©1, memâ‡©1) (cmsâ‡©2, memâ‡©2) mems =
  (length cmsâ‡©1 = length cmsâ‡©2 âˆ§ length cmsâ‡©1 = length mems âˆ§
   (âˆ€ i. i < length cmsâ‡©1 âŸ¶
       (âˆ€ Ïƒ. dom Ïƒ = differing_vars_lists memâ‡©1 memâ‡©2 mems i âŸ¶
         (cmsâ‡©1 ! i, (fst (mems ! i)) [â†¦ Ïƒ]) â‰ˆ (cmsâ‡©2 ! i, (snd (mems ! i)) [â†¦ Ïƒ])) âˆ§
       (âˆ€ x. (memâ‡©1 x = memâ‡©2 x âˆ¨ dma memâ‡©1 x = High âˆ¨ x âˆˆ ğ’) âŸ¶
             x âˆ‰ differing_vars_lists memâ‡©1 memâ‡©2 mems i)) âˆ§
    ((length cmsâ‡©1 = 0 âˆ§ memâ‡©1 =â‡§l memâ‡©2) âˆ¨ (âˆ€ x. âˆƒ i. i < length cmsâ‡©1 âˆ§
                                          x âˆ‰ differing_vars_lists memâ‡©1 memâ‡©2 mems i)))"

(* This just restates the previous definition using meta-quantification. This allows
  more readable proof blocks that prove each part separately. *)
lemma makes_compatible_intro [intro]:
  "âŸ¦ length cmsâ‡©1 = length cmsâ‡©2 âˆ§ length cmsâ‡©1 = length mems;
     (â‹€ i Ïƒ. âŸ¦ i < length cmsâ‡©1; dom Ïƒ = differing_vars_lists memâ‡©1 memâ‡©2 mems i âŸ§ âŸ¹
          (cmsâ‡©1 ! i, (fst (mems ! i)) [â†¦ Ïƒ]) â‰ˆ (cmsâ‡©2 ! i, (snd (mems ! i)) [â†¦ Ïƒ]));
     (â‹€ i x. âŸ¦ i < length cmsâ‡©1; memâ‡©1 x = memâ‡©2 x âˆ¨ dma memâ‡©1 x = High âˆ¨ x âˆˆ ğ’ âŸ§ âŸ¹ 
          x âˆ‰ differing_vars_lists memâ‡©1 memâ‡©2 mems i);
     (length cmsâ‡©1 = 0 âˆ§ memâ‡©1 =â‡§l memâ‡©2) âˆ¨
     (âˆ€ x. âˆƒ i. i < length cmsâ‡©1 âˆ§ x âˆ‰ differing_vars_lists memâ‡©1 memâ‡©2 mems i) âŸ§ âŸ¹
  makes_compatible (cmsâ‡©1, memâ‡©1) (cmsâ‡©2, memâ‡©2) mems"
  by auto

(* First, some auxiliary lemmas about makes_compatible: *)
lemma compat_low:
  "âŸ¦ makes_compatible (cmsâ‡©1, memâ‡©1) (cmsâ‡©2, memâ‡©2) mems;
     i < length cmsâ‡©1;
     x âˆˆ differing_vars_lists memâ‡©1 memâ‡©2 mems i âŸ§ âŸ¹ dma memâ‡©1 x = Low"
proof -
  assume "i < length cmsâ‡©1" and *: "x âˆˆ differing_vars_lists memâ‡©1 memâ‡©2 mems i" and
    "makes_compatible (cmsâ‡©1, memâ‡©1) (cmsâ‡©2, memâ‡©2) mems"
  then have
    "(memâ‡©1 x = memâ‡©2 x âˆ¨ dma memâ‡©1 x = High âˆ¨ x âˆˆ ğ’) âŸ¶ x âˆ‰ differing_vars_lists memâ‡©1 memâ‡©2 mems i"
    by (simp add: Let_def, blast)
  with * show "dma memâ‡©1 x = Low"
    by (cases "dma memâ‡©1 x", blast)
qed

lemma compat_different:
  "âŸ¦ makes_compatible (cmsâ‡©1, memâ‡©1) (cmsâ‡©2, memâ‡©2) mems;
     i < length cmsâ‡©1;
     x âˆˆ differing_vars_lists memâ‡©1 memâ‡©2 mems i âŸ§ âŸ¹ memâ‡©1 x â‰  memâ‡©2 x âˆ§ dma memâ‡©1 x = Low âˆ§ x âˆ‰ ğ’"
  by (cases "dma memâ‡©1 x", auto)

lemma sound_modes_no_read :
  "âŸ¦ sound_mode_use (cms, mem); x âˆˆ (map snd cms ! i) GuarNoReadOrWrite; i < length cms âŸ§ âŸ¹
  doesnt_read_or_modify (fst (cms ! i)) x"
proof -
  fix cms mem x i
  assume sound_modes: "sound_mode_use (cms, mem)" and "i < length cms"
  hence "locally_sound_mode_use (cms ! i, mem)"
    by (auto simp: sound_mode_use_def list_all_length)
  moreover
  assume "x âˆˆ (map snd cms ! i) GuarNoReadOrWrite"
  ultimately show "doesnt_read_or_modify (fst (cms !i)) x"
    apply (simp add: locally_sound_mode_use_def)
    using â€¹i < length cmsâ€º â€¹locally_sound_mode_use (cms ! i, mem)â€º locally_sound_respects_guarantees respects_own_guarantees_def by auto
qed

lemma differing_vars_neg: "x âˆ‰ differing_vars_lists mem1 mem2 mems i âŸ¹
  (fst (mems ! i) x = mem1 x âˆ§ snd (mems ! i) x = mem2 x)"
  by (simp add: differing_vars_lists_def differing_vars_def)

lemma differing_vars_neg_intro:
  "âŸ¦ memâ‡©1 x = fst (mems ! i) x;
  memâ‡©2 x = snd (mems ! i) x âŸ§ âŸ¹ x âˆ‰ differing_vars_lists memâ‡©1 memâ‡©2 mems i"
  by (auto simp: differing_vars_lists_def differing_vars_def)

lemma differing_vars_elim [elim]:
  "x âˆˆ differing_vars_lists memâ‡©1 memâ‡©2 mems i âŸ¹
  (fst (mems ! i) x â‰  memâ‡©1 x) âˆ¨ (snd (mems ! i) x â‰  memâ‡©2 x)"
  by (auto simp: differing_vars_lists_def differing_vars_def)

lemma makes_compatible_dma_eq:
  assumes compat: "makes_compatible (cmsâ‡©1, memâ‡©1) (cmsâ‡©2, memâ‡©2) mems"
  assumes ile: "i < length cmsâ‡©1"
  assumes domÏƒ: "dom Ïƒ = differing_vars_lists memâ‡©1 memâ‡©2 mems i"
  shows "dma ((fst (mems ! i)) [â†¦ Ïƒ]) = dma memâ‡©1"
proof(rule dma_ğ’, clarify)
  fix x
  assume "x âˆˆ ğ’"
  with compat ile have notin_diff: "x âˆ‰ differing_vars_lists memâ‡©1 memâ‡©2 mems i"
    by simp
  hence "x âˆ‰ dom Ïƒ"
    by(metis domÏƒ)
  hence "(fst (mems ! i) [â†¦ Ïƒ]) x = (fst (mems ! i)) x"
    by(metis subst_not_in_dom)
  moreover have "(fst (mems ! i)) x = memâ‡©1 x"
    using notin_diff differing_vars_neg by metis
  ultimately show "(fst (mems ! i) [â†¦ Ïƒ]) x = memâ‡©1 x" by simp
qed

lemma compat_different_vars:
  "âŸ¦ fst (mems ! i) x = snd (mems ! i) x;
     x âˆ‰ differing_vars_lists memâ‡©1 memâ‡©2 mems i âŸ§ âŸ¹
    memâ‡©1 x = memâ‡©2 x"
proof -
  assume "x âˆ‰ differing_vars_lists memâ‡©1 memâ‡©2 mems i"
  hence "fst (mems ! i) x = memâ‡©1 x âˆ§ snd (mems ! i) x = memâ‡©2 x"
    by (simp add: differing_vars_lists_def differing_vars_def)
  moreover assume "fst (mems ! i) x = snd (mems ! i) x"
  ultimately show "memâ‡©1 x = memâ‡©2 x" by auto
qed

lemma differing_vars_subst [rule_format]:
  assumes domÏƒ: "dom Ïƒ âŠ‡ differing_vars memâ‡©1 memâ‡©2"
  shows "memâ‡©1 [â†¦ Ïƒ] = memâ‡©2 [â†¦ Ïƒ]"
proof (rule ext)
  fix x
  from domÏƒ show "memâ‡©1 [â†¦ Ïƒ] x = memâ‡©2 [â†¦ Ïƒ] x"
    unfolding subst_def differing_vars_def
    by (cases "Ïƒ x", auto)
qed

lemma mm_equiv_low_eq:
  "âŸ¦ âŸ¨ câ‡©1, mds, memâ‡©1 âŸ© â‰ˆ âŸ¨ câ‡©2, mds, memâ‡©2 âŸ© âŸ§ âŸ¹ memâ‡©1 =â‡˜mdsâ‡™â‡§l memâ‡©2"
  unfolding mm_equiv.simps strong_low_bisim_mm_def
  by fast

lemma globally_sound_modes_compatible:
  "âŸ¦ globally_sound_mode_use (cms, mem) âŸ§ âŸ¹ compatible_modes (map snd cms)"
  apply (simp add: globally_sound_mode_use_def reachable_mode_states_def)
  using meval_sched.simps(1) by blast

(* map snd cms1 = map snd cms2 states that both global configurations use the same modes *)
lemma compatible_different_no_read :
  assumes sound_modes: "sound_mode_use (cmsâ‡©1, memâ‡©1)"
                       "sound_mode_use (cmsâ‡©2, memâ‡©2)"
  assumes compat: "makes_compatible (cmsâ‡©1, memâ‡©1) (cmsâ‡©2, memâ‡©2) mems"
  assumes modes_eq: "map snd cmsâ‡©1 = map snd cmsâ‡©2"
  assumes ile: "i < length cmsâ‡©1"
  assumes x: "x âˆˆ differing_vars_lists memâ‡©1 memâ‡©2 mems i"
  shows "doesnt_read_or_modify (fst (cmsâ‡©1 ! i)) x âˆ§ doesnt_read_or_modify (fst (cmsâ‡©2 ! i)) x"
proof -
  from compat have len: "length cmsâ‡©1 = length cmsâ‡©2"
    by simp

  let ?Xâ‡©i = "differing_vars_lists memâ‡©1 memâ‡©2 mems i"

  from compat ile x have a: "dma memâ‡©1 x = Low"
    by (metis compat_low)

  from compat ile x have b: "memâ‡©1 x â‰  memâ‡©2 x"
    by (metis compat_different)

  from compat ile x have not_in_ğ’: "x âˆ‰ ğ’"
    by (metis compat_different)

  with a and compat ile x obtain j where
    jprop: "j < length cmsâ‡©1 âˆ§ x âˆ‰ differing_vars_lists memâ‡©1 memâ‡©2 mems j"
    by fastforce

  let ?Xâ‡©j = "differing_vars_lists memâ‡©1 memâ‡©2 mems j"
  obtain Ïƒ :: "'Var â‡€ 'Val" where domÏƒ: "dom Ïƒ = ?Xâ‡©j"
  proof
    let ?Ïƒ = "Î» x. if (x âˆˆ ?Xâ‡©j) then Some some_val else None"
    show "dom ?Ïƒ = ?Xâ‡©j" unfolding dom_def by auto
  qed
  let ?mdss = "map snd cmsâ‡©1" and
      ?memsâ‡©1j = "fst (mems ! j)" and
      ?memsâ‡©2j = "snd (mems ! j)"

  from jprop domÏƒ have subst_eq:
  "?memsâ‡©1j [â†¦ Ïƒ] x = ?memsâ‡©1j x âˆ§ ?memsâ‡©2j [â†¦ Ïƒ] x = ?memsâ‡©2j x"
  by (metis subst_not_in_dom)

  from compat jprop domÏƒ
  have "(cmsâ‡©1 ! j, ?memsâ‡©1j [â†¦ Ïƒ]) â‰ˆ (cmsâ‡©2 ! j, ?memsâ‡©2j [â†¦ Ïƒ])"
    by (auto simp: Let_def)

  hence low_eq: "?memsâ‡©1j [â†¦ Ïƒ] =â‡˜?mdss ! jâ‡™â‡§l ?memsâ‡©2j [â†¦ Ïƒ]" using modes_eq
    by (metis (no_types) jprop len mm_equiv_low_eq nth_map surjective_pairing)

  with jprop and b have "x âˆˆ (?mdss ! j) AsmNoReadOrWrite"
  proof -
    { assume "x âˆ‰ (?mdss ! j) AsmNoReadOrWrite"
      then have mems_eq: "?memsâ‡©1j x = ?memsâ‡©2j x"
        using â€¹dma memâ‡©1 x = Lowâ€º low_eq subst_eq
        makes_compatible_dma_eq[OF compat jprop[THEN conjunct1] domÏƒ]
        low_mds_eq_def 
        by (metis (poly_guards_query))

      hence "memâ‡©1 x = memâ‡©2 x"
        by (metis compat_different_vars jprop)

      hence False by (metis b)
    }
    thus ?thesis by metis
  qed

  hence "x âˆˆ (?mdss ! i) GuarNoReadOrWrite"
    using sound_modes jprop
    by (metis compatible_modes_def globally_sound_modes_compatible
      length_map sound_mode_use.simps x ile)

  thus "doesnt_read_or_modify (fst (cmsâ‡©1 ! i)) x âˆ§ doesnt_read_or_modify (fst (cmsâ‡©2 ! i)) x" using sound_modes ile
    by (metis len modes_eq sound_modes_no_read)
qed

definition
  vars_and_ğ’ :: "'Var set â‡’ 'Var set"
where
  "vars_and_ğ’ X â‰¡ X âˆª vars_ğ’ X"

(* Toby: most of the complexity drops out as doesnt_read_or_modify now implies doesnt_modify *)
fun change_respecting ::
  "('Com, 'Var, 'Val) LocalConf â‡’
   ('Com, 'Var, 'Val) LocalConf â‡’
   'Var set â‡’ bool"
  where "change_respecting (cms, mem) (cms', mem') X =
      ((cms, mem) â† (cms', mem') âˆ§
       (âˆ€ Ïƒ. dom Ïƒ = vars_and_ğ’ X âŸ¶ (cms, mem [â†¦ Ïƒ]) â† (cms', mem' [â†¦ Ïƒ])))"

lemma subst_overrides: "dom Ïƒ = dom Ï„ âŸ¹ mem [â†¦ Ï„] [â†¦ Ïƒ] = mem [â†¦ Ïƒ]"
  unfolding subst_def
  by (metis domIff option.exhaust option.simps(4) option.simps(5))

definition to_partial :: "('a â‡’ 'b) â‡’ ('a â‡€ 'b)"
  where "to_partial f = (Î» x. Some (f x))"

lemma dom_restrict_total: "dom (to_partial f |` X) = X"
  unfolding to_partial_def
  by (metis Int_UNIV_left dom_const dom_restrict)

lemma change_respecting_doesnt_modify':
  assumes eval: "(cms, mem) â† (cms', mem')"
  assumes cr: "âˆ€ f. dom f = Y âŸ¶ (cms, mem [â†¦ f]) â† (cms', mem' [â†¦ f])"
  assumes x_in_dom: "x âˆˆ Y"
  shows "mem x = mem' x"
proof -
  let ?f' = "to_partial mem |` Y"
  have domf': "dom ?f' = Y"
    by (metis dom_restrict_total)

  from this cr have eval': "(cms, mem [â†¦ ?f']) â† (cms', mem' [â†¦ ?f'])"
    by (metis)

  have mem_eq: "mem [â†¦ ?f'] = mem"
  proof
    fix x
    show "mem [â†¦ ?f'] x = mem x"
      unfolding subst_def
      apply (cases "x âˆˆ Y")
       apply (metis option.simps(5) restrict_in to_partial_def)
      by (metis domf' subst_def subst_not_in_dom)
  qed

  then have mem'_eq: "mem' [â†¦ ?f'] = mem'"
    using eval eval' deterministic
    by (metis Pair_inject)

  moreover
  have x_in_dom': "x âˆˆ dom ?f'"
    by (metis x_in_dom dom_restrict_total)
  hence "?f' x = Some (mem x)"
    by (metis restrict_in to_partial_def x_in_dom)
  hence "mem' [â†¦ ?f'] x = mem x"
    using subst_def x_in_dom'
    by (metis option.simps(5))
  thus "mem x = mem' x"
    by (metis mem'_eq)
qed

lemma change_respecting_subset':
  assumes step: "(cms, mem) â† (cms', mem')"
  assumes noread: "(âˆ€ Ïƒ. dom Ïƒ = X âŸ¶ (cms, mem [â†¦ Ïƒ]) â† (cms', mem' [â†¦ Ïƒ]))"
  assumes dom_subset: "dom Ïƒ âŠ† X"
  shows "(cms, mem [â†¦ Ïƒ]) â† (cms', mem' [â†¦ Ïƒ])"
proof -
  define Ïƒâ‡©X where "Ïƒâ‡©X x = (if x âˆˆ X then if x âˆˆ dom Ïƒ then Ïƒ x else Some (mem x) else None)" for x
  have "dom Ïƒâ‡©X = X" using dom_subset by(auto simp: Ïƒâ‡©X_def)

  have "mem [â†¦ Ïƒ] = mem [â†¦ Ïƒâ‡©X]"
    apply(rule ext)
    using dom_subset apply(auto simp: subst_def Ïƒâ‡©X_def split: option.splits)
    done

  moreover have "mem' [â†¦ Ïƒ] = mem' [â†¦ Ïƒâ‡©X]"
    apply(rule ext)
    using dom_subset apply(auto simp: subst_def Ïƒâ‡©X_def split: option.splits simp: change_respecting_doesnt_modify'[OF step noread])
    done

  moreover from noread â€¹dom Ïƒâ‡©X = Xâ€º have "(cms, mem [â†¦ Ïƒâ‡©X]) â† (cms', mem' [â†¦ Ïƒâ‡©X])" by metis
  ultimately show ?thesis by simp
qed
 
lemma change_respecting_subst:
  "change_respecting (cms, mem) (cms', mem') X âŸ¹
       (âˆ€ Ïƒ. dom Ïƒ = X âŸ¶ (cms, mem [â†¦ Ïƒ]) â† (cms', mem' [â†¦ Ïƒ]))"
  unfolding change_respecting.simps vars_and_ğ’_def
  using change_respecting_subset' by blast
 
lemma change_respecting_intro [iff]:
  "âŸ¦ âŸ¨ c, mds, mem âŸ© â† âŸ¨ c', mds', mem' âŸ©;
     â‹€ f. dom f = vars_and_ğ’ X âŸ¹
           (âŸ¨ c, mds, mem [â†¦ f] âŸ© â† âŸ¨ c', mds', mem' [â†¦ f] âŸ©) âŸ§
  âŸ¹ change_respecting âŸ¨c, mds, memâŸ© âŸ¨c', mds', mem'âŸ© X"
  unfolding change_respecting.simps
  by blast

lemma vars_ğ’_mono:
  "X âŠ† Y âŸ¹ vars_ğ’ X âŠ† vars_ğ’ Y"
  by(auto simp: vars_ğ’_def)

lemma vars_ğ’_Un:
  "vars_ğ’ (X âˆª Y) = (vars_ğ’ X âˆª vars_ğ’ Y)"
  by(simp add: vars_ğ’_def)

lemma vars_ğ’_insert:
  "vars_ğ’ (insert x Y) = (vars_ğ’ {x}) âˆª (vars_ğ’ Y)"
  apply(subst insert_is_Un)
  apply(rule vars_ğ’_Un)
  done

lemma vars_ğ’_empty[simp]:
  "vars_ğ’ {} = {}"
  by(simp add: vars_ğ’_def)

lemma ğ’_vars_of_ğ’_vars_empty:
  "x âˆˆ ğ’_vars y âŸ¹ ğ’_vars x = {}"
  apply(drule subsetD[OF ğ’_vars_subset_ğ’])
  apply(erule ğ’_vars_ğ’)
  done

lemma vars_and_ğ’_mono:
  "X âŠ† X' âŸ¹ vars_and_ğ’ X âŠ† vars_and_ğ’ X'"
  apply(unfold vars_and_ğ’_def)
  apply(metis Un_mono vars_ğ’_mono)
  done

lemma ğ’_vars_finite[simp]:
  "finite (ğ’_vars x)"
  apply(rule finite_subset[OF _ finite_memory])
  by blast

lemma finite_dom:
  "finite (dom (Ïƒ::'Var â‡’ 'Val option))"
  by(blast intro: finite_subset[OF _ finite_memory])

lemma doesnt_read_or_modify_subst: 
  assumes noread: "doesnt_read_or_modify c x"
  assumes step: "âŸ¨c, mds, memâŸ© â† âŸ¨c', mds', mem'âŸ©"
  assumes subset: "X âŠ† {x} âˆª ğ’_vars x"
  shows "â‹€ Ïƒ. dom Ïƒ = X âŸ¹ âŸ¨c, mds, mem[â†¦ Ïƒ]âŸ© â† âŸ¨c', mds', mem'[â†¦ Ïƒ]âŸ©"  
proof -
  have "finite X"
    using subset apply(rule finite_subset)
    by simp
  show "â‹€ Ïƒ. dom Ïƒ = X âŸ¹ âŸ¨c, mds, mem[â†¦ Ïƒ]âŸ© â† âŸ¨c', mds', mem'[â†¦ Ïƒ]âŸ©"
    using â€¹finite Xâ€º subset 
  proof(induct "X" rule: finite_subset_induct[where A="{x} âˆª ğ’_vars x"])
    case empty
    thus "âŸ¨c, mds, subst Ïƒ memâŸ© â† âŸ¨c', mds', subst Ïƒ mem'âŸ©"
      using step by(simp add: subst_def)
  next
    case (insert a X)
    show "âŸ¨c, mds, subst Ïƒ memâŸ© â† âŸ¨c', mds', subst Ïƒ mem'âŸ©"
    proof -
      let ?Ïƒâ‡©X = "(Ïƒ |` X)"
      have IHâ‡©X: "âŸ¨c, mds, subst ?Ïƒâ‡©X memâŸ© â† âŸ¨c', mds', subst ?Ïƒâ‡©X mem'âŸ©"
        apply(rule insert(4))
        using insert by (metis dom_restrict inf.absorb2 subset_insertI)
      from insert obtain v where Ïƒa: "Ïƒ a = Some v" by auto
      have r: "â‹€mem. (subst ?Ïƒâ‡©X mem)(a := v) = subst Ïƒ mem"
        apply(rule ext, rename_tac y)
        apply(simp, safe)
         apply(simp add: subst_def Ïƒa)
        using â€¹a âˆ‰ Xâ€º insert apply(auto simp: subst_def split: option.splits simp: restrict_map_def)
        done
      have "âŸ¨c, mds, (subst ?Ïƒâ‡©X mem)(a := v)âŸ© â† âŸ¨c', mds', (subst ?Ïƒâ‡©X mem')(a := v)âŸ©"
        using noread â€¹a âˆˆ {x} âˆª ğ’_vars xâ€º IHâ‡©X
        unfolding doesnt_read_or_modify_def doesnt_read_or_modify_vars_def by metis
      thus ?thesis by(simp add: r)
    qed
  qed
qed

lemma subst_restrict_twice:
  "dom Ïƒ = A âˆª B âŸ¹
   mem [â†¦ (Ïƒ |` A)] [â†¦ (Ïƒ |` B)] = mem [â†¦ Ïƒ]"
  by(fastforce simp: subst_def split: option.splits intro!: ext simp: restrict_map_def)

(* Toby: this proof is now far simpler because change_respecting is *)
lemma noread_exists_change_respecting:
  assumes fin: "finite (X :: 'Var set)"
  assumes eval: "âŸ¨ c, mds, mem âŸ© â† âŸ¨ c', mds', mem' âŸ©"
  assumes noread: "âˆ€ x âˆˆ X. doesnt_read_or_modify c x"
  shows "change_respecting âŸ¨c, mds, memâŸ© âŸ¨c', mds', mem'âŸ© X"
proof -
  let ?lc = "âŸ¨c, mds, memâŸ©" and ?lc' = "âŸ¨c', mds', mem'âŸ©"
  from fin eval noread show "change_respecting âŸ¨c, mds, memâŸ© âŸ¨c', mds', mem'âŸ© X"
  proof (induct "X" arbitrary: mem mem' rule: finite_induct)
    case empty
    have "mem [â†¦ Map.empty] = mem" "mem' [â†¦ Map.empty] = mem'"
      unfolding subst_def
      by auto
    hence "change_respecting âŸ¨c, mds, memâŸ© âŸ¨c', mds', mem'âŸ© {}"
      using empty
      unfolding change_respecting.simps subst_def vars_ğ’_def vars_and_ğ’_def
      by auto
    thus ?case by blast
  next
    case (insert x X)
    then have IH: "change_respecting âŸ¨c, mds, memâŸ© âŸ¨c', mds', mem'âŸ© X"
      by (metis (poly_guards_query) insertCI insert_disjoint(1))
    show "change_respecting âŸ¨c, mds, memâŸ© âŸ¨c', mds', mem'âŸ© (insert x X)"
    proof
      show "âŸ¨c, mds, memâŸ© â† âŸ¨c', mds', mem'âŸ©" using insert by auto
    next
      fix Ïƒ :: "'Var â‡€ 'Val"
      let ?Ïƒâ‡©X = "Ïƒ |` vars_and_ğ’ X"
      let ?Ïƒâ‡©x = "Ïƒ |` ({x} âˆª ğ’_vars x)"
      assume domÏƒ: "dom Ïƒ = vars_and_ğ’ (insert x X)"
      hence "dom ?Ïƒâ‡©X = vars_and_ğ’ X"
        by (metis dom_restrict inf_absorb2 subset_insertI vars_and_ğ’_mono)
      from domÏƒ have domÏƒâ‡©x: "dom ?Ïƒâ‡©x = {x} âˆª ğ’_vars x"
        by(simp add: domÏƒ vars_and_ğ’_def vars_ğ’_def, blast)
      have "dom Ïƒ = vars_and_ğ’ X âˆª ({x} âˆª ğ’_vars x)"
        by(simp add: domÏƒ vars_and_ğ’_def vars_ğ’_def, blast)
      hence substÏƒ: "â‹€ mem. mem [â†¦ ?Ïƒâ‡©X] [â†¦ ?Ïƒâ‡©x] = mem [â†¦ Ïƒ]"
        by(rule subst_restrict_twice)
      from insert have "doesnt_read_or_modify c x" by auto
      moreover from IH have evalâ‡©X: "âŸ¨c, mds, mem [â†¦ ?Ïƒâ‡©X]âŸ© â† âŸ¨c', mds', mem' [â†¦ ?Ïƒâ‡©X]âŸ©"
        using â€¹dom ?Ïƒâ‡©X = vars_and_ğ’ Xâ€º
        unfolding change_respecting.simps
        by auto
      ultimately have "âŸ¨c, mds, mem [â†¦ ?Ïƒâ‡©X] [â†¦ ?Ïƒâ‡©x]âŸ© â† âŸ¨c', mds', mem' [â†¦ ?Ïƒâ‡©X] [â†¦ ?Ïƒâ‡©x]âŸ©"
        using subset_refl domÏƒâ‡©x doesnt_read_or_modify_subst by metis
      thus "âŸ¨c, mds, mem [â†¦ Ïƒ]âŸ© â† âŸ¨c', mds', mem' [â†¦ Ïƒ]âŸ©"
        using substÏƒ by metis 
    qed
  qed
qed


lemma update_nth_eq:
  "âŸ¦ xs = ys; n < length xs âŸ§ âŸ¹ xs = ys [n := xs ! n]"
  by (metis list_update_id)

text â€¹This property is obvious,
  so an unreadable apply-style proof is acceptable here:â€º
lemma mm_equiv_step:
  assumes bisim: "(cmsâ‡©1, memâ‡©1) â‰ˆ (cmsâ‡©2, memâ‡©2)"
  assumes modes_eq: "snd cmsâ‡©1 = snd cmsâ‡©2"
  assumes step: "(cmsâ‡©1, memâ‡©1) â† (cmsâ‡©1', memâ‡©1')"
  shows "âˆƒ câ‡©2' memâ‡©2'. (cmsâ‡©2, memâ‡©2) â† âŸ¨ câ‡©2', snd cmsâ‡©1', memâ‡©2' âŸ© âˆ§
  (cmsâ‡©1', memâ‡©1') â‰ˆ âŸ¨ câ‡©2', snd cmsâ‡©1', memâ‡©2' âŸ©"
  using assms mm_equiv_strong_low_bisim
  unfolding strong_low_bisim_mm_def
  apply auto
  apply (erule_tac x = "fst cmsâ‡©1" in allE)
  apply (erule_tac x = "snd cmsâ‡©1" in allE)
  by (metis surjective_pairing)

lemma change_respecting_doesnt_modify:
  assumes cr: "change_respecting (cms, mem) (cms', mem') X"
  assumes eval: "(cms, mem) â† (cms', mem')"
  assumes x_in_dom: "x âˆˆ X âˆª vars_ğ’ X"
  shows "mem x = mem' x"
  using change_respecting_doesnt_modify'[where Y="X âˆª vars_ğ’ X", OF eval] cr     
        change_respecting.simps vars_and_ğ’_def x_in_dom 
  by metis

lemma change_respecting_doesnt_modify_dma:
  assumes cr: "change_respecting (cms, mem) (cms', mem') X"
  assumes eval: "(cms, mem) â† (cms', mem')"
  assumes x_in_dom: "x âˆˆ X"
  shows "dma mem x = dma mem' x"
proof - 
  have "â‹€y. y âˆˆ ğ’_vars x âŸ¹ mem y = mem' y"
    proof -
    fix y
    assume "y âˆˆ ğ’_vars x"
    hence "y âˆˆ vars_ğ’ X"
      using x_in_dom by(auto simp: vars_ğ’_def)
    thus "mem y = mem' y"
      using cr eval change_respecting_doesnt_modify by blast
    qed
  thus ?thesis by(metis dma_ğ’_vars)
qed

definition restrict_total :: "('a â‡’ 'b) â‡’ 'a set â‡’ 'a â‡€ 'b" (*infix "|'" 60*)
  where "restrict_total f A = to_partial f |` A"

lemma differing_empty_eq:
  "âŸ¦ differing_vars mem mem' = {} âŸ§ âŸ¹ mem = mem'"
  unfolding differing_vars_def
  by auto

lemma adaptation_finite:
  "finite (dom (A::('Var,'Val) adaptation))"
  apply(rule finite_subset[OF _ finite_memory])
  by blast

definition 
  globally_consistent  :: "('Var, 'Val) adaptation â‡’ 'Var Mds â‡’ ('Var,'Val) Mem â‡’ ('Var,'Val) Mem â‡’ bool"
where "globally_consistent A mds memâ‡©1 memâ‡©2 â‰¡ 
  (âˆ€x.  case A x of Some (v,v') â‡’ (memâ‡©1 x â‰  v âˆ¨ memâ‡©2 x â‰  v') âŸ¶ Â¬ var_asm_not_written mds x | _ â‡’ True) âˆ§
        (âˆ€x. dma memâ‡©1 [âˆ¥â‡©1 A] x â‰  dma memâ‡©1 x âŸ¶ Â¬ var_asm_not_written mds x) âˆ§
          (âˆ€x. dma (memâ‡©1 [âˆ¥â‡©1 A]) x = Low âˆ§ (x âˆ‰ mds AsmNoReadOrWrite âˆ¨ x âˆˆ ğ’) âŸ¶ (memâ‡©1 [âˆ¥â‡©1 A]) x = (memâ‡©2 [âˆ¥â‡©2 A]) x)"

lemma globally_consistent_adapt_bisim:
  assumes bisim: "âŸ¨câ‡©1, mds, memâ‡©1âŸ© â‰ˆ âŸ¨câ‡©2, mds, memâ‡©2âŸ©"
  assumes globally_consistent: "globally_consistent A mds memâ‡©1 memâ‡©2"
  shows "âŸ¨câ‡©1, mds, memâ‡©1 [âˆ¥â‡©1 A]âŸ© â‰ˆ âŸ¨câ‡©2, mds, memâ‡©2 [âˆ¥â‡©2 A]âŸ©"
  apply(rule mm_equiv_glob_consistent[simplified closed_glob_consistent_def, rule_format])
   apply(rule bisim)
  apply(fold globally_consistent_def)
  by(rule globally_consistent)

lemma mm_equiv_ğ’_eq: 
  "(a,b) â‰ˆ (a',b') âŸ¹ snd a = snd a' âŸ¹
    âˆ€xâˆˆğ’. b x = b' x"
  apply(case_tac a, case_tac a')
  using mm_equiv_strong_low_bisim[simplified strong_low_bisim_mm_def, rule_format]
  by(auto simp: low_mds_eq_def ğ’_Low)

lemma apply_adaptation_not_in_dom: 
  "x âˆ‰ dom A âŸ¹ apply_adaptation b blah A x = blah x"
  apply(simp add: apply_adaptation_def domIff split: option.splits)
  done

(* This is the central lemma. Unfortunately, I didn't find
   a nice partitioning into several easier lemmas: *)
lemma makes_compatible_invariant:
  assumes sound_modes: "sound_mode_use (cmsâ‡©1, memâ‡©1)"
                      "sound_mode_use (cmsâ‡©2, memâ‡©2)"
  assumes compat: "makes_compatible (cmsâ‡©1, memâ‡©1) (cmsâ‡©2, memâ‡©2) mems"
  assumes modes_eq: "map snd cmsâ‡©1 = map snd cmsâ‡©2"
  assumes eval: "(cmsâ‡©1, memâ‡©1) â†â‡˜kâ‡™ (cmsâ‡©1', memâ‡©1')"
  obtains cmsâ‡©2' memâ‡©2' mems' where
      "map snd cmsâ‡©1' = map snd cmsâ‡©2' âˆ§
       (cmsâ‡©2, memâ‡©2) â†â‡˜kâ‡™ (cmsâ‡©2', memâ‡©2') âˆ§
       makes_compatible (cmsâ‡©1', memâ‡©1') (cmsâ‡©2', memâ‡©2') mems'"
proof -
  let ?X = "Î» i. differing_vars_lists memâ‡©1 memâ‡©2 mems i"
  from sound_modes compat modes_eq have
    a: "âˆ€ i < length cmsâ‡©1. âˆ€ x âˆˆ (?X i). doesnt_read_or_modify (fst (cmsâ‡©1 ! i)) x âˆ§
                                          doesnt_read_or_modify (fst (cmsâ‡©2 ! i)) x"
    by (metis compatible_different_no_read)
  from eval have
    b: "k < length cmsâ‡©1 âˆ§ (cmsâ‡©1 ! k, memâ‡©1) â† (cmsâ‡©1' ! k, memâ‡©1') âˆ§
        cmsâ‡©1' = cmsâ‡©1 [k := cmsâ‡©1' ! k]"
    by (metis meval_elim nth_list_update_eq)

  from modes_eq have equal_size: "length cmsâ‡©1 = length cmsâ‡©2"
    by (metis length_map)

  let ?mdsâ‡©k = "snd (cmsâ‡©1 ! k)" and
      ?mdsâ‡©k' = "snd (cmsâ‡©1' ! k)" and
      ?memsâ‡©1k = "fst (mems ! k)" and
      ?memsâ‡©2k = "snd (mems ! k)" and
      ?n = "length cmsâ‡©1"

  have "finite (?X k)"
    by (metis differing_lists_finite)

  (* Obtaining cms' and memâ‡©2' is not in a proof block, since we
     need some of the following statements later: *)
  then have
    c: "change_respecting (cmsâ‡©1 ! k, memâ‡©1) (cmsâ‡©1' ! k, memâ‡©1') (?X k)"
    using noread_exists_change_respecting b a
    by (metis surjective_pairing)

  from compat have "â‹€ Ïƒ. dom Ïƒ = ?X k âŸ¹ ?memsâ‡©1k [â†¦ Ïƒ] = memâ‡©1 [â†¦ Ïƒ]"
    using differing_vars_subst differing_vars_lists_def
    by (metis Un_upper1 Un_subset_iff)

  hence
    evalâ‡©Ïƒ: "â‹€ Ïƒ. dom Ïƒ = ?X k âŸ¹ (cmsâ‡©1 ! k, ?memsâ‡©1k [â†¦ Ïƒ]) â† (cmsâ‡©1' ! k, memâ‡©1' [â†¦ Ïƒ])"
      by(metis change_respecting_subst[rule_format, where X="?X k"] c)

  moreover
  with b and compat have
    bisimâ‡©Ïƒ: "â‹€ Ïƒ. dom Ïƒ = ?X k âŸ¹ (cmsâ‡©1 ! k, ?memsâ‡©1k [â†¦ Ïƒ]) â‰ˆ (cmsâ‡©2 ! k, ?memsâ‡©2k [â†¦ Ïƒ])"
    by auto

  moreover have "snd (cmsâ‡©1 ! k) = snd (cmsâ‡©2 ! k)"
    by (metis b equal_size modes_eq nth_map)
    
  ultimately have d: "â‹€ Ïƒ. dom Ïƒ = ?X k âŸ¹ âˆƒ câ‡©f' memâ‡©f'.
    (cmsâ‡©2 ! k, ?memsâ‡©2k [â†¦ Ïƒ]) â† âŸ¨ câ‡©f', ?mdsâ‡©k', memâ‡©f' âŸ© âˆ§
    (cmsâ‡©1' ! k, memâ‡©1' [â†¦ Ïƒ]) â‰ˆ âŸ¨ câ‡©f', ?mdsâ‡©k', memâ‡©f' âŸ©"
    by (metis mm_equiv_step)

  obtain h :: "'Var â‡€ 'Val" where domh: "dom h = ?X k"
    by (metis dom_restrict_total)

  then obtain câ‡©h memâ‡©h where h_prop:
    "(cmsâ‡©2 ! k, ?memsâ‡©2k [â†¦ h]) â† âŸ¨ câ‡©h, ?mdsâ‡©k', memâ‡©h âŸ© âˆ§
    (cmsâ‡©1' ! k, memâ‡©1' [â†¦ h]) â‰ˆ âŸ¨ câ‡©h, ?mdsâ‡©k', memâ‡©h âŸ©"
    using d
    by metis

  then have
    "change_respecting (cmsâ‡©2 ! k, ?memsâ‡©2k [â†¦ h]) âŸ¨ câ‡©h, ?mdsâ‡©k', memâ‡©h âŸ© (?X k)"
    using a b noread_exists_change_respecting
    by (metis differing_lists_finite surjective_pairing)

  â€• â€¹The following statements are universally quantified
      since they are reused later:â€º
  with h_prop have
    "âˆ€ Ïƒ. dom Ïƒ = ?X k âŸ¶
      (cmsâ‡©2 ! k, ?memsâ‡©2k [â†¦ h] [â†¦ Ïƒ]) â† âŸ¨ câ‡©h, ?mdsâ‡©k', memâ‡©h [â†¦ Ïƒ] âŸ©"
    by (metis change_respecting_subst)

  with domh have f:
    "âˆ€ Ïƒ. dom Ïƒ = ?X k âŸ¶
      (cmsâ‡©2 ! k, ?memsâ‡©2k [â†¦ Ïƒ]) â† âŸ¨ câ‡©h, ?mdsâ‡©k', memâ‡©h [â†¦ Ïƒ] âŸ©"
    by (auto simp: subst_overrides)

  from d and f have g: "â‹€ Ïƒ. dom Ïƒ = ?X k âŸ¹
    (cmsâ‡©2 ! k, ?memsâ‡©2k [â†¦ Ïƒ]) â† âŸ¨ câ‡©h, ?mdsâ‡©k', memâ‡©h [â†¦ Ïƒ] âŸ© âˆ§
    (cmsâ‡©1' ! k, memâ‡©1' [â†¦ Ïƒ]) â‰ˆ âŸ¨ câ‡©h, ?mdsâ‡©k', memâ‡©h [â†¦ Ïƒ] âŸ©"
    using h_prop
    by (metis deterministic)
  let ?Ïƒ_memâ‡©2 = "to_partial memâ‡©2 |` ?X k"
  define memâ‡©2' where "memâ‡©2' = memâ‡©h [â†¦ ?Ïƒ_memâ‡©2]"
  define câ‡©2' where "câ‡©2' = câ‡©h"

  have domÏƒ_memâ‡©2: "dom ?Ïƒ_memâ‡©2 = ?X k"
    by (metis dom_restrict_total)

  have "memâ‡©2 = ?memsâ‡©2k [â†¦ ?Ïƒ_memâ‡©2]"
  proof (rule ext)
    fix x
    show "memâ‡©2 x = ?memsâ‡©2k [â†¦ ?Ïƒ_memâ‡©2] x"
      using domÏƒ_memâ‡©2
      unfolding to_partial_def subst_def
      apply (cases "x âˆˆ ?X k")
      apply auto
      by (metis differing_vars_neg)
  qed

  with f domÏƒ_memâ‡©2 have i: "(cmsâ‡©2 ! k, memâ‡©2) â† âŸ¨ câ‡©2', ?mdsâ‡©k', memâ‡©2' âŸ©"
    unfolding memâ‡©2'_def câ‡©2'_def
    by metis

  define cmsâ‡©2' where "cmsâ‡©2' = cmsâ‡©2 [k := (câ‡©2', ?mdsâ‡©k')]"

  with i b equal_size have "(cmsâ‡©2, memâ‡©2) â†â‡˜kâ‡™ (cmsâ‡©2', memâ‡©2')"
    by (metis meval_intro)

  moreover
  from equal_size have new_length: "length cmsâ‡©1' = length cmsâ‡©2'"
    unfolding cmsâ‡©2'_def
    by (metis eval length_list_update meval_elim)

  with modes_eq have "map snd cmsâ‡©1' = map snd cmsâ‡©2'"
    unfolding cmsâ‡©2'_def
    by (metis b map_update snd_conv)

  moreover

  â€• â€¹This is the complicated part of the proof.â€º
  obtain mems' where "makes_compatible (cmsâ‡©1', memâ‡©1') (cmsâ‡©2', memâ‡©2') mems'"
  proof
    â€• â€¹This is used in two of the following cases, so we prove it beforehand:â€º
    have x_unchanged: "â‹€ x. âŸ¦ x âˆˆ ?X k âŸ§ âŸ¹
      memâ‡©1 x = memâ‡©1' x âˆ§ memâ‡©2 x = memâ‡©2' x âˆ§ dma memâ‡©1 x = dma memâ‡©1' x"
    proof(intro conjI)
      fix x
      assume "x âˆˆ ?X k"
      thus "memâ‡©1 x = memâ‡©1' x"
        using a b c change_respecting_doesnt_modify domh 
        by (metis (erased, hide_lams) Un_upper1 contra_subsetD)
    next
      fix x
      assume "x âˆˆ ?X k"

      hence eq_memâ‡©2: "?Ïƒ_memâ‡©2 x = Some (memâ‡©2 x)"
        by (metis restrict_in to_partial_def)
      hence "?memsâ‡©2k [â†¦ h] [â†¦ ?Ïƒ_memâ‡©2] x = memâ‡©2 x"
        by (auto simp: subst_def)

      moreover have "memâ‡©h [â†¦ ?Ïƒ_memâ‡©2] x = memâ‡©2 x"
        by (auto simp: subst_def â€¹x âˆˆ ?X kâ€º eq_memâ‡©2)

      ultimately have "?memsâ‡©2k [â†¦ h] [â†¦ ?Ïƒ_memâ‡©2] x = memâ‡©h [â†¦ ?Ïƒ_memâ‡©2] x"
        by auto
      thus "memâ‡©2 x = memâ‡©2' x"
        by (metis â€¹memâ‡©2 = ?memsâ‡©2k [â†¦ ?Ïƒ_memâ‡©2]â€º domÏƒ_memâ‡©2 domh memâ‡©2'_def subst_overrides)
    next
      fix x
      assume "x âˆˆ ?X k"
      thus "dma memâ‡©1 x = dma memâ‡©1' x"
        using a b c change_respecting_doesnt_modify_dma domh 
        by (metis (erased, hide_lams))      
    qed

    define mems'_k where "mems'_k x =
      (if x âˆ‰ ?X k
       then (memâ‡©1' x, memâ‡©2' x)
       else (?memsâ‡©1k x, ?memsâ‡©2k x))" for x

    (* FIXME: see if we can reduce the number of cases *)
    define mems'_i where "mems'_i i x =
      (if ((memâ‡©1 x â‰  memâ‡©1' x âˆ¨ memâ‡©2 x â‰  memâ‡©2' x) âˆ§
          (memâ‡©1' x = memâ‡©2' x âˆ¨ dma memâ‡©1' x = High))
         then (memâ‡©1' x, memâ‡©2' x)
         else if ((memâ‡©1 x â‰  memâ‡©1' x âˆ¨ memâ‡©2 x â‰  memâ‡©2' x) âˆ§
                  (memâ‡©1' x â‰  memâ‡©2' x âˆ§ dma memâ‡©1' x = Low))
              then (some_val, some_val)
              else if dma memâ‡©1 x = High âˆ§ dma memâ‡©1' x = Low then (memâ‡©1 x, memâ‡©1 x)
              else if dma memâ‡©1' x = dma memâ‡©1 x then (fst (mems ! i) x, snd (mems ! i) x)
              else (memâ‡©1' x, memâ‡©2' x))" for i x

    define mems'
      where "mems' =
        map (Î» i.
            if i = k
            then (fst âˆ˜ mems'_k, snd âˆ˜ mems'_k)
            else (fst âˆ˜ mems'_i i, snd âˆ˜ mems'_i i))
      [0..< length cmsâ‡©1]"
    from b have mems'_k_simp: "mems' ! k = (fst âˆ˜ mems'_k, snd âˆ˜ mems'_k)"
      unfolding mems'_def
      by auto

    have mems'_simp2: "â‹€i. âŸ¦ i â‰  k; i < length cmsâ‡©1 âŸ§ âŸ¹
      mems' ! i = (fst âˆ˜ mems'_i i, snd âˆ˜ mems'_i i)"
      unfolding mems'_def
      by auto
    (* Some auxiliary statements to allow reasoning about these definitions as if they were given
       by cases instead of nested if clauses. *)
    have mems'_k_1 [simp]: "â‹€ x. âŸ¦ x âˆ‰ ?X k âŸ§ âŸ¹
      fst (mems' ! k) x = memâ‡©1' x âˆ§ snd (mems' ! k) x = memâ‡©2' x"
      unfolding mems'_k_simp mems'_k_def
      by auto
    have mems'_k_2 [simp]: "â‹€ x. âŸ¦ x âˆˆ ?X k âŸ§ âŸ¹
      fst (mems' ! k) x = fst (mems ! k) x âˆ§ snd (mems' ! k) x = snd (mems ! k) x"
      unfolding mems'_k_simp mems'_k_def
      by auto

    
    have mems'_k_cases:
      "â‹€ P x.
        âŸ¦
         âŸ¦ x âˆ‰ ?X k;
           fst (mems' ! k) x = memâ‡©1' x;
           snd (mems' ! k) x = memâ‡©2' x âŸ§ âŸ¹ P x;
         âŸ¦ x âˆˆ ?X k; 
           fst (mems' ! k) x = fst (mems ! k) x;
           snd (mems' ! k) x = snd (mems ! k) x âŸ§ âŸ¹ P x âŸ§ âŸ¹ P x"
      apply(case_tac "x âˆ‰ ?X k")
       apply simp
      apply simp
      done

    have mems'_i_simp:
      "â‹€ i. âŸ¦ i < length cmsâ‡©1; i â‰  k âŸ§ âŸ¹ mems' ! i = (fst âˆ˜ mems'_i i, snd âˆ˜ mems'_i i)"
      unfolding mems'_def
      by auto

    have mems'_i_1 [simp]:
      "â‹€ i x. âŸ¦ i â‰  k; i < length cmsâ‡©1;
                 memâ‡©1 x â‰  memâ‡©1' x âˆ¨ memâ‡©2 x â‰  memâ‡©2' x;
                 memâ‡©1' x = memâ‡©2' x âˆ¨ dma memâ‡©1' x = High âŸ§ âŸ¹
               fst (mems' ! i) x = memâ‡©1' x âˆ§ snd (mems' ! i) x = memâ‡©2' x"
      unfolding mems'_i_def mems'_i_simp
      by auto

    have mems'_i_2 [simp]:
      "â‹€ i x. âŸ¦ i â‰  k; i < length cmsâ‡©1;
                 memâ‡©1 x â‰  memâ‡©1' x âˆ¨ memâ‡©2 x â‰  memâ‡©2' x;
                 memâ‡©1' x â‰  memâ‡©2' x; dma memâ‡©1' x = Low âŸ§ âŸ¹
              fst (mems' ! i) x = some_val âˆ§ snd (mems' ! i) x = some_val"
      unfolding mems'_i_def mems'_i_simp
      by auto
    have mems'_i_3 [simp]:
      "â‹€ i x. âŸ¦ i â‰  k; i < length cmsâ‡©1;
                 memâ‡©1 x = memâ‡©1' x; memâ‡©2 x = memâ‡©2' x;
                 dma memâ‡©1 x = High âˆ§ dma memâ‡©1' x = Low âŸ§ âŸ¹
              fst (mems' ! i) x = memâ‡©1 x âˆ§ snd (mems' ! i) x = memâ‡©1 x"
      unfolding mems'_i_def mems'_i_simp
      by auto

    have mems'_i_4 [simp]:
      "â‹€ i x. âŸ¦ i â‰  k; i < length cmsâ‡©1;
                 memâ‡©1 x = memâ‡©1' x; memâ‡©2 x = memâ‡©2' x;
                 dma memâ‡©1 x = Low âˆ¨ dma memâ‡©1' x = High;
                 dma memâ‡©1' x = dma memâ‡©1 x âŸ§ âŸ¹
              fst (mems' ! i) x = fst (mems ! i) x âˆ§ snd (mems' ! i) x = snd (mems ! i) x"
      unfolding mems'_i_def mems'_i_simp
      by auto

    have mems'_i_5 [simp]:
      "â‹€ i x. âŸ¦ i â‰  k; i < length cmsâ‡©1;
                 memâ‡©1 x = memâ‡©1' x; memâ‡©2 x = memâ‡©2' x;
                 dma memâ‡©1 x = Low âˆ§ dma memâ‡©1' x = High;
                 dma memâ‡©1' x â‰  dma memâ‡©1 x âŸ§ âŸ¹
              fst (mems' ! i) x = memâ‡©1' x âˆ§ snd (mems' ! i) x = memâ‡©2' x"
      unfolding mems'_i_def mems'_i_simp
      by auto

    (* This may look complicated, but is actually a rather
       mechanical definition, as it merely spells out the cases
       of the definition: *)
    have mems'_i_cases:
      "â‹€ P i x.
         âŸ¦ i â‰  k; i < length cmsâ‡©1;
           âŸ¦ memâ‡©1 x â‰  memâ‡©1' x âˆ¨ memâ‡©2 x â‰  memâ‡©2' x;
             memâ‡©1' x = memâ‡©2' x âˆ¨ dma memâ‡©1' x = High;
             fst (mems' ! i) x = memâ‡©1' x; snd (mems' ! i) x = memâ‡©2' x âŸ§ âŸ¹ P x;
      âŸ¦ memâ‡©1 x â‰  memâ‡©1' x âˆ¨ memâ‡©2 x â‰  memâ‡©2' x;
        memâ‡©1' x â‰   memâ‡©2' x; dma memâ‡©1' x = Low;
        fst (mems' ! i) x = some_val; snd (mems' ! i) x = some_val âŸ§ âŸ¹ P x;
      âŸ¦ memâ‡©1 x = memâ‡©1' x; memâ‡©2 x = memâ‡©2' x; dma memâ‡©1 x = High; 
        dma memâ‡©1' x = Low;
        fst (mems' ! i) x = memâ‡©1 x; snd (mems' ! i) x = memâ‡©1 x âŸ§ âŸ¹ P x;
      âŸ¦ memâ‡©1 x = memâ‡©1' x; memâ‡©2 x = memâ‡©2' x; dma memâ‡©1 x = Low âˆ¨ dma memâ‡©1' x = High;
        dma memâ‡©1' x = dma memâ‡©1 x;
        fst (mems' ! i) x = fst (mems ! i) x; snd (mems' ! i) x = snd (mems ! i) x âŸ§ âŸ¹ P x;
      âŸ¦ memâ‡©1 x = memâ‡©1' x; memâ‡©2 x = memâ‡©2' x; dma memâ‡©1 x = Low; dma memâ‡©1' x = High;
        fst (mems' ! i) x = memâ‡©1' x; snd (mems' ! i) x = memâ‡©2' x âŸ§ âŸ¹ P x       âŸ§
      âŸ¹ P x"
      using mems'_i_1 mems'_i_2 mems'_i_3 mems'_i_4 mems'_i_5
      by (metis (full_types) Sec.exhaust)

    let ?X' = "Î» i. differing_vars_lists memâ‡©1' memâ‡©2' mems' i"

    have len_unchanged: "length cmsâ‡©1' = length cmsâ‡©1"
      by (metis cmsâ‡©2'_def equal_size length_list_update new_length)

    have mm_equiv': "(cmsâ‡©1' ! k, subst (?Ïƒ_memâ‡©2) memâ‡©1') â‰ˆ âŸ¨câ‡©h, snd (cmsâ‡©1' ! k), memâ‡©2'âŸ©"
      apply(simp add: memâ‡©2'_def)
      apply(rule g[THEN conjunct2])
      apply(rule dom_restrict_total)
      done

   hence ğ’_subst_eq: "âˆ€xâˆˆğ’. (subst (?Ïƒ_memâ‡©2) memâ‡©1') x = memâ‡©2' x"
     apply(rule mm_equiv_ğ’_eq)
     by simp

   have low_mds_eq': "(subst (?Ïƒ_memâ‡©2) memâ‡©1') =â‡˜snd (cmsâ‡©1' ! k)â‡™â‡§l memâ‡©2'"
     apply(rule mm_equiv_low_eq[where câ‡©1="fst (cmsâ‡©1' ! k)"])
     apply(force intro: mm_equiv')
     done

   have ğ’_subst_eq_idemp: "â‹€x. x âˆˆ ğ’ âŸ¹ (subst (?Ïƒ_memâ‡©2) memâ‡©1') x = memâ‡©1' x"
     apply(rule subst_not_in_dom)
     apply(rule notI)
     apply(simp add: dom_restrict_total)
     using compat b by force

    from ğ’_subst_eq ğ’_subst_eq_idemp
    have ğ’_eq: "â‹€x. x âˆˆ ğ’ âŸ¹ memâ‡©1' x = memâ‡©2' x"
     by simp

    have not_control: "â‹€x i. i < length cmsâ‡©1' âŸ¹ x âˆˆ ?X' i âŸ¹ x âˆ‰ ğ’"
    proof(rule ccontr, clarsimp)
      fix x i
      let ?memsâ‡©1i = "fst (mems ! i)"
      let ?memsâ‡©2i = "snd (mems ! i)"
      let ?memsâ‡©1'i = "fst (mems' ! i)"
      let ?memsâ‡©2'i = "snd (mems' ! i)"
      assume "i < length cmsâ‡©1'"
      have "i < length cmsâ‡©1" by (metis len_unchanged â€¹i < length cmsâ‡©1'â€º)
      assume "x âˆˆ ?X' i"
      assume "x âˆˆ ğ’"
      have "x âˆ‰ ?X i"
        using compat â€¹i < length cmsâ‡©1'â€º len_unchanged new_length
        by (metis â€¹x âˆˆ ğ’â€º compat_different)
      from â€¹x âˆˆ ğ’â€º have  "memâ‡©1' x = memâ‡©2' x" by(rule ğ’_eq)
      from â€¹x âˆˆ ğ’â€º have "dma memâ‡©1' x = Low" by(simp add: ğ’_Low)
      show "False"
      proof(cases "i = k")
        assume eq[simp]: "i = k"
        show ?thesis
        using â€¹x âˆ‰ ?X iâ€º â€¹x âˆˆ ?X' iâ€º
        by(force simp: differing_vars_lists_def differing_vars_def)
      next
        assume neq: "i â‰  k"
        thus ?thesis
        using â€¹x âˆˆ ?X' iâ€º â€¹x âˆ‰ ?X iâ€º â€¹x âˆˆ ğ’â€º ğ’_Low â€¹memâ‡©1' x = memâ‡©2' xâ€º
        by(force elim: mems'_i_cases[of "i" "x" "Î»x. False", OF _ â€¹i < length cmsâ‡©1â€º]
                 simp: differing_vars_lists_def differing_vars_def)
      qed
    qed

    show "makes_compatible (cmsâ‡©1', memâ‡©1') (cmsâ‡©2', memâ‡©2') mems'"
    proof
      have "length cmsâ‡©1' = length cmsâ‡©1"
        by (metis cmsâ‡©2'_def equal_size length_list_update new_length)
      then show "length cmsâ‡©1' = length cmsâ‡©2' âˆ§ length cmsâ‡©1' = length mems'"
        using compat new_length
        unfolding mems'_def
        by auto
    next
      fix i
      fix Ïƒ :: "'Var â‡€ 'Val"
      let ?memsâ‡©1'i = "fst (mems' ! i)"
      let ?memsâ‡©2'i = "snd (mems' ! i)"
      assume i_le: "i < length cmsâ‡©1'"
      assume domÏƒ: "dom Ïƒ = ?X' i"
      show "(cmsâ‡©1' ! i, (fst (mems' ! i)) [â†¦ Ïƒ]) â‰ˆ (cmsâ‡©2' ! i, (snd (mems' ! i)) [â†¦ Ïƒ])"
      proof (cases "i = k")
        assume [simp]: "i = k"
        â€• â€¹We define another  function from this and reuse the universally quantified statements
          from the first part of the proof.â€º
        define Ïƒ' where "Ïƒ' x =
           (if x âˆˆ ?X k
            then if x âˆˆ ?X' k
                 then Ïƒ x
                 else Some (memâ‡©1' x)
            else None)" for x
        have domÏƒ': "dom Ïƒ' = ?X k"
          using Ïƒ'_def [abs_def]
          apply (clarsimp, safe)
          by( metis domI domIff, metis â€¹i = kâ€º domD domÏƒ )
        have diff_vars_impl [simp]: "â‹€x. x âˆˆ ?X' k âŸ¹ x âˆˆ ?X k"
        proof (rule ccontr)
          fix x
          assume "x âˆ‰ ?X k"
          hence "memâ‡©1 x = ?memsâ‡©1k x âˆ§ memâ‡©2 x = ?memsâ‡©2k x"
            by (metis differing_vars_neg)
          from â€¹x âˆ‰ ?X kâ€º have "?memsâ‡©1'i x = memâ‡©1' x âˆ§ ?memsâ‡©2'i x = memâ‡©2' x"
            by auto
          moreover
          assume "x âˆˆ ?X' k"
          hence "memâ‡©1' x â‰  ?memsâ‡©1'i x âˆ¨ memâ‡©2' x â‰  ?memsâ‡©2'i x"
            by (metis â€¹i = kâ€º differing_vars_elim)
          ultimately show False
            by auto
        qed

        (* We now show that we can reuse the earlier statements
           by showing the following equality: *)
        have "?memsâ‡©1'i [â†¦ Ïƒ] = memâ‡©1' [â†¦ Ïƒ']"
        proof (rule ext)
          fix x

          show "?memsâ‡©1'i [â†¦ Ïƒ] x = memâ‡©1' [â†¦ Ïƒ'] x"
          proof (cases "x âˆˆ ?X' k")
            assume x_in_X'k: "x âˆˆ ?X' k"

            then obtain v where "Ïƒ x = Some v"
              by (metis domÏƒ domD â€¹i = kâ€º)
            hence "?memsâ‡©1'i [â†¦ Ïƒ] x = v"
              using â€¹x âˆˆ ?X' kâ€º domÏƒ
              by (auto simp: subst_def)
            moreover
            from domÏƒ' and â€¹x âˆˆ ?X' kâ€º have "x âˆˆ dom Ïƒ'" by simp
             
            hence "memâ‡©1' [â†¦ Ïƒ'] x = v"
              using domÏƒ' 
              unfolding subst_def
              by (metis Ïƒ'_def â€¹Ïƒ x = Some vâ€º diff_vars_impl option.simps(5) x_in_X'k)

            ultimately show "?memsâ‡©1'i [â†¦ Ïƒ] x = memâ‡©1' [â†¦ Ïƒ'] x" ..
          next
            assume "x âˆ‰ ?X' k"

            hence "?memsâ‡©1'i [â†¦ Ïƒ] x = ?memsâ‡©1'i x"
              using domÏƒ
              by (metis â€¹i = kâ€º subst_not_in_dom)
            show ?thesis
            proof(case_tac "x âˆˆ ?X k")
              assume "x âˆˆ ?X k"
              from â€¹x âˆ‰ ?X' kâ€º have "memâ‡©1' x = ?memsâ‡©1'i x"
                by(metis differing_vars_neg â€¹i = kâ€º)
              then have "Ïƒ' x = Some (?memsâ‡©1'i x)"
                unfolding Ïƒ'_def
                using domÏƒ' domh
                by(simp add: â€¹x âˆˆ ?X kâ€º â€¹x âˆ‰ ?X' kâ€º)
              hence "memâ‡©1' [â†¦ Ïƒ'] x = ?memsâ‡©1'i x"
                unfolding subst_def
                by (metis option.simps(5))
              thus ?thesis
                by (metis â€¹?memsâ‡©1'i [â†¦Ïƒ] x = ?memsâ‡©1'i xâ€º)
            next
              assume "x âˆ‰ ?X k"
              then have "memâ‡©1' [â†¦ Ïƒ'] x = memâ‡©1' x"
                by (metis domÏƒ' subst_not_in_dom)
              moreover
              have "?memsâ‡©1'i x = memâ‡©1' x"
                by (metis â€¹i = kâ€º â€¹x âˆ‰ ?X' kâ€º differing_vars_neg)
              ultimately show ?thesis
                by (metis â€¹?memsâ‡©1'i [â†¦Ïƒ] x = ?memsâ‡©1'i xâ€º)
            qed
          qed
        qed
        (* And the same for the second memories: *)
        moreover have "?memsâ‡©2'i [â†¦ Ïƒ] = memâ‡©h [â†¦ Ïƒ']"
        proof (rule ext)
          fix x

          show "?memsâ‡©2'i [â†¦ Ïƒ] x = memâ‡©h [â†¦ Ïƒ'] x"
          proof (cases "x âˆˆ ?X' k")
            assume "x âˆˆ ?X' k"

            then obtain v where "Ïƒ x = Some v"
              using domÏƒ
              by (metis domD â€¹i = kâ€º)
            hence "?memsâ‡©2'i [â†¦ Ïƒ] x = v"
              using â€¹x âˆˆ ?X' kâ€º domÏƒ
              unfolding subst_def
              by (metis option.simps(5))
            moreover
            from â€¹x âˆˆ ?X' kâ€º have "x âˆˆ ?X k"
              by auto
            hence "x âˆˆ dom (Ïƒ')"
              by (metis domÏƒ'  â€¹x âˆˆ ?X' kâ€º)
            hence "memâ‡©2' [â†¦ Ïƒ'] x = v"
              using domÏƒ' c 
              unfolding subst_def
              by (metis Ïƒ'_def â€¹Ïƒ x = Some vâ€º diff_vars_impl option.simps(5) â€¹x âˆˆ ?X' kâ€º)

            ultimately show ?thesis
              by (metis domÏƒ' dom_restrict_total memâ‡©2'_def subst_overrides)
          next
            assume "x âˆ‰ ?X' k"

            hence "?memsâ‡©2'i [â†¦ Ïƒ] x = ?memsâ‡©2'i x"
              using domÏƒ
              by (metis â€¹i = kâ€º subst_not_in_dom) 
            show ?thesis
            
            proof(case_tac "x âˆˆ ?X k")
              assume "x âˆˆ ?X k"  
              (* This case can't happen so derive a contradiction *)
              hence "memâ‡©1 x = memâ‡©1' x âˆ§ memâ‡©2 x = memâ‡©2' x" by (metis x_unchanged)

              moreover from â€¹x âˆ‰ ?X' kâ€º â€¹i = kâ€º have "?memsâ‡©1'i x = memâ‡©1' x âˆ§ ?memsâ‡©2'i x = memâ‡©2' x"
                by(metis differing_vars_neg)
               
              moreover from â€¹x âˆˆ ?X kâ€º have "fst (mems ! i) x â‰  memâ‡©1 x âˆ¨ snd (mems ! i) x â‰  memâ‡©2 x"
                by(metis differing_vars_elim â€¹i = kâ€º)

              moreover from â€¹x âˆˆ ?X kâ€º have "fst (mems' ! i) x = fst (mems ! i) x âˆ§
                                             snd (mems' ! i) x = snd (mems ! i) x"
                by(metis mems'_k_2 â€¹i = kâ€º)
                
              ultimately have "False" by auto

              thus ?thesis by blast
            next
              assume "x âˆ‰ ?X k"
              hence "x âˆ‰ dom Ïƒ'" by (simp add: domÏƒ')
              then have "memâ‡©h [â†¦ Ïƒ'] x = memâ‡©h x"
                by (metis subst_not_in_dom)
              moreover
              have "?memsâ‡©2'i x = memâ‡©2' x"
                by (metis â€¹i = kâ€º  mems'_k_1 â€¹x âˆ‰ ?X kâ€º)

              hence "?memsâ‡©2'i x = memâ‡©h x"
                unfolding memâ‡©2'_def
                by (metis domÏƒ_memâ‡©2 subst_not_in_dom â€¹x âˆ‰ ?X kâ€º)
              ultimately show ?thesis
                by (metis â€¹?memsâ‡©2'i [â†¦Ïƒ] x = ?memsâ‡©2'i xâ€º)
            qed
          qed
        qed

        ultimately show
          "(cmsâ‡©1' ! i, (fst (mems' ! i)) [â†¦ Ïƒ]) â‰ˆ (cmsâ‡©2' ! i, (snd (mems' ! i)) [â†¦ Ïƒ])"
          using domÏƒ domÏƒ' g b â€¹i = kâ€º
          by (metis câ‡©2'_def cmsâ‡©2'_def equal_size nth_list_update_eq)

      next
        assume "i â‰  k"
        define Ïƒ' where "Ïƒ' x =
            (if x âˆˆ ?X i
             then if x âˆˆ ?X' i
                  then Ïƒ x
                  else Some (memâ‡©1' x)
             else None)" for x
        let ?memsâ‡©1i = "fst (mems ! i)" and
            ?memsâ‡©2i = "snd (mems ! i)"
        have "dom Ïƒ' = ?X i"
          unfolding Ïƒ'_def
          apply auto
           apply (metis option.simps(2))
          by (metis domD domÏƒ)

        have o: "â‹€ x.
                 ((?memsâ‡©1'i [â†¦ Ïƒ] x â‰  ?memsâ‡©1i [â†¦ Ïƒ'] x âˆ¨
                  ?memsâ‡©2'i [â†¦ Ïƒ] x â‰  ?memsâ‡©2i [â†¦ Ïƒ'] x) âˆ§
                 (dma memâ‡©1 x = Low âˆ¨ dma memâ‡©1' x = High) âˆ§
                 (dma memâ‡©1' x = dma memâ‡©1 x))
                 âŸ¶ (memâ‡©1' x â‰  memâ‡©1 x âˆ¨ memâ‡©2' x â‰  memâ‡©2 x)"
        proof -
          fix x
          {
            assume eq_mem: "memâ‡©1' x = memâ‡©1 x âˆ§ memâ‡©2' x = memâ‡©2 x"
               and clas: "dma memâ‡©1 x = Low âˆ¨ dma memâ‡©1' x = High"
               and clas_eq: "dma memâ‡©1' x = dma memâ‡©1 x"
            hence mems'_simp: "?memsâ‡©1'i x = ?memsâ‡©1i x âˆ§ ?memsâ‡©2'i x = ?memsâ‡©2i x"
              using mems'_i_4
              by (metis â€¹i â‰  kâ€º b i_le length_list_update)
            have
              "?memsâ‡©1'i [â†¦ Ïƒ] x = ?memsâ‡©1i [â†¦ Ïƒ'] x âˆ§ ?memsâ‡©2'i [â†¦ Ïƒ] x = ?memsâ‡©2i [â†¦ Ïƒ'] x"
            proof (cases "x âˆˆ ?X' i")
              assume "x âˆˆ ?X' i"
              hence "?memsâ‡©1'i x â‰  memâ‡©1' x âˆ¨ ?memsâ‡©2'i x â‰  memâ‡©2' x"
                by (metis differing_vars_neg_intro)
              hence "x âˆˆ ?X i"
                using eq_mem mems'_simp
                by (metis differing_vars_neg)
              hence "Ïƒ' x = Ïƒ x"
                by (metis Ïƒ'_def â€¹x âˆˆ ?X' iâ€º)
              thus ?thesis
                by (clarsimp simp: subst_def mems'_simp split: option.splits)
            next
              assume "x âˆ‰ ?X' i"
              hence "?memsâ‡©1'i x = memâ‡©1' x âˆ§ ?memsâ‡©2'i x = memâ‡©2' x"
                by (metis differing_vars_neg)
              hence "x âˆ‰ ?X i"
                using eq_mem mems'_simp
                by (auto simp: differing_vars_neg_intro)
              thus ?thesis
                by (metis â€¹dom Ïƒ' = ?X iâ€º â€¹x âˆ‰ ?X' iâ€º domÏƒ mems'_simp subst_not_in_dom)
            qed
          }
          thus "?thesis x" by blast
        qed

        (* FIXME: clean this up once we optimise the definition of mems'_i *)
        (* Toby: try to establish something similar to o for the downgrading case *)
        have o_downgrade: "â‹€x. x âˆ‰ ?X' i âˆ§ (subst Ïƒ (fst (mems' ! i)) x â‰  subst Ïƒ' (fst (mems ! i)) x âˆ¨
                    subst Ïƒ (snd (mems' ! i)) x â‰  subst Ïƒ' (snd (mems ! i)) x) âˆ§
                   (dma memâ‡©1 x = High âˆ§ dma memâ‡©1' x = Low) âŸ¶
                    memâ‡©1' x â‰  memâ‡©1 x âˆ¨ memâ‡©2' x â‰  memâ‡©2 x"
          proof -
          fix x {
            assume mem_eq: "memâ‡©1' x = memâ‡©1 x âˆ§ memâ‡©2' x = memâ‡©2 x"
               and clas: "(dma memâ‡©1 x = High âˆ§ dma memâ‡©1' x = Low)"
               and notin: "x âˆ‰ ?X' i"
            hence mems'_simp [simp]: "?memsâ‡©1'i x = memâ‡©1 x âˆ§ ?memsâ‡©2'i x = memâ‡©1 x"
              using mems'_i_3
              by (metis â€¹i â‰  kâ€º b i_le length_list_update)
            have
              "?memsâ‡©1'i [â†¦ Ïƒ] x = ?memsâ‡©1i [â†¦ Ïƒ'] x âˆ§ ?memsâ‡©2'i [â†¦ Ïƒ] x = ?memsâ‡©2i [â†¦ Ïƒ'] x"
            proof (cases "x âˆˆ ?X' i")
              assume "x âˆˆ ?X' i"
              thus ?thesis using notin by blast
            next
              assume "x âˆ‰ ?X' i"
              hence "?memsâ‡©1'i x = memâ‡©1' x âˆ§ ?memsâ‡©2'i x = memâ‡©2' x"
                by (metis differing_vars_neg)
              moreover have "x âˆ‰ ?X i"
                using clas compat i_le len_unchanged
                by (force)
              ultimately show ?thesis
                using domÏƒ â€¹dom Ïƒ' = ?X iâ€º â€¹x âˆ‰ ?X' iâ€º apply(simp add: subst_not_in_dom)
                apply(simp add: mem_eq)
                apply(force simp: differing_vars_def differing_vars_lists_def)
                done
            qed
            
          } thus "?thesis x" by blast
        qed

        have modifies_no_var_asm_not_written:
             "â‹€x. memâ‡©1' x â‰  memâ‡©1 x âˆ¨ memâ‡©2' x â‰  memâ‡©2 x âˆ¨
                   dma memâ‡©1' x â‰  dma memâ‡©1 x âˆ¨ dma memâ‡©2' x â‰  dma memâ‡©2 x âŸ¹
              Â¬ var_asm_not_written (snd (cmsâ‡©1 ! i)) x"
        proof -
          fix x
          assume "memâ‡©1' x â‰  memâ‡©1 x âˆ¨ memâ‡©2' x â‰  memâ‡©2 x âˆ¨ dma memâ‡©1' x â‰  dma memâ‡©1 x âˆ¨ dma memâ‡©2' x â‰  dma memâ‡©2 x"
          hence modified: " Â¬ (doesnt_modify (fst (cmsâ‡©1 ! k)) x) âˆ¨ Â¬ (doesnt_modify (fst (cmsâ‡©2 ! k)) x)"
            using b i
            unfolding doesnt_modify_def
            by (metis surjective_pairing)
          hence modified_r: " Â¬ (doesnt_read_or_modify (fst (cmsâ‡©1 ! k)) x) âˆ¨ Â¬ (doesnt_read_or_modify (fst (cmsâ‡©2 ! k)) x)" using doesnt_read_or_modify_doesnt_modify by fastforce

          from sound_modes have loc_modes:
            "locally_sound_mode_use (cmsâ‡©1 ! k, memâ‡©1) âˆ§
             locally_sound_mode_use (cmsâ‡©2 ! k, memâ‡©2)"
            unfolding sound_mode_use.simps
            by (metis b equal_size list_all_length)
          moreover
          have "snd (cmsâ‡©1 ! k) = snd (cmsâ‡©2 ! k)"
            by (metis b equal_size modes_eq nth_map)
          have "(cmsâ‡©1 ! k, memâ‡©1) âˆˆ loc_reach (cmsâ‡©1 ! k, memâ‡©1)"
            using loc_reach.refl by auto
          hence guars:
                "x âˆˆ snd (cmsâ‡©1 ! k) GuarNoWrite âŸ¶ doesnt_modify (fst (cmsâ‡©1 ! k)) x âˆ§
                 x âˆˆ snd (cmsâ‡©2 ! k) GuarNoWrite âŸ¶ doesnt_modify (fst (cmsâ‡©1 ! k)) x âˆ§
                 x âˆˆ snd (cmsâ‡©1 ! k) GuarNoReadOrWrite âŸ¶ doesnt_read_or_modify (fst (cmsâ‡©1 ! k)) x âˆ§
                 x âˆˆ snd (cmsâ‡©2 ! k) GuarNoReadOrWrite âŸ¶ doesnt_read_or_modify (fst (cmsâ‡©1 ! k)) x"
            using loc_modes
            unfolding locally_sound_mode_use_def â€¹snd (cmsâ‡©1 ! k) = snd (cmsâ‡©2 ! k)â€º
            by (metis loc_reach.refl surjective_pairing)

          hence "x âˆ‰ snd (cmsâ‡©1 ! k) GuarNoWrite âˆ§ x âˆ‰ snd (cmsâ‡©1 ! k) GuarNoReadOrWrite"
            using modified modified_r loc_modes locally_sound_mode_use_def
            by (metis (no_types, lifting) â€¹(cmsâ‡©2, memâ‡©2) â†â‡˜kâ‡™ (cmsâ‡©2', memâ‡©2')â€º b locally_sound_respects_guarantees modes_eq nth_map meval_elim respects_own_guarantees_def sifum_security_init_axioms)
          moreover
          from sound_modes have "compatible_modes (map snd cmsâ‡©1)"
            by (metis globally_sound_modes_compatible sound_mode_use.simps)

          ultimately show "(?thesis x)"
            unfolding compatible_modes_def var_asm_not_written_def
            using â€¹i â‰  kâ€º i_le
            by (metis (no_types) b length_list_update length_map nth_map)
        qed

        
        from o o_downgrade have
          p: "â‹€ x. âŸ¦ ?memsâ‡©1'i [â†¦ Ïƒ] x â‰  ?memsâ‡©1i [â†¦ Ïƒ'] x âˆ¨
                      ?memsâ‡©2'i [â†¦ Ïƒ] x â‰  ?memsâ‡©2i [â†¦ Ïƒ'] x;
                     x âˆ‰ ?X' i âˆ¨ ((dma memâ‡©1 x = Low âˆ¨ dma memâ‡©1' x = High) âˆ§
                                   (dma memâ‡©1' x = dma memâ‡©1 x)) âŸ§ âŸ¹
          Â¬ var_asm_not_written  (snd (cmsâ‡©1 ! i)) x"
        proof -
          fix x
          assume mems_neq:
            "?memsâ‡©1'i [â†¦ Ïƒ] x â‰  ?memsâ‡©1i [â†¦ Ïƒ'] x âˆ¨ ?memsâ‡©2'i [â†¦ Ïƒ] x â‰  ?memsâ‡©2i [â†¦ Ïƒ'] x"
             and nin:
            "x âˆ‰ ?X' i âˆ¨ ((dma memâ‡©1 x = Low âˆ¨ dma memâ‡©1' x = High) âˆ§
                           (dma memâ‡©1' x = dma memâ‡©1 x))"
          hence "memâ‡©1' x â‰  memâ‡©1 x âˆ¨ memâ‡©2' x â‰  memâ‡©2 x âˆ¨ dma memâ‡©1' x â‰  dma memâ‡©1 x"
            (* FIXME: clean this up *)
            apply -
            apply(erule disjE[where P="x âˆ‰ ?X' i"])
             apply(case_tac "(dma memâ‡©1 x = High âˆ§ dma memâ‡©1' x = Low)")
              apply(metis o_downgrade[rule_format])
             apply(case_tac "dma memâ‡©1' x = dma memâ‡©1 x")
              (* use o *)
              apply(metis (poly_guards_query) o Sec.exhaust)
             (* should follow trivially *)
             apply fastforce
            apply(metis (poly_guards_query) o Sec.exhaust)
            done
          thus "?thesis x"
            by(force simp: modifies_no_var_asm_not_written)
        qed

        have q':
          "â‹€ x. âŸ¦ dma memâ‡©1 x = Low; dma memâ‡©1' x = Low;
                   ?memsâ‡©1'i [â†¦ Ïƒ] x â‰  ?memsâ‡©1i [â†¦ Ïƒ'] x âˆ¨
                   ?memsâ‡©2'i [â†¦ Ïƒ] x â‰  ?memsâ‡©2i [â†¦ Ïƒ'] x;
                   x âˆ‰ ?X' i âŸ§ âŸ¹
                 memâ‡©1' x = memâ‡©2' x"
          by (metis â€¹i â‰  kâ€º b compat_different_vars i_le length_list_update mems'_i_2 o)
        have "i < length cmsâ‡©1"
          by (metis cmsâ‡©2'_def equal_size i_le length_list_update new_length)
        with compat and â€¹dom Ïƒ' = ?X iâ€º have
          bisim: "(cmsâ‡©1 ! i, ?memsâ‡©1i [â†¦ Ïƒ']) â‰ˆ (cmsâ‡©2 ! i, ?memsâ‡©2i [â†¦ Ïƒ'])"
          by auto

        define Ïƒ'â‡©k where "Ïƒ'â‡©k x = (if x âˆˆ ?X k then Some (undefined::'Val) else None)" for x
        have "dom Ïƒ'â‡©k = ?X k" unfolding Ïƒ'â‡©k_def by (simp add: dom_def)
        with compat and â€¹dom Ïƒ'â‡©k = ?X kâ€º and b have
          bisimâ‡©k: "(cmsâ‡©1 ! k, ?memsâ‡©1k [â†¦ Ïƒ'â‡©k]) â‰ˆ (cmsâ‡©2 ! k, ?memsâ‡©2k [â†¦ Ïƒ'â‡©k])"
          by auto

        have q_downgrade:
          "â‹€ x. âŸ¦ dma memâ‡©1 x = High; dma memâ‡©1' x = Low;
                   ?memsâ‡©1'i [â†¦ Ïƒ] x â‰  ?memsâ‡©1i [â†¦ Ïƒ'] x âˆ¨
                   ?memsâ‡©2'i [â†¦ Ïƒ] x â‰  ?memsâ‡©2i [â†¦ Ïƒ'] x;
                   x âˆ‰ ?X' i âŸ§ âŸ¹
                 memâ‡©1' x = memâ‡©2' x"
        by (metis (erased, hide_lams) â€¹i â‰  kâ€º compat_different_vars i_le len_unchanged mems'_i_2 o_downgrade)

        have q: "â‹€ x. âŸ¦ dma memâ‡©1' x = Low;
                   ?memsâ‡©1'i [â†¦ Ïƒ] x â‰  ?memsâ‡©1i [â†¦ Ïƒ'] x âˆ¨
                   ?memsâ‡©2'i [â†¦ Ïƒ] x â‰  ?memsâ‡©2i [â†¦ Ïƒ'] x;
                   x âˆ‰ ?X' i âŸ§ âŸ¹
                 memâ‡©1' x = memâ‡©2' x"
          apply(case_tac "dma memâ‡©1 x")
           apply(blast intro: q_downgrade)
          by(blast intro: q')

        let ?Î” = "differing_vars (?memsâ‡©1i [â†¦ Ïƒ']) (?memsâ‡©1'i [â†¦ Ïƒ]) âˆª
                  differing_vars (?memsâ‡©2i [â†¦ Ïƒ']) (?memsâ‡©2'i [â†¦ Ïƒ])"

        have Î”_finite: "finite ?Î”"
          by (metis (no_types) differing_finite finite_UnI)
        â€• â€¹We first define the adaptation, then prove that it does the right thing.â€º
        define A where "A x =
             (if x âˆˆ ?Î”
              then if dma (?memsâ‡©1'i [â†¦ Ïƒ]) x = High
                   then Some (?memsâ‡©1'i [â†¦ Ïƒ] x, ?memsâ‡©2'i [â†¦ Ïƒ] x)
                   else if x âˆˆ ?X' i
                        then (case Ïƒ x of
                                Some v â‡’ Some (v, v)
                              | None â‡’ None)
                        else Some (memâ‡©1' x, memâ‡©1' x)
              else None)" for x
        have domA: "dom A = ?Î”"
        proof
          show "dom A âŠ† ?Î”"
            using A_def
            apply (auto simp: domD)
            by (metis option.simps(2))
        next
          show "?Î” âŠ† dom A"
            unfolding A_def
            apply auto
             apply (metis (no_types) domIff domÏƒ option.exhaust option.simps(5))
            by (metis (no_types) domIff domÏƒ option.exhaust option.simps(5))
        qed

        (* FIXME: clean up *)
        have dma_eq: "dma (?memsâ‡©1'i [â†¦ Ïƒ]) = dma memâ‡©1'"
          apply(rule dma_ğ’)
          apply(rule ballI)
          apply(case_tac "x âˆˆ ?X' i")
           apply(drule not_control[rotated])
            apply (metis i_le)
           apply blast
          apply(subst subst_not_in_dom)
           apply(simp add: domÏƒ)
          apply(simp add: differing_vars_lists_def differing_vars_def)
          done

        (* FIXME: clean up *)
        have dma_eq'': "dma (?memsâ‡©1i [â†¦ Ïƒ']) = dma memâ‡©1"
          apply(rule dma_ğ’)
          apply(rule ballI)
          apply(case_tac "x âˆˆ ?X i")
           using compat compat i_le len_unchanged apply fastforce
          apply(subst subst_not_in_dom)
           apply(simp add: â€¹dom Ïƒ' = ?X iâ€º)
          apply(simp add: differing_vars_lists_def differing_vars_def)
          done

        have dma_eq': "dma (subst ((to_partial memâ‡©2 |` differing_vars_lists memâ‡©1 memâ‡©2 mems k)) memâ‡©1') = dma memâ‡©1'"
          using compat b
          by(force intro!: dma_ğ’ subst_not_in_dom)

        have A_correct:
              "â‹€ x.
