               ?memsâ‡©1i [â†¦ Ïƒ'] [âˆ¥â‡©1 A] x = ?memsâ‡©1'i [â†¦ Ïƒ] x âˆ§
               ?memsâ‡©2i [â†¦ Ïƒ'] [âˆ¥â‡©2 A] x = ?memsâ‡©2'i [â†¦ Ïƒ] x"
        proof -
          fix x
          show "?thesis x"
            (is "?Eqâ‡©1 âˆ§ ?Eqâ‡©2")
          proof (cases "x âˆˆ ?Î”")
            assume "x âˆˆ ?Î”"
            hence diff:
              "?memsâ‡©1'i [â†¦ Ïƒ] x â‰  ?memsâ‡©1i [â†¦ Ïƒ'] x âˆ¨ ?memsâ‡©2'i [â†¦ Ïƒ] x â‰  ?memsâ‡©2i [â†¦ Ïƒ'] x"
              by (auto simp: differing_vars_def)
            show ?thesis
            proof (cases "dma (?memsâ‡©1'i [â†¦ Ïƒ]) x")
              assume "dma (?memsâ‡©1'i [â†¦ Ïƒ]) x = High"
              from â€¹dma (?memsâ‡©1'i [â†¦ Ïƒ]) x = Highâ€º have A_simp [simp]:
                "A x = Some (?memsâ‡©1'i [â†¦ Ïƒ] x, ?memsâ‡©2'i [â†¦ Ïƒ] x)"
                unfolding A_def
                by (metis â€¹x âˆˆ ?Î”â€º)
              from A_simp have ?Eqâ‡©1 ?Eqâ‡©2
                unfolding A_def apply_adaptation_def
                by auto
              thus ?thesis
                by auto
            next
              assume "dma (?memsâ‡©1'i [â†¦ Ïƒ]) x = Low"
              show ?thesis
              proof (cases "x âˆˆ ?X' i")
                assume "x âˆˆ ?X' i"
                then obtain v where "Ïƒ x = Some v"
                  by (metis domD domÏƒ)
                hence eq: "?memsâ‡©1'i [â†¦ Ïƒ] x = v âˆ§ ?memsâ‡©2'i [â†¦ Ïƒ] x = v"
                  unfolding subst_def
                  by auto
                moreover
                from â€¹x âˆˆ ?X' iâ€º and â€¹dma (?memsâ‡©1'i [â†¦ Ïƒ]) x = Lowâ€º have A_simp [simp]:
                  "A x = (case Ïƒ x of
                            Some v â‡’ Some (v, v)
                          | None â‡’ None)"
                  unfolding A_def
                  by (metis Sec.simps(1) â€¹x âˆˆ ?Î”â€º)
                ultimately show ?thesis
                  using domA â€¹x âˆˆ ?Î”â€º â€¹Ïƒ x = Some vâ€º
                  by (auto simp: apply_adaptation_def)

              next
                assume "x âˆ‰ ?X' i"

                hence A_simp [simp]: "A x = Some (memâ‡©1' x, memâ‡©1' x)"
                  unfolding A_def
                  using â€¹x âˆˆ ?Î”â€º â€¹x âˆ‰ ?X' iâ€º â€¹dma (?memsâ‡©1'i [â†¦ Ïƒ]) x = Lowâ€º
                  by auto

                from q have "memâ‡©1' x = memâ‡©2' x"
                  by (metis â€¹dma (?memsâ‡©1'i [â†¦ Ïƒ]) x = Lowâ€º diff â€¹x âˆ‰ ?X' iâ€º dma_eq dma_eq'')

                from â€¹x âˆ‰ ?X' iâ€º have
                  "?memsâ‡©1'i [â†¦ Ïƒ] x = ?memsâ‡©1'i x âˆ§ ?memsâ‡©2'i [â†¦ Ïƒ] x = ?memsâ‡©2'i x"
                  by (metis domÏƒ subst_not_in_dom)
                moreover
                from â€¹x âˆ‰ ?X' iâ€º have "?memsâ‡©1'i x = memâ‡©1' x âˆ§ ?memsâ‡©2'i x = memâ‡©2' x"
                  by (metis differing_vars_neg)
                ultimately show ?thesis
                  using â€¹memâ‡©1' x = memâ‡©2' xâ€º
                  by (auto simp: apply_adaptation_def)
              qed
            qed
          
          next
            assume "x âˆ‰ ?Î”"
            hence "A x = None"
              by (metis domA domIff)
            from â€¹A x = Noneâ€º have "x âˆ‰ dom A"
              by (metis domIff)
            from â€¹x âˆ‰ ?Î”â€º have "?memsâ‡©1i [â†¦ Ïƒ'] [âˆ¥â‡©1 A] x = ?memsâ‡©1'i [â†¦ Ïƒ] x âˆ§
                                 ?memsâ‡©2i [â†¦ Ïƒ'] [âˆ¥â‡©2 A] x = ?memsâ‡©2'i [â†¦ Ïƒ] x"
              using â€¹A x = Noneâ€º
              unfolding differing_vars_def apply_adaptation_def
              by auto

            thus ?thesis
              by auto
          qed
        qed
        hence adapt_eq: 
              "?memsâ‡©1i [â†¦ Ïƒ'] [âˆ¥â‡©1 A] = ?memsâ‡©1'i [â†¦ Ïƒ] âˆ§
               ?memsâ‡©2i [â†¦ Ïƒ'] [âˆ¥â‡©2 A] = ?memsâ‡©2'i [â†¦ Ïƒ]"
          by auto

        have "cmsâ‡©1' ! i = cmsâ‡©1 ! i"
          by (metis â€¹i â‰  kâ€º b nth_list_update_neq)

        have A_correct': "globally_consistent A (snd (cmsâ‡©1 ! i)) (?memsâ‡©1i [â†¦ Ïƒ']) (?memsâ‡©2i [â†¦ Ïƒ'])"
          (* FIXME: clean up *)
          apply(clarsimp simp: globally_consistent_def)
          apply(rule conjI)
           apply(split option.split)
           apply(intro allI conjI)
            apply simp
           apply(intro allI impI)
           apply(split prod.split)
           apply(intro allI impI)
           apply(simp only:)
           proof -
             fix x v v'
             assume A_updates_xâ‡©1: "A x = Some (v, v')"
                and A_updates_xâ‡©2:"subst Ïƒ' (fst (mems ! i)) x â‰  v âˆ¨ subst Ïƒ' (snd (mems ! i)) x â‰  v'"
             hence "x âˆˆ dom A" by(blast)
             hence diff:
               "?memsâ‡©1'i [â†¦ Ïƒ] x â‰  ?memsâ‡©1i [â†¦ Ïƒ'] x âˆ¨ ?memsâ‡©2'i [â†¦ Ïƒ] x â‰  ?memsâ‡©2i [â†¦ Ïƒ'] x"
                by (auto simp: differing_vars_def domA)
             show "Â¬ var_asm_not_written (snd (cmsâ‡©1 ! i)) x"
             proof (cases "x âˆ‰ ?X' i âˆ¨ ((dma memâ‡©1 x = Low âˆ¨ dma memâ‡©1' x = High) âˆ§ dma memâ‡©1' x = dma memâ‡©1 x)")
               assume "x âˆ‰ ?X' i âˆ¨ ((dma memâ‡©1 x = Low âˆ¨ dma memâ‡©1' x = High) âˆ§ (dma memâ‡©1' x = dma memâ‡©1 x))"
               from this p and diff show writable: "Â¬ var_asm_not_written (snd (cmsâ‡©1 ! i)) x"
                 by auto
             next
               assume "Â¬ (x âˆ‰ ?X' i âˆ¨ ((dma memâ‡©1 x = Low âˆ¨ dma memâ‡©1' x = High) âˆ§ (dma memâ‡©1' x = dma memâ‡©1 x)))"
               hence "x âˆˆ ?X' i" "((dma memâ‡©1 x = High âˆ§ dma memâ‡©1' x = Low) âˆ¨ (dma memâ‡©1' x â‰  dma memâ‡©1 x))"
                 by (metis Sec.exhaust)+

               thus ?thesis by(fastforce simp add: modifies_no_var_asm_not_written)
             qed
                      
          next
            
            have reclas: "(âˆ€x. dma ((subst Ïƒ' (fst (mems ! i))) [âˆ¥â‡©1 A]) x â‰  dma (subst Ïƒ' (fst (mems ! i))) x âŸ¶
         Â¬ var_asm_not_written (snd (cmsâ‡©1 ! i)) x)"
              apply(simp add: adapt_eq dma_eq dma_eq'')
              apply(simp add: modifies_no_var_asm_not_written)
              done

            have "snd (cmsâ‡©2 ! i) = snd (cmsâ‡©1 ! i)"
              by (metis â€¹i < length cmsâ‡©1â€º equal_size modes_eq nth_map)

            hence low_mds_eq: "(subst Ïƒ' (fst (mems ! i))) =â‡˜snd (cmsâ‡©1 ! i)â‡™â‡§l (subst Ïƒ' (snd (mems ! i)))"
              apply -
              apply(rule mm_equiv_low_eq[where câ‡©1="fst (cmsâ‡©1 ! i)" and câ‡©2="fst (cmsâ‡©2 ! i)"])
              using bisim
              by (metis prod.collapse)

            have "snd (cmsâ‡©2 ! k) = snd (cmsâ‡©1 ! k)"
              by (metis b equal_size modes_eq nth_map)

            hence low_mds_eqâ‡©k: "(subst Ïƒ'â‡©k (fst (mems ! k))) =â‡˜snd (cmsâ‡©1 ! k)â‡™â‡§l (subst Ïƒ'â‡©k (snd (mems ! k)))"
              apply -
              apply(rule mm_equiv_low_eq[where câ‡©1="fst (cmsâ‡©1 ! k)" and câ‡©2="fst (cmsâ‡©2 ! k)"])
              using bisimâ‡©k
              by (metis prod.collapse)

            have eq: "âˆ€x. dma ((subst Ïƒ' (fst (mems ! i))) [âˆ¥â‡©1 A]) x = Low âˆ§ (x âˆˆ (snd (cmsâ‡©1 ! i)) AsmNoReadOrWrite âŸ¶ x âˆˆ ğ’) âŸ¶
        (subst Ïƒ' (fst (mems ! i))) [âˆ¥â‡©1 A] x = (subst Ïƒ' (snd (mems ! i))) [âˆ¥â‡©2 A] x"
            (* FIXME: clean up *)
            apply(clarsimp simp: adapt_eq dma_eq)
            apply(case_tac "x âˆˆ dom Ïƒ")
             apply(force simp: subst_def)
            apply(simp add: subst_not_in_dom)
            apply(simp add: domÏƒ)
            apply(clarsimp simp: differing_vars_lists_def differing_vars_def)
            apply(case_tac "i = k")
             apply(simp add: â€¹i â‰  kâ€º)
            apply(erule mems'_i_cases)
                apply(rule â€¹i < length cmsâ‡©1'â€º[simplified len_unchanged])
               apply force
              apply fastforce
             apply clarsimp
            apply clarsimp

            apply(case_tac "x âˆˆ differing_vars_lists memâ‡©1 memâ‡©2 mems i")
             apply(force simp: differing_vars_lists_def differing_vars_def)

            apply(insert low_mds_eq)[1]
            apply(simp add: low_mds_eq_def)
            apply(drule_tac x=x in spec)

            apply(subst (asm) makes_compatible_dma_eq)
               apply(rule compat)
              apply(rule â€¹i < length cmsâ‡©1â€º)
             apply(rule â€¹dom Ïƒ' = differing_vars_lists memâ‡©1 memâ‡©2 mems iâ€º)
            apply simp
            apply(subgoal_tac "x âˆ‰ dom Ïƒ'")
             apply(simp add: subst_not_in_dom)
             apply force
            apply(simp add: â€¹dom Ïƒ' = differing_vars_lists memâ‡©1 memâ‡©2 mems iâ€º)+
            done
          from reclas eq
          show " (âˆ€x. dma ((subst Ïƒ' (fst (mems ! i))) [âˆ¥â‡©1 A]) x â‰  dma (subst Ïƒ' (fst (mems ! i))) x âŸ¶
         Â¬ var_asm_not_written (snd (cmsâ‡©1 ! i)) x) âˆ§
    (âˆ€x. dma ((subst Ïƒ' (fst (mems ! i))) [âˆ¥â‡©1 A]) x = Low âˆ§ (x âˆˆ snd (cmsâ‡©1 ! i) AsmNoReadOrWrite âŸ¶ x âˆˆ ğ’) âŸ¶
         (subst Ïƒ' (fst (mems ! i))) [âˆ¥â‡©1 A] x = (subst Ïƒ' (snd (mems ! i))) [âˆ¥â‡©2 A] x)"
          by blast
        qed

        have "snd (cmsâ‡©1 ! i) = snd (cmsâ‡©2 ! i)"
          by (metis â€¹i < length cmsâ‡©1â€º equal_size modes_eq nth_map)

        with bisim have "(cmsâ‡©1 ! i, ?memsâ‡©1i [â†¦ Ïƒ'] [âˆ¥â‡©1 A]) â‰ˆ (cmsâ‡©2 ! i, ?memsâ‡©2i [â†¦ Ïƒ'] [âˆ¥â‡©2 A])"
          using A_correct'
          apply (subst surjective_pairing[of "cmsâ‡©1 ! i"])
          apply (subst surjective_pairing[of "cmsâ‡©2 ! i"])
          by (metis surjective_pairing globally_consistent_adapt_bisim)

        thus ?thesis using adapt_eq
          by (metis â€¹i â‰  kâ€º b cmsâ‡©2'_def nth_list_update_neq)
      qed
    next
      fix i x

      let ?memsâ‡©1'i = "fst (mems' ! i)"
      let ?memsâ‡©2'i = "snd (mems' ! i)"
      assume i_le: "i < length cmsâ‡©1'"
      assume mem_eq': "memâ‡©1' x = memâ‡©2' x âˆ¨ dma memâ‡©1' x = High âˆ¨ x âˆˆ ğ’"
      show "x âˆ‰ ?X' i"
      proof (cases "x âˆˆ ğ’")
        assume "x âˆˆ ğ’"
        thus ?thesis by(metis not_control i_le)
      next
        assume "x âˆ‰ ğ’"
        hence mem_eq: "memâ‡©1' x = memâ‡©2' x âˆ¨ dma memâ‡©1' x = High" by(metis mem_eq')
        thus ?thesis
        proof (cases "i = k")
          assume "i = k"
          thus "x âˆ‰ ?X' i"
            apply (cases "x âˆ‰ ?X k")
             apply (metis differing_vars_neg_intro mems'_k_1 mems'_k_2)
            by(metis compat_different[OF compat] b mem_eq Sec.distinct(1) x_unchanged)
        next
          assume "i â‰  k"
          thus "x âˆ‰ ?X' i"
          proof (rule mems'_i_cases)
            from b i_le show "i < length cmsâ‡©1"
              by (metis length_list_update)
          next
            assume "fst (mems' ! i) x = memâ‡©1' x"
              "snd (mems' ! i) x = memâ‡©2' x"
            thus "x âˆ‰ ?X' i"
              by (metis differing_vars_neg_intro)
          next
            assume "memâ‡©1 x â‰  memâ‡©1' x âˆ¨ memâ‡©2 x â‰  memâ‡©2' x"
              "memâ‡©1' x â‰  memâ‡©2' x" and "dma memâ‡©1' x = Low"
            â€• â€¹In this case, for example, the values of (mems' ! i) are not needed.â€º
            thus "x âˆ‰ ?X' i"
              by (metis Sec.simps(2) mem_eq)
          next
            (* FIXME: clean this up -- there is surely a more direct route.
                      Same must be true of mems'_i definition and o, o_downgrade,
                      p etc. lemmas above that are proved with surely lots of
                      overlapping cases *)
            assume case3: "memâ‡©1 x = memâ‡©1' x" "memâ‡©2 x = memâ‡©2' x" 
              "dma memâ‡©1 x = Low âˆ¨ dma memâ‡©1' x = High"
              "fst (mems' ! i) x = fst (mems ! i) x"
              "snd (mems' ! i) x = snd (mems ! i) x"
            have "x âˆˆ ?X' i âŸ¹ memâ‡©1' x â‰  memâ‡©2' x âˆ§ dma memâ‡©1' x = Low"
            proof -
              assume "x âˆˆ ?X' i"
              from case3 and â€¹x âˆˆ ?X' iâ€º have "x âˆˆ ?X i"
                by (metis differing_vars_neg differing_vars_elim)
              with case3 have "memâ‡©1' x â‰  memâ‡©2' x âˆ§ dma memâ‡©1 x = Low"
                by (metis b compat compat_different i_le length_list_update)
              with mem_eq have clases: "dma memâ‡©1 x = Low âˆ§ dma memâ‡©1' x = High" by auto
              have "fst (mems' ! i) x = memâ‡©1' x âˆ§ snd (mems' ! i) x = memâ‡©2' x"
                apply(rule mems'_i_5)
                     apply(rule â€¹i â‰  kâ€º)
                    using i_le len_unchanged apply(simp)
                   apply(simp add: case3)+
                 apply(simp add: clases)+
                done
              hence "x âˆ‰ ?X' i" by (metis differing_vars_neg_intro)
              with â€¹x âˆˆ ?X' iâ€º show ?thesis by blast
            qed
            with â€¹memâ‡©1' x = memâ‡©2' x âˆ¨ dma memâ‡©1' x = Highâ€º show "x âˆ‰ ?X' i"
              by auto
          next
            assume case4: "memâ‡©1 x = memâ‡©1' x" "memâ‡©2 x = memâ‡©2' x"
                   "dma memâ‡©1 x = High" "dma memâ‡©1' x = Low"
                   "fst (mems' ! i) x = memâ‡©1 x" "snd (mems' ! i) x = memâ‡©1 x"
            with mem_eq have "memâ‡©1' x = memâ‡©2' x" by auto
            with case4 show ?thesis by(auto simp: differing_vars_def differing_vars_lists_def)
          next
            assume "fst (mems' ! i) x = memâ‡©1' x"
                   "snd (mems' ! i) x = memâ‡©2' x" thus ?thesis by(metis differing_vars_neg_intro)
          qed
        qed
      qed
    next
      { fix x
        have "âˆƒ i < length cmsâ‡©1. x âˆ‰ ?X' i"
        proof (cases "memâ‡©1 x â‰  memâ‡©1' x âˆ¨ memâ‡©2 x â‰  memâ‡©2' x âˆ¨ dma memâ‡©1' x â‰  dma memâ‡©1 x")
          assume var_changed: "memâ‡©1 x â‰  memâ‡©1' x âˆ¨ memâ‡©2 x â‰  memâ‡©2' x âˆ¨ dma memâ‡©1' x â‰  dma memâ‡©1 x"
          have "x âˆ‰ ?X' k"
            apply (rule mems'_k_cases)
             apply (metis differing_vars_neg_intro)
            by (metis var_changed x_unchanged)
          thus ?thesis by (metis b)
        next
          assume "Â¬ (memâ‡©1 x â‰  memâ‡©1' x âˆ¨ memâ‡©2 x â‰  memâ‡©2' x âˆ¨ dma memâ‡©1' x â‰  dma memâ‡©1 x)"
          hence assms: "memâ‡©1 x = memâ‡©1' x" "memâ‡©2 x = memâ‡©2' x" "dma memâ‡©1' x = dma memâ‡©1 x" by auto

          have "length cmsâ‡©1 â‰  0"
            using b
            by (metis less_zeroE)
          then obtain i where i_prop: "i < length cmsâ‡©1 âˆ§ x âˆ‰ ?X i"
            using compat
            by (auto, blast)
          show ?thesis
          proof (cases "i = k")
            assume "i = k"
            have "x âˆ‰ ?X' k"
              apply (rule mems'_k_cases)
               apply (metis differing_vars_neg_intro)
              by (metis i_prop â€¹i = kâ€º)
            thus ?thesis
              by (metis b)
          next
            from i_prop have "x âˆ‰ ?X i" by simp
            assume "i â‰  k"
            hence "x âˆ‰ ?X' i"
              (* FIXME: clean up *)
              apply -
              apply(rule mems'_i_cases)
                    apply assumption
                   apply(simp add: i_prop)
                  apply(simp add: assms)+
               using â€¹x âˆ‰ ?X iâ€º differing_vars_neg
               using â€¹Â¬ (memâ‡©1 x â‰  memâ‡©1' x âˆ¨ memâ‡©2 x â‰  memâ‡©2' x âˆ¨ dma memâ‡©1' x â‰  dma memâ‡©1 x)â€º differing_vars_elim apply auto[1]
              by(metis differing_vars_neg_intro)
            with i_prop show ?thesis
              by auto
          qed
        qed
      }
      thus "(length cmsâ‡©1' = 0 âˆ§ memâ‡©1' =â‡§l memâ‡©2') âˆ¨ (âˆ€ x. âˆƒ i < length cmsâ‡©1'. x âˆ‰ ?X' i)"
        by (metis cmsâ‡©2'_def equal_size length_list_update new_length)
    qed
  qed

  ultimately show ?thesis using that by blast
qed

text â€¹The Isar proof language provides a readable
way of specifying assumptions while also giving them names for subsequent
usage.â€º
lemma compat_low_eq:
  assumes compat: "makes_compatible (cmsâ‡©1, memâ‡©1) (cmsâ‡©2, memâ‡©2) mems"
  assumes modes_eq: "map snd cmsâ‡©1 = map snd cmsâ‡©2"
  assumes x_low: "dma memâ‡©1 x = Low"
  assumes x_readable: "x âˆˆ ğ’ âˆ¨ (âˆ€ i < length cmsâ‡©1. x âˆ‰ snd (cmsâ‡©1 ! i) AsmNoReadOrWrite)"
  shows "memâ‡©1 x = memâ‡©2 x"
proof -
  let ?X = "Î» i. differing_vars_lists memâ‡©1 memâ‡©2 mems i"
  from compat have "(length cmsâ‡©1 = 0 âˆ§ memâ‡©1 =â‡§l memâ‡©2) âˆ¨
                    (âˆ€ x. âˆƒ j. j < length cmsâ‡©1 âˆ§ x âˆ‰ ?X j)"
    by auto
  thus "memâ‡©1 x = memâ‡©2 x"
  proof
    assume "length cmsâ‡©1 = 0 âˆ§ memâ‡©1 =â‡§l memâ‡©2"
    with x_low show ?thesis
      by (simp add: low_eq_def)
  next
    assume "âˆ€ x. âˆƒ j. j < length cmsâ‡©1 âˆ§ x âˆ‰ ?X j"
    then obtain j where j_prop: "j < length cmsâ‡©1 âˆ§ x âˆ‰ ?X j"
      by auto
    let ?memsâ‡©1j = "fst (mems ! j)" and
        ?memsâ‡©2j = "snd (mems ! j)"

    obtain Ïƒ :: "'Var â‡€ 'Val" where domÏƒ: "dom Ïƒ = ?X j"
      by (metis dom_restrict_total)

    from compat x_low makes_compatible_dma_eq j_prop â€¹dom Ïƒ = ?X jâ€º
    have x_low: "dma (?memsâ‡©1j [â†¦ Ïƒ]) x = Low"
      by metis

    from domÏƒ compat and j_prop have "(cmsâ‡©1 ! j, ?memsâ‡©1j [â†¦ Ïƒ]) â‰ˆ (cmsâ‡©2 ! j, ?memsâ‡©2j [â†¦ Ïƒ])"
      by auto
    
    moreover
    have "snd (cmsâ‡©1 ! j) = snd (cmsâ‡©2 ! j)"
      using modes_eq
      by (metis j_prop length_map nth_map)

    ultimately have "?memsâ‡©1j [â†¦ Ïƒ] =â‡˜snd (cmsâ‡©1 ! j)â‡™â‡§l ?memsâ‡©2j [â†¦ Ïƒ]"
      using modes_eq j_prop
      by (metis mm_equiv_low_eq prod.collapse)
    hence "?memsâ‡©1j x = ?memsâ‡©2j x"
      using x_low x_readable j_prop â€¹dom Ïƒ = ?X jâ€º
      unfolding low_mds_eq_def
      by (metis subst_not_in_dom)

    thus ?thesis
      using j_prop
      by (metis compat_different_vars)
  qed
qed

lemma loc_reach_subset:
  assumes eval: "âŸ¨c, mds, memâŸ© â† âŸ¨c', mds', mem'âŸ©"
  shows "loc_reach âŸ¨c', mds', mem'âŸ© âŠ† loc_reach âŸ¨c, mds, memâŸ©"
proof (clarify)
  fix c'' mds'' mem''
  from eval have "âŸ¨c', mds', mem'âŸ© âˆˆ loc_reach âŸ¨c, mds, memâŸ©"
    by (metis loc_reach.refl loc_reach.step surjective_pairing)
  assume "âŸ¨c'', mds'', mem''âŸ© âˆˆ loc_reach âŸ¨c', mds', mem'âŸ©"
  thus "âŸ¨c'', mds'', mem''âŸ© âˆˆ loc_reach âŸ¨c, mds, memâŸ©"
    apply induct
      apply (metis â€¹âŸ¨c', mds', mem'âŸ© âˆˆ loc_reach âŸ¨c, mds, memâŸ©â€º surjective_pairing)
     apply (metis loc_reach.step)
    by (metis loc_reach.mem_diff)
qed

lemma locally_sound_modes_invariant:
  assumes sound_modes: "locally_sound_mode_use âŸ¨c, mds, memâŸ©"
  assumes eval: "âŸ¨c, mds, memâŸ© â† âŸ¨c', mds', mem'âŸ©"
  shows "locally_sound_mode_use âŸ¨c', mds', mem'âŸ©"
proof -
  from eval have "âŸ¨c', mds', mem'âŸ© âˆˆ loc_reach âŸ¨c, mds, memâŸ©"
    by (metis fst_conv loc_reach.refl loc_reach.step snd_conv)
  thus ?thesis
    using sound_modes
    unfolding locally_sound_mode_use_def
    by (metis (no_types) Collect_empty_eq eval loc_reach_subset subsetD)
qed


lemma meval_sched_one:
  "(cms, mem) â†â‡˜kâ‡™ (cms', mem') âŸ¹
        (cms, mem) â†’â‡˜[k]â‡™ (cms', mem')"
  apply(simp)
  done

lemma meval_sched_ConsI: 
  "(cms, mem) â†â‡˜kâ‡™ (cms', mem') âŸ¹
   (cms', mem') â†’â‡˜schedâ‡™ (cms'', mem'') âŸ¹
   (cms, mem) â†’â‡˜(k#sched)â‡™ (cms'', mem'')"
  by fastforce

lemma reachable_modes_subset:
  assumes eval: "(cms, mem) â†â‡˜kâ‡™ (cms', mem')"
  shows "reachable_mode_states (cms', mem') âŠ† reachable_mode_states (cms, mem)"
proof
  fix mdss
  assume "mdss âˆˆ reachable_mode_states (cms', mem')"
  thus "mdss âˆˆ reachable_mode_states (cms, mem)"
    using assms
    unfolding reachable_mode_states_def 
    by (blast intro: meval_sched_ConsI)
qed

lemma globally_sound_modes_invariant:
  assumes globally_sound: "globally_sound_mode_use (cms, mem)"
  assumes eval: "(cms, mem) â†â‡˜kâ‡™ (cms', mem')"
  shows "globally_sound_mode_use (cms', mem')"
  using assms reachable_modes_subset
  unfolding globally_sound_mode_use_def
  by (metis (no_types) subsetD)

lemma loc_reach_mem_diff_subset:
  assumes mem_diff: "âˆ€ x. var_asm_not_written mds x âŸ¶ memâ‡©1 x = memâ‡©2 x âˆ§ dma memâ‡©1 x = dma memâ‡©2 x"
  shows "âŸ¨c', mds', mem'âŸ© âˆˆ loc_reach âŸ¨c, mds, memâ‡©1âŸ© âŸ¹ âŸ¨c', mds', mem'âŸ© âˆˆ loc_reach âŸ¨c, mds, memâ‡©2âŸ©"
proof -
  let ?lc = "âŸ¨c', mds', mem'âŸ©"
  assume "?lc âˆˆ loc_reach âŸ¨c, mds, memâ‡©1âŸ©"
  thus ?thesis
  proof (induct)
    case refl
    thus ?case
      by (metis fst_conv loc_reach.mem_diff loc_reach.refl mem_diff snd_conv)
  next
    case step
    thus ?case
      by (metis loc_reach.step)
  next
    case mem_diff
    thus ?case
      by (metis loc_reach.mem_diff)
  qed
qed

lemma loc_reach_mem_diff_eq:
  assumes mem_diff: "âˆ€ x. var_asm_not_written mds x âŸ¶ mem' x = mem x âˆ§ dma mem' x = dma mem x"
  shows "loc_reach âŸ¨c, mds, memâŸ© = loc_reach âŸ¨c, mds, mem'âŸ©"
  using assms loc_reach_mem_diff_subset
  by (auto, metis)

lemma sound_modes_invariant:
  assumes sound_modes: "sound_mode_use (cms, mem)"
  assumes eval: "(cms, mem) â†â‡˜kâ‡™ (cms', mem')"
  shows "sound_mode_use (cms', mem')"
proof -
  from sound_modes and eval have "globally_sound_mode_use (cms', mem')"
    by (metis globally_sound_modes_invariant sound_mode_use.simps)
  moreover
  from sound_modes have loc_sound: "âˆ€ i < length cms. locally_sound_mode_use (cms ! i, mem)"
    unfolding sound_mode_use_def
    by simp (metis list_all_length)
  from eval obtain k cmsâ‡©k' where
    ev: "(cms ! k, mem) â† (cmsâ‡©k', mem') âˆ§ k < length cms âˆ§ cms' = cms [k := cmsâ‡©k']"
    by (metis meval_elim)
  hence "length cms = length cms'"
    by auto
  have "â‹€ i. i < length cms' âŸ¹ locally_sound_mode_use (cms' ! i, mem')"
  proof -
    fix i
    assume i_le: "i < length cms'"
    thus "?thesis i"
    proof (cases "i = k")
      assume "i = k"
      thus ?thesis
        using i_le ev loc_sound
        by (metis (hide_lams, no_types) locally_sound_modes_invariant nth_list_update surj_pair)
    next
      assume "i â‰  k"
      hence "cms' ! i = cms ! i"
        by (metis ev nth_list_update_neq)
      from sound_modes have "compatible_modes (map snd cms)"
        unfolding sound_mode_use.simps
        by (metis globally_sound_modes_compatible)
      hence "â‹€ x. var_asm_not_written (snd (cms ! i)) x âŸ¹ x âˆˆ snd (cms ! k) GuarNoWrite âˆ¨ x âˆˆ snd (cms ! k) GuarNoReadOrWrite"
        unfolding compatible_modes_def
        by (metis (no_types) â€¹i â‰  kâ€º â€¹length cms = length cms'â€º ev i_le length_map nth_map var_asm_not_written_def)
      hence "â‹€ x. var_asm_not_written (snd (cms ! i)) x âŸ¶ doesnt_modify (fst (cms ! k)) x"
        using ev loc_sound
        unfolding locally_sound_mode_use_def
        by (metis loc_reach.refl surjective_pairing doesnt_read_or_modify_doesnt_modify)
      with ev have "â‹€ x. var_asm_not_written (snd (cms ! i)) x âŸ¹ mem x = mem' x âˆ§ dma mem x = dma mem' x"
        unfolding doesnt_modify_def by (metis prod.collapse)
      with loc_reach_mem_diff_eq have "loc_reach (cms ! i, mem') = loc_reach (cms ! i, mem)"
         apply -
         by(case_tac "cms ! i", simp)
      thus ?thesis
        using loc_sound i_le â€¹length cms = length cms'â€º
        unfolding locally_sound_mode_use_def
        by (metis â€¹cms' ! i = cms ! iâ€º)
    qed
  qed
  ultimately show ?thesis
    unfolding sound_mode_use.simps
    by (metis (no_types) list_all_length)
qed

lemma app_Cons_rewrite:
  "ns @ (a # ms) = ((ns @ [a]) @ ms)"
  apply simp
  done

lemma meval_sched_app_iff:
  "(cmsâ‡©1, memâ‡©1) â†’â‡˜ns@msâ‡™ (cmsâ‡©1', memâ‡©1') =
   (âˆƒcmsâ‡©1'' memâ‡©1''. (cmsâ‡©1, memâ‡©1) â†’â‡˜nsâ‡™ (cmsâ‡©1'', memâ‡©1'') âˆ§ (cmsâ‡©1'', memâ‡©1'') â†’â‡˜msâ‡™ (cmsâ‡©1', memâ‡©1'))"
  apply(induct ns arbitrary: ms cmsâ‡©1 memâ‡©1)
   apply simp
  apply force
  done

lemmas meval_sched_appD = meval_sched_app_iff[THEN iffD1]
lemmas meval_sched_appI = meval_sched_app_iff[THEN iffD2, OF exI, OF exI]

lemma meval_sched_snocD:
  "(cmsâ‡©1, memâ‡©1) â†’â‡˜ns@[n]â‡™ (cmsâ‡©1', memâ‡©1') âŸ¹
   âˆƒcmsâ‡©1'' memâ‡©1''. (cmsâ‡©1, memâ‡©1) â†’â‡˜nsâ‡™ (cmsâ‡©1'', memâ‡©1'') âˆ§ (cmsâ‡©1'', memâ‡©1'') â†â‡˜nâ‡™ (cmsâ‡©1', memâ‡©1')"
  apply(fastforce dest: meval_sched_appD)
  done

lemma meval_sched_snocI:
  "(cmsâ‡©1, memâ‡©1) â†’â‡˜nsâ‡™ (cmsâ‡©1'', memâ‡©1'') âˆ§ (cmsâ‡©1'', memâ‡©1'') â†â‡˜nâ‡™ (cmsâ‡©1', memâ‡©1') âŸ¹
  (cmsâ‡©1, memâ‡©1) â†’â‡˜ns@[n]â‡™ (cmsâ‡©1', memâ‡©1')"
  apply(fastforce intro: meval_sched_appI)
  done
  
lemma makes_compatible_eval_sched:
  assumes compat: "makes_compatible (cmsâ‡©1, memâ‡©1) (cmsâ‡©2, memâ‡©2) mems"
  assumes modes_eq: "map snd cmsâ‡©1 = map snd cmsâ‡©2"
  assumes sound_modes: "sound_mode_use (cmsâ‡©1, memâ‡©1)" "sound_mode_use (cmsâ‡©2, memâ‡©2)"
  assumes eval: "(cmsâ‡©1, memâ‡©1) â†’â‡˜schedâ‡™ (cmsâ‡©1', memâ‡©1')"
  shows "âˆƒ cmsâ‡©2' memâ‡©2' mems'. sound_mode_use (cmsâ‡©1', memâ‡©1') âˆ§
                              sound_mode_use (cmsâ‡©2', memâ‡©2') âˆ§
                              map snd cmsâ‡©1' = map snd cmsâ‡©2' âˆ§
                              (cmsâ‡©2, memâ‡©2) â†’â‡˜schedâ‡™ (cmsâ‡©2', memâ‡©2') âˆ§
                              makes_compatible (cmsâ‡©1', memâ‡©1') (cmsâ‡©2', memâ‡©2') mems'"
proof -
  (* cmsâ‡©1' and memâ‡©1' need to be arbitrary so
     that the induction hypothesis is sufficiently general. *)
  from eval show ?thesis
  proof (induct "sched" arbitrary: cmsâ‡©1' memâ‡©1' rule: rev_induct)
    case Nil
    hence "cmsâ‡©1' = cmsâ‡©1 âˆ§ memâ‡©1' = memâ‡©1"
      by (simp add: Pair_inject meval_sched.simps(1))
    thus ?case
      by (metis compat meval_sched.simps(1) modes_eq sound_modes)
  next
    case (snoc n ns)
    then obtain cmsâ‡©1'' memâ‡©1'' where eval'':
      "(cmsâ‡©1, memâ‡©1) â†’â‡˜nsâ‡™ (cmsâ‡©1'', memâ‡©1'') âˆ§ (cmsâ‡©1'', memâ‡©1'') â†â‡˜nâ‡™ (cmsâ‡©1', memâ‡©1')"
      by (metis meval_sched_snocD prod_cases3 snd_conv)
    hence "(cmsâ‡©1'', memâ‡©1'') â†â‡˜nâ‡™ (cmsâ‡©1', memâ‡©1')" ..
    moreover
    from eval'' obtain cmsâ‡©2'' memâ‡©2'' mems'' where IH:
      "sound_mode_use (cmsâ‡©1'', memâ‡©1'') âˆ§
       sound_mode_use (cmsâ‡©2'', memâ‡©2'') âˆ§
       map snd cmsâ‡©1'' = map snd cmsâ‡©2'' âˆ§
       (cmsâ‡©2, memâ‡©2) â†’â‡˜nsâ‡™ (cmsâ‡©2'', memâ‡©2'') âˆ§
       makes_compatible (cmsâ‡©1'', memâ‡©1'') (cmsâ‡©2'', memâ‡©2'') mems''"
      using snoc
      by metis
    ultimately obtain cmsâ‡©2' memâ‡©2' mems' where
      "map snd cmsâ‡©1' = map snd cmsâ‡©2' âˆ§
       (cmsâ‡©2'', memâ‡©2'') â†â‡˜nâ‡™ (cmsâ‡©2', memâ‡©2') âˆ§
       makes_compatible (cmsâ‡©1', memâ‡©1') (cmsâ‡©2', memâ‡©2') mems'"
      using makes_compatible_invariant
      by blast
    thus ?case
      using IH eval'' meval_sched_snocI sound_modes_invariant
      by metis
  qed
qed

lemma differing_vars_initially_empty:
  "i < n âŸ¹ x âˆ‰ differing_vars_lists memâ‡©1 memâ‡©2 (zip (replicate n memâ‡©1) (replicate n memâ‡©2)) i"
  unfolding differing_vars_lists_def differing_vars_def
  by auto

lemma compatible_refl:
  assumes coms_secure: "list_all com_sifum_secure cmds"
  assumes low_eq: "memâ‡©1 =â‡§l memâ‡©2"
  shows "makes_compatible (cmds, memâ‡©1)
                          (cmds, memâ‡©2)
                          (replicate (length cmds) (memâ‡©1, memâ‡©2))"
proof -
  let ?n = "length cmds"
  let ?mems = "replicate ?n (memâ‡©1, memâ‡©2)" and
      ?mdss = "map snd cmds"
  let ?X = "differing_vars_lists memâ‡©1 memâ‡©2 ?mems"
  have diff_empty: "âˆ€ i < ?n. ?X i = {}"
    by (metis differing_vars_initially_empty ex_in_conv min.idem zip_replicate)

  show ?thesis
  proof
    show "length cmds = length cmds âˆ§ length cmds = length ?mems"
      by auto
  next
    fix i and Ïƒ :: "'Var â‡’ 'Val option"
    let ?memsâ‡©1i = "fst (?mems ! i)" and ?memsâ‡©2i = "snd (?mems ! i)"
    let ?mdssâ‡©i = "?mdss ! i"
    assume i: "i < length cmds"
    assume domÏƒ: "dom Ïƒ =
                  differing_vars_lists memâ‡©1 memâ‡©2
                                      (replicate (length cmds) (memâ‡©1, memâ‡©2)) i"
    from i have "?memsâ‡©1i = memâ‡©1" "?memsâ‡©2i = memâ‡©2"
      by auto

    with domÏƒ have [simp]: "dom Ïƒ = {}" by(auto simp: differing_vars_lists_def differing_vars_def i)

    from i coms_secure have "com_sifum_secure (cmds ! i)"
      using coms_secure
      by (metis length_map length_replicate list_all_length map_snd_zip)
    with i have "â‹€ memâ‡©1 memâ‡©2. memâ‡©1 =â‡˜?mdssâ‡©iâ‡™â‡§l memâ‡©2 âŸ¹
      (cmds ! i, memâ‡©1) â‰ˆ (cmds ! i, memâ‡©2)"
      using com_sifum_secure_def low_indistinguishable_def
      by auto

    moreover
    have "â‹€x. Ïƒ x = None" using â€¹dom Ïƒ = {}â€º
      by (metis domIff empty_iff)
    hence [simp]: "â‹€ mem. mem [â†¦ Ïƒ] = mem"
      by(simp add: subst_def)

    from i have "?memsâ‡©1i = memâ‡©1" "?memsâ‡©2i = memâ‡©2"
      by auto
    with low_eq have "?memsâ‡©1i [â†¦ Ïƒ] =â‡˜?mdssâ‡©iâ‡™â‡§l ?memsâ‡©2i [â†¦ Ïƒ]"
      by (auto simp: low_mds_eq_def low_eq_def)

    ultimately show "(cmds ! i, ?memsâ‡©1i [â†¦ Ïƒ]) â‰ˆ (cmds ! i, ?memsâ‡©2i [â†¦ Ïƒ])"
      by simp
  next
    fix i x
    assume "i < length cmds"
    with diff_empty show "x âˆ‰ ?X i" by auto
  next
    show "(length cmds = 0 âˆ§ memâ‡©1 =â‡§l memâ‡©2) âˆ¨ (âˆ€ x. âˆƒ i < length cmds. x âˆ‰ ?X i)"
      using diff_empty
      by (metis bot_less bot_nat_def empty_iff length_zip low_eq min_0L)
  qed
qed

theorem sifum_compositionality_cont:
  assumes com_secure: "list_all com_sifum_secure cmds"
  assumes sound_modes: "âˆ€ mem. INIT mem âŸ¶ sound_mode_use (cmds, mem)"
  shows "prog_sifum_secure_cont cmds"
  unfolding prog_sifum_secure_cont_def
  using assms
proof (clarify)
  fix memâ‡©1 memâ‡©2 :: "'Var â‡’ 'Val"
  fix sched cmsâ‡©1' memâ‡©1'
  let ?n = "length cmds"
  let ?mems = "zip (replicate ?n memâ‡©1) (replicate ?n memâ‡©2)"
  assume INITâ‡©1: "INIT memâ‡©1" and INITâ‡©2: "INIT memâ‡©2"
  assume low_eq: "memâ‡©1 =â‡§l memâ‡©2"
  with com_secure have compat:
    "makes_compatible (cmds, memâ‡©1) (cmds, memâ‡©2) ?mems"
    by (metis compatible_refl fst_conv length_replicate map_replicate snd_conv zip_eq_conv INITâ‡©1 INITâ‡©2)

  also assume eval: "(cmds, memâ‡©1) â†’â‡˜schedâ‡™ (cmsâ‡©1', memâ‡©1')"

  ultimately obtain cmsâ‡©2' memâ‡©2' mems'
    where p: "map snd cmsâ‡©1' = map snd cmsâ‡©2' âˆ§
             (cmds, memâ‡©2) â†’â‡˜schedâ‡™ (cmsâ‡©2', memâ‡©2') âˆ§
             makes_compatible (cmsâ‡©1', memâ‡©1') (cmsâ‡©2', memâ‡©2') mems'"
    using sound_modes makes_compatible_eval_sched INITâ‡©1 INITâ‡©2
    by blast

  thus "âˆƒ cmsâ‡©2' memâ‡©2'. (cmds, memâ‡©2) â†’â‡˜schedâ‡™ (cmsâ‡©2', memâ‡©2') âˆ§
                        map snd cmsâ‡©1' = map snd cmsâ‡©2' âˆ§
                        length cmsâ‡©2' = length cmsâ‡©1' âˆ§
                        (âˆ€ x. dma memâ‡©1' x = Low âˆ§ (x âˆˆ ğ’ âˆ¨ (âˆ€ i < length cmsâ‡©1'. x âˆ‰ snd (cmsâ‡©1' ! i) AsmNoReadOrWrite))
          âŸ¶ memâ‡©1' x = memâ‡©2' x)"
    using p compat_low_eq
    by (metis length_map)
qed

end

end

Theory Language

(*
Title: Value-Dependent SIFUM-Type-Systems
Authors: Toby Murray, Robert Sison, Edward Pierzchalski, Christine Rizkallah
(Based on the SIFUM-Type-Systems AFP entry, whose authors
 are: Sylvia Grewe, Heiko Mantel, Daniel Schoepe)
*)
section â€¹Language for Instantiating the SIFUM-Security Propertyâ€º

theory Language
imports Preliminaries
begin

subsection â€¹Syntaxâ€º

datatype 'var ModeUpd = Acq "'var" Mode (infix "+=â‡©m" 75)
  | Rel "'var" Mode (infix "-=â‡©m" 75)

datatype ('var, 'aexp, 'bexp) Stmt = Assign "'var" "'aexp" (infix "â†" 130)
  | Skip
  | ModeDecl "('var, 'aexp, 'bexp) Stmt" "'var ModeUpd" ("_@[_]" [0, 0] 150)
  | Seq "('var, 'aexp, 'bexp) Stmt" "('var, 'aexp, 'bexp) Stmt" (infixr ";;" 150)
  | If "'bexp" "('var, 'aexp, 'bexp) Stmt" "('var, 'aexp, 'bexp) Stmt"
  | While "'bexp" "('var, 'aexp, 'bexp) Stmt"
  | Await "'bexp" "('var, 'aexp, 'bexp) Stmt"
  | Stop

type_synonym ('var, 'aexp, 'bexp) EvalCxt = "('var, 'aexp, 'bexp) Stmt list"

locale sifum_lang_no_dma =
  fixes evalâ‡©A :: "('Var, 'Val) Mem â‡’ 'AExp â‡’ 'Val"
  fixes evalâ‡©B :: "('Var, 'Val) Mem â‡’ 'BExp â‡’ bool"
  fixes aexp_vars :: "'AExp â‡’ 'Var set"
  fixes bexp_vars :: "'BExp â‡’ 'Var set"
  assumes Var_finite : "finite {(x :: 'Var). True}"
  assumes eval_vars_detâ‡©A : "âŸ¦ âˆ€ x âˆˆ aexp_vars e. memâ‡©1 x = memâ‡©2 x âŸ§ âŸ¹ evalâ‡©A memâ‡©1 e = evalâ‡©A memâ‡©2 e"
  assumes eval_vars_detâ‡©B : "âŸ¦ âˆ€ x âˆˆ bexp_vars b. memâ‡©1 x = memâ‡©2 x âŸ§ âŸ¹ evalâ‡©B memâ‡©1 b = evalâ‡©B memâ‡©2 b"

locale sifum_lang = sifum_lang_no_dma evalâ‡©A evalâ‡©B aexp_vars bexp_vars
  for evalâ‡©A :: "('Var, 'Val) Mem â‡’ 'AExp â‡’ 'Val"
  and evalâ‡©B :: "('Var, 'Val) Mem â‡’ 'BExp â‡’ bool"
  and aexp_vars :: "'AExp â‡’ 'Var set"
  and bexp_vars :: "'BExp â‡’ 'Var set"+
  fixes dma :: "'Var â‡’ Sec"

context sifum_lang_no_dma
begin

(* To make the examples look a bit nicer in the PDF. *)

notation (latex output)
  Seq ("_; _" 60)

notation (Rule output)
  Seq ("_ ; _" 60)

notation (Rule output)
  If ("if _ then _ else _ fi" 50)

notation (Rule output)
  While ("while _ do _ done")

notation (Rule output)
  Await ("await _ do _ done")

abbreviation confâ‡©w_abv :: "('Var, 'AExp, 'BExp) Stmt â‡’
  'Var Mds â‡’ ('Var, 'Val) Mem â‡’ (_,_,_) LocalConf"
  ("âŸ¨_, _, _âŸ©â‡©w" [0, 120, 120] 100)
  where
  "âŸ¨ c, mds, mem âŸ©â‡©w â‰¡ ((c, mds), mem)"

subsection â€¹Semanticsâ€º

primrec update_modes :: "'Var ModeUpd â‡’ 'Var Mds â‡’ 'Var Mds"
  where
  "update_modes (Acq x m) mds = mds (m := insert x (mds m))" |
  "update_modes (Rel x m) mds = mds (m := {y. y âˆˆ mds m âˆ§ y â‰  x})"

fun updated_var :: "'Var ModeUpd â‡’ 'Var"
  where
  "updated_var (Acq x _) = x" |
  "updated_var (Rel x _) = x"

fun updated_mode :: "'Var ModeUpd â‡’ Mode"
  where
  "updated_mode (Acq _ m) = m" |
  "updated_mode (Rel _ m) = m"

inductive_set evalâ‡©w_simple :: "(('Var, 'AExp, 'BExp) Stmt Ã— ('Var, 'Val) Mem) rel"
and evalâ‡©w_simple_abv :: "(('Var, 'AExp, 'BExp) Stmt Ã— ('Var, 'Val) Mem) â‡’
  ('Var, 'AExp, 'BExp) Stmt Ã— ('Var, 'Val) Mem â‡’ bool"
  (infixr "â†â‡©s" 60)
  where
  "c â†â‡©s c' â‰¡ (c, c') âˆˆ evalâ‡©w_simple" |
  assign: "((x â† e, mem), (Stop, mem (x := evalâ‡©A mem e))) âˆˆ evalâ‡©w_simple" |
  skip: "((Skip, mem), (Stop, mem)) âˆˆ evalâ‡©w_simple" |
  seq_stop: "((Seq Stop c, mem), (c, mem)) âˆˆ evalâ‡©w_simple" |
  if_true: "âŸ¦ evalâ‡©B mem b âŸ§ âŸ¹ ((If b t e, mem), (t, mem)) âˆˆ evalâ‡©w_simple" |
  if_false: "âŸ¦ Â¬ evalâ‡©B mem b âŸ§ âŸ¹ ((If b t e, mem), (e, mem)) âˆˆ evalâ‡©w_simple" |
  while: "((While b c, mem), (If b (c ;; While b c) Stop, mem)) âˆˆ evalâ‡©w_simple"

lemma cond:
  "((If b t e, mem), (if evalâ‡©B mem b then t else e, mem)) âˆˆ evalâ‡©w_simple"
  apply(case_tac "evalâ‡©B mem b")
   apply(auto intro: evalâ‡©w_simple.intros)
  done

primrec cxt_to_stmt :: "('Var, 'AExp, 'BExp) EvalCxt â‡’ ('Var, 'AExp, 'BExp) Stmt
  â‡’ ('Var, 'AExp, 'BExp) Stmt"
  where
  "cxt_to_stmt [] c = c" |
  "cxt_to_stmt (c # cs) c' = Seq c' (cxt_to_stmt cs c)"

(* Design decision: Add "normal" rule for sequential statements here as well.
  Otherwise, one would have to take care of adding some sort of normalization
  later, so that one doesn't get stuck on expressions of the form (c ;; c') ;; c''.
*)
(* Normalization turned out to be more difficult, as it made the proofs of several
  helpful lemmas below quite difficult. *)

lemma rtrancl_mono_proof[mono]:
  "(â‹€a b. x a b âŸ¶ y a b) âŸ¹ rtranclp x a b âŸ¶ rtranclp y a b"
  apply (rule impI, rotate_tac, induct rule: rtranclp.induct)
   apply simp_all
  apply (metis rtranclp.intros)
  done

lemma trancl_mono_proof[mono]:
  "(â‹€a b. x a b âŸ¶ y a b) âŸ¹ tranclp x a b âŸ¶ tranclp y a b"
  apply (rule impI, rotate_tac, induct rule: tranclp.induct)
   apply simp_all
   apply blast
  by fastforce

inductive no_await :: "('Var, 'AExp, 'BExp) Stmt â‡’ bool" where
  "no_await (x â† e)" |
  "no_await c1 âŸ¹ no_await c2 âŸ¹ no_await (c1 ;; c2)" |
  "no_await c1 âŸ¹ no_await c2 âŸ¹ no_await (If b c1 c2)" |
  "no_await c âŸ¹ no_await (While b c)" |
  "no_await Skip" |
  "no_await Stop" |
  "no_await c âŸ¹ no_await (c@[m])"

inductive is_final :: "('Var, 'AExp, 'BExp) Stmt â‡’ bool" where
  "is_final Stop" |
  "is_final c âŸ¹ is_final (c@[m])"

inductive_set evalâ‡©w :: "(('Var, 'AExp, 'BExp) Stmt, 'Var, 'Val) LocalConf rel"
and evalâ‡©w_abv :: "(('Var, 'AExp, 'BExp) Stmt, 'Var, 'Val) LocalConf â‡’
                  (('Var, 'AExp, 'BExp) Stmt, 'Var, 'Val) LocalConf â‡’ bool"
  (infixr "â†â‡©w" 60)
where
  "c â†â‡©w c' â‰¡ (c, c') âˆˆ evalâ‡©w" |
  unannotated: "âŸ¦ (c, mem) â†â‡©s (c', mem') âŸ§
    âŸ¹ (âŸ¨cxt_to_stmt E c, mds, memâŸ©â‡©w, âŸ¨cxt_to_stmt E c', mds, mem'âŸ©â‡©w) âˆˆ evalâ‡©w" |
  seq: "âŸ¦ âŸ¨câ‡©1, mds, memâŸ©â‡©w â†â‡©w âŸ¨câ‡©1', mds', mem'âŸ©â‡©w âŸ§ âŸ¹ (âŸ¨(câ‡©1 ;; câ‡©2), mds, memâŸ©â‡©w, âŸ¨(câ‡©1' ;; câ‡©2), mds', mem'âŸ©â‡©w) âˆˆ evalâ‡©w" |
  decl: "âŸ¦ âŸ¨c, update_modes mu mds, memâŸ©â‡©w â†â‡©w âŸ¨c', mds', mem'âŸ©â‡©w âŸ§ âŸ¹
         (âŸ¨cxt_to_stmt E (ModeDecl c mu), mds, memâŸ©â‡©w, âŸ¨cxt_to_stmt E c', mds', mem'âŸ©â‡©w) âˆˆ evalâ‡©w" |
(* This is added instead of defining evalâ‡©p -- see next comment*)
  await: "âŸ¦evalâ‡©B mem b; no_await câ‡©1;
         (âŸ¨câ‡©1, mds, memâŸ©â‡©w, âŸ¨câ‡©2, mds', mem'âŸ©â‡©w) âˆˆ evalâ‡©wâ‡§+;
         is_final câ‡©2âŸ§ âŸ¹
         (âŸ¨Await b câ‡©1, mds, memâŸ©â‡©w, âŸ¨câ‡©2, mds', mem'âŸ©â‡©w) âˆˆ evalâ‡©w"

abbreviation evalâ‡©w_plus :: "
  (('Var, 'AExp, 'BExp) Stmt, 'Var, 'Val) LocalConf â‡’
                  (('Var, 'AExp, 'BExp) Stmt, 'Var, 'Val) LocalConf â‡’ bool" ("_ â†â‡©wâ‡§+ _") where
"ctx â†â‡©wâ‡§+ ctx' â‰¡ (ctx, ctx') âˆˆ evalâ‡©wâ‡§+"
  
subsection â€¹Semantic Propertiesâ€º

text â€¹The following lemmas simplify working with evaluation contexts
  in the soundness proofs for the type system(s).â€º

inductive_cases eval_elim: "(((c, mds), mem), ((c', mds'), mem')) âˆˆ evalâ‡©w"
inductive_cases stop_no_eval' [elim]: "((Stop, mem), (c', mem')) âˆˆ evalâ‡©w_simple"
inductive_cases assign_elim' [elim]: "((x â† e, mem), (c', mem')) âˆˆ evalâ‡©w_simple"
inductive_cases skip_elim' [elim]: "(Skip, mem) â†â‡©s (c', mem')"

lemma cxt_inv:
  "âŸ¦ cxt_to_stmt E c = c' ; â‹€ p q. c' â‰  Seq p q âŸ§ âŸ¹ E = [] âˆ§ c' = c"
  by (metis cxt_to_stmt.simps(1) cxt_to_stmt.simps(2) neq_Nil_conv)

lemma cxt_inv_assign:
  "âŸ¦ cxt_to_stmt E c = x â† e âŸ§ âŸ¹ c = x â† e âˆ§ E = []"
  by (metis Stmt.simps(11) cxt_inv)

lemma cxt_inv_skip:
  "âŸ¦ cxt_to_stmt E c = Skip âŸ§ âŸ¹ c = Skip âˆ§ E = []"
  by (metis Stmt.simps(23) cxt_inv)

lemma cxt_inv_stop:
  "cxt_to_stmt E c = Stop âŸ¹ c = Stop âˆ§ E = []"
  by (metis Stmt.simps(49) cxt_inv)

lemma cxt_inv_if:
  "cxt_to_stmt E c = If e p q âŸ¹ c = If e p q âˆ§ E = []"
  by (metis Stmt.simps(43) cxt_inv)
  
lemma ctx_inv_anno:
  "cxt_to_stmt E c = c'@[mu] âŸ¹ c = c'@[mu] âˆ§ E = []"
  using cxt_inv by blast 
  
lemma cxt_inv_await:
  "cxt_to_stmt E c = Await e p âŸ¹ c = Await e p  âˆ§ E = []"
  by (metis Stmt.simps(47) cxt_inv)

lemma cxt_inv_while:
  "cxt_to_stmt E c = While e p âŸ¹ c = While e p âˆ§ E = []"
  by (metis Stmt.simps(45) cxt_inv)

lemma skip_elim [elim]:
  "âŸ¨Skip, mds, memâŸ©â‡©w â†â‡©w âŸ¨c', mds', mem'âŸ©â‡©w âŸ¹ c' = Stop âˆ§ mds = mds' âˆ§ mem = mem'"
  apply (erule eval_elim)
     apply (metis (lifting) cxt_inv_skip cxt_to_stmt.simps(1) skip_elim')
    apply (metis Stmt.simps(24))
   apply (metis Stmt.simps(21) cxt_inv_skip)
  by simp

lemma assign_elim [elim]:
  "âŸ¨x â† e, mds, memâŸ©â‡©w â†â‡©w âŸ¨c', mds', mem'âŸ©â‡©w âŸ¹ c' = Stop âˆ§ mds = mds' âˆ§ mem' = mem (x := evalâ‡©A mem e)"
  apply (erule eval_elim)
     apply (rename_tac c c'a E)
     apply (subgoal_tac "c = x â† e âˆ§ E = []")
      apply force 
     apply auto
      apply (metis cxt_inv_assign)
     apply (metis cxt_inv_assign)
    apply (metis Stmt.simps(9) cxt_inv_assign)
   apply (metis Stmt.simps(9) cxt_inv_assign)
  by (metis Stmt.simps(9) cxt_inv_assign)

inductive_cases if_elim' [elim!]: "(If b p q, mem) â†â‡©s (c', mem')"

lemma if_elim [elim]:
  "â‹€ P.
    âŸ¦ âŸ¨If b p q, mds, memâŸ©â‡©w â†â‡©w âŸ¨c', mds', mem'âŸ©â‡©w ;
     âŸ¦ c' = p; mem' = mem ; mds' = mds ; evalâ‡©B mem b âŸ§ âŸ¹ P ;
     âŸ¦ c' = q; mem' = mem ; mds' = mds ; Â¬ evalâ‡©B mem b âŸ§ âŸ¹ P âŸ§ âŸ¹ P"
  apply (erule eval_elim)
     apply (metis (no_types) cxt_inv_if cxt_to_stmt.simps(1) if_elim')
    apply (metis Stmt.simps(43))
   apply (metis Stmt.simps(35) cxt_inv_if)
  by simp

inductive_cases await_elim' [elim!]: "âŸ¨Await b p, mds, memâŸ©â‡©w â†â‡©w âŸ¨c',mds', mem'âŸ©â‡©w"

inductive_cases while_elim' [elim!]: "(While e c, mem) â†â‡©s (c', mem')"

lemma while_elim [elim]:
  "âŸ¦ âŸ¨While e c, mds, memâŸ©â‡©w â†â‡©w âŸ¨c', mds', mem'âŸ©â‡©w âŸ§ âŸ¹ c' = If e (c ;; While e c) Stop âˆ§ mds' = mds âˆ§ mem' = mem"
  apply (erule eval_elim)
     apply (metis (no_types) cxt_inv_while cxt_to_stmt.simps(1) while_elim')
    apply (metis Stmt.simps(45))
   apply (metis (lifting) Stmt.simps(37) cxt_inv_while)
  by simp

inductive_cases upd_elim' [elim]: "(c@[upd], mem) â†â‡©s (c', mem')"

lemma upd_elim [elim]:
  "âŸ¨c@[upd], mds, memâŸ©â‡©w â†â‡©w âŸ¨c', mds', mem'âŸ©â‡©w âŸ¹ âŸ¨c, update_modes upd mds, memâŸ©â‡©w â†â‡©w âŸ¨c', mds', mem'âŸ©â‡©w"
  apply (erule eval_elim)
     apply (metis (lifting) Stmt.simps(33) cxt_inv upd_elim')
    apply (metis Stmt.simps(34))
   apply (metis (lifting) Stmt.simps(2) Stmt.simps(33) cxt_inv cxt_to_stmt.simps(1))
  by simp

lemma cxt_seq_elim [elim]:
  "câ‡©1 ;; câ‡©2 = cxt_to_stmt E c âŸ¹ (E = [] âˆ§ c = câ‡©1 ;; câ‡©2) âˆ¨ (âˆƒ c' cs. E = c' # cs âˆ§ c = câ‡©1 âˆ§ câ‡©2 = cxt_to_stmt cs c')"
  apply (cases E)
   apply (metis cxt_to_stmt.simps(1))
  by (metis Stmt.simps(3) cxt_to_stmt.simps(2))

inductive_cases seq_elim' [elim]: "(câ‡©1 ;; câ‡©2, mem) â†â‡©s (c', mem')"

lemma stop_no_eval: "Â¬ (âŸ¨Stop, mds, memâŸ©â‡©w â†â‡©w âŸ¨c', mds', mem'âŸ©â‡©w)"
  apply auto
  apply (erule eval_elim)
     apply (metis cxt_inv_stop stop_no_eval')
    apply (metis Stmt.simps(49))
   apply (metis Stmt.simps(41) cxt_inv_stop)
  by simp

lemma seq_stop_elim [elim]:
  "âŸ¨Stop ;; c, mds, memâŸ©â‡©w â†â‡©w âŸ¨c', mds', mem'âŸ©â‡©w âŸ¹ c' = c âˆ§ mds' = mds âˆ§ mem' = mem"
  apply (erule eval_elim)
     apply clarify
     apply (metis (no_types) cxt_seq_elim cxt_to_stmt.simps(1) seq_elim' stop_no_eval')
    apply (metis Stmt.inject(3) stop_no_eval)
   apply (metis Stmt.distinct(28) Stmt.distinct(36) cxt_seq_elim)
  by simp

lemma cxt_stmt_seq:
  "c ;; cxt_to_stmt E c' = cxt_to_stmt (c' # E) c"
  by (metis cxt_to_stmt.simps(2))


lemma seq_elim [elim]:
  "âŸ¦ âŸ¨câ‡©1 ;; câ‡©2, mds, memâŸ©â‡©w â†â‡©w âŸ¨c', mds', mem'âŸ©â‡©w ; câ‡©1 â‰  Stop âŸ§ âŸ¹
  (âˆƒ câ‡©1'. âŸ¨câ‡©1, mds, memâŸ©â‡©w â†â‡©w âŸ¨câ‡©1', mds', mem'âŸ©â‡©w âˆ§ c' = câ‡©1' ;; câ‡©2)"
  apply (erule eval_elim)
    apply clarify
    apply (drule cxt_seq_elim)
    apply (erule disjE)
     apply blast 
    apply auto
   apply (metis cxt_to_stmt.simps(1) evalâ‡©w.unannotated)
  apply (subgoal_tac "câ‡©1 = c@[mu]")
   apply simp
   apply (drule cxt_seq_elim)
   apply (metis Stmt.distinct(27) cxt_stmt_seq cxt_to_stmt.simps(1) evalâ‡©w.decl)
  using cxt_seq_elim by blast

lemma stop_cxt: "Stop = cxt_to_stmt E c âŸ¹ c = Stop"
  by (metis Stmt.simps(50) cxt_to_stmt.simps(1) cxt_to_stmt.simps(2) neq_Nil_conv)

(* Additional helper lemmas added by TobyM and RobS *)

lemmas decl_evalâ‡©w = decl[OF unannotated, OF skip, where E="[]", simplified, where E1="[]", simplified]
lemmas seq_stop_evalâ‡©w = unannotated[OF seq_stop, where E="[]", simplified]
lemmas assign_evalâ‡©w = unannotated[OF assign, where E="[]", simplified]
lemmas if_evalâ‡©w = unannotated[OF cond, where E="[]", simplified]
lemmas if_false_evalâ‡©w = unannotated[OF if_false, where E="[]", simplified]
lemmas skip_evalâ‡©w = unannotated[OF skip, where E="[]", simplified]
lemmas while_evalâ‡©w = unannotated[OF while, where E="[]", simplified]

lemma decl_evalâ‡©w':
  assumes mem_unchanged: "mem' = mem"
  assumes upd: "mds' = update_modes upd mds"
  shows "(âŸ¨Skip@[upd], mds, memâŸ©â‡©w, âŸ¨Stop, mds', mem'âŸ©â‡©w) âˆˆ evalâ‡©w"
  using assms decl_evalâ‡©w
  by auto

lemma assign_evalâ‡©w':
  "âŸ¦mds = mds'; mem' = mem(x := evalâ‡©A mem e)âŸ§ âŸ¹
  âŸ¨x â† e, mds, memâŸ©â‡©w â†â‡©w âŸ¨Stop, mds', mem'âŸ©â‡©w"
  using assign_evalâ‡©w
  by simp

(* Following the naming convention, but we actually apply these as dest, not elim rules... *)

lemma seq_decl_elim:
  "âŸ¨(Skip@[upd]) ;; c, mds, memâŸ©â‡©w â†â‡©w âŸ¨c', mds', mem'âŸ©â‡©w âŸ¹
   c' = Stop ;; c âˆ§ mem' = mem âˆ§ mds' = update_modes upd mds"
  apply(drule seq_elim, simp)
  apply(erule exE, clarsimp)
  apply(drule upd_elim)
  apply(drule skip_elim, clarsimp)
  done

lemma seq_assign_elim:
  "âŸ¨(x â† e) ;; c, mds, memâŸ©â‡©w â†â‡©w âŸ¨c', mds', mem'âŸ©â‡©w âŸ¹
   c' = Stop ;; c âˆ§ mds' = mds âˆ§ mem' = mem(x := evalâ‡©A mem e)"
  apply(drule seq_elim, simp)
  apply(erule exE, clarsimp)
  apply(drule assign_elim, clarsimp)
  done

lemma no_await_trans: 
  "âŸ¦ no_await c; âŸ¨c, mds, memâŸ©â‡©w â†â‡©w âŸ¨c', mds', mem'âŸ©â‡©w âŸ§ âŸ¹ no_await c'"
  apply (induct arbitrary: c' mds rule: "no_await.induct")
        using assign_elim "no_await.simps" apply blast
       apply (rename_tac c1 c2 c3 mds)
       apply (case_tac "c1 = Stop")
        apply (simp, frule seq_stop_elim, clarsimp)
        using seq_elim no_await.intros apply metis
       using if_elim no_await.intros apply blast
      apply (frule while_elim, clarsimp)
     apply (rename_tac c b)
     apply (subgoal_tac "no_await (While b c)")
      apply (subgoal_tac "no_await (c ;; While b c)")
       using no_await.intros apply blast
      using no_await.intros apply blast
     using no_await.intros apply blast
    using no_await.intros skip_elim apply fast
   using no_await.intros stop_no_eval apply fast
  using no_await.intros upd_elim by fast

lemma no_await_no_await[elim]: "âŸ¦ no_await c âŸ§ âŸ¹ c â‰  Await b c'"
  using no_await.cases Stmt.distinct by fast

lemma no_await_trancl_impl: 
  "âŸ¦ctx â†â‡©wâ‡§+ ctx'âŸ§ âŸ¹ no_await (fst (fst ctx)) âŸ¶ no_await (fst (fst ctx'))"
  apply (erule trancl.induct, clarsimp)
   using no_await_trans apply blast
  apply clarsimp
  using no_await_trans by blast
  
lemma no_await_trancl: 
  "âŸ¦ctx â†â‡©wâ‡§+ ctx'; no_await (fst (fst ctx))âŸ§ âŸ¹ no_await (fst (fst ctx'))" 
  using no_await_trancl_impl by blast

lemma await_elim: 
  "âŸ¦âŸ¨Await b câ‡©1, mds, memâŸ©â‡©w â†â‡©w âŸ¨câ‡©2, mds', mem'âŸ©â‡©wâŸ§ âŸ¹ 
    evalâ‡©B mem b âˆ§ no_await câ‡©1 âˆ§ is_final câ‡©2  âˆ§
    âŸ¨câ‡©1, mds, memâŸ©â‡©w â†â‡©wâ‡§+ âŸ¨câ‡©2, mds', mem'âŸ©â‡©w"
  apply (erule "evalâ‡©w.cases"; clarsimp)
   apply (subgoal_tac "cxt_to_stmt E c = Await b câ‡©1")
    apply (drule cxt_inv_await)
    using "evalâ‡©w_simple.cases" apply force
   apply simp
  by (metis Stmt.distinct(33) cxt_inv_await)
  
end

end

Theory TypeSystem

(*
Title: Value-Dependent SIFUM-Type-Systems
Authors: Toby Murray, Robert Sison, Edward Pierzchalski, Christine Rizkallah
(Based on the SIFUM-Type-Systems AFP entry, whose authors
 are: Sylvia Grewe, Heiko Mantel, Daniel Schoepe)
*)
section â€¹Type System for Ensuring SIFUM-Security of Commandsâ€º

theory TypeSystem
imports Compositionality Language
begin

subsection â€¹Typing Rulesâ€º

text â€¹
  Types now depend on memories. To see why, consider an assignment in which some variable
  @{term x} for which we have a @{term AsmNoReadOrWrite} assumption is assigned the value in 
  variable @{term input}, but where @{term input}'s classification depends on some control
  variable. Then the new type of @{term x} depends on memory. If we were to just take the 
  upper bound of @{term input}'s classification, this would likely give us @{term High} as
  @{term x}'s type, but that would prevent us from treating @{term x} as @{term Low}
  if we later learn @{term input}'s original classification. 
  
  Instead we need to make @{term x}'s type explicitly depend on memory so later on, once we
  learn @{term input}'s classification, we can resolve @{term x}'s type to a concrete
  security level.
  
  We choose to deeply embed types as sets of boolean expressions. If any expression in the
  set evaluates to @{term True}, the type is @{term High}; otherwise it is @{term Low}.
â€º
type_synonym 'BExp Type = "'BExp set"

text â€¹
  We require @{term Î“} to track all stable (i.e. @{term AsmNoWrite} or @{term AsmNoReadOrWrite}), 
  non-@{term ğ’} variables.
  
  This differs from Mantel a bit. Mantel would exclude from @{term Î“}, variables
  whose classification (according to @{term dma}) is @{term Low} for which we have only
  an @{term AsmNoWrite} assumption.
  
  We decouple the requirement for inclusion in @{term Î“} from a variable's classification
  so that we don't need to be updating @{term Î“} each time we alter a control variable.
  Even if we tried to keep @{term Î“} up-to-date in that case, we may not be able to 
  precisely compute the new classification of each variable after the modification anyway.
â€º
type_synonym ('Var,'BExp) TyEnv = "'Var â‡€ 'BExp Type"

text â€¹
  This records which variables are \emph{stable} in that we have an assumption
  implying that their value won't change. It duplicates a bit of info in
  @{term Î“} above but I haven't yet thought of a way to remove that duplication
  cleanly.
  
  The first component of the pair records variables for which we have
  @{term AsmNoWrite}; the second component is for @{term AsmNoReadOrWrite}.
  
  The reason we want to distinguish the different kinds of assumptions is to know whether
  a variable should remain in @{term Î“} when we drop an assumption on it. If we drop
  e.g. @{term AsmNoWrite} but also have @{term AsmNoReadOrWrite} then if we didn't track
  stability info this way we wouldn't know whether we had to remove the variable from
  @{term Î“} or not.
â€º
type_synonym 'Var Stable = "('Var set Ã— 'Var set)"

text â€¹
  We track a set of predicates on memories as we execute. If we evaluate a boolean expression
  all of whose variables are stable, then we enrich this set predicate with that one.
  If we assign to a stable variable, then we enrich this predicate also.
  If we release an assumption making a variable unstable, we need to remove all predicates that
  pertain to it from this set.
  
  This needs to be deeply embedded (i.e. it cannot be stored as a predicate of type
  @{typ "('Var,'Val) Mem â‡’ bool"} or even @{typ "('Var,'Val) Mem set"}), because we need to be 
  able to identify each individual predicate and for each predicate identify all of the
  variables in it, so we can discard the right predicates each time a variable becomes unstable.
â€º
type_synonym 'bexp preds = "'bexp set"

context sifum_lang_no_dma begin

definition
  pred :: "'BExp preds â‡’ ('Var,'Val) Mem â‡’ bool"
where
  "pred P â‰¡ Î»mem. (âˆ€pâˆˆP. evalâ‡©B mem p)"

end

locale sifum_types =
  sifum_lang_no_dma evâ‡©A evâ‡©B aexp_vars bexp_vars + sifum_security dma ğ’_vars ğ’ evalâ‡©w undefined
  for evâ‡©A :: "('Var, 'Val) Mem â‡’ 'AExp â‡’ 'Val"
  and evâ‡©B :: "('Var, 'Val) Mem â‡’ 'BExp â‡’ bool"
  and aexp_vars :: "'AExp â‡’ 'Var set"
  and bexp_vars :: "'BExp â‡’ 'Var set"
  and dma :: "('Var,'Val) Mem â‡’ 'Var â‡’ Sec"
  and ğ’_vars :: "'Var â‡’ 'Var set"
  and ğ’ :: "'Var set" +
  (* we need to be able to negate predicates, when we explore the ELSE branch of an IF *)
  fixes bexp_neg :: "'BExp â‡’ 'BExp"
  assumes bexp_neg_negates: "â‹€mem e. (evâ‡©B mem (bexp_neg e)) = (Â¬ (evâ‡©B mem e))" 
  (* we need to be able to compute a valid postcondition after an assignment *)
  fixes assign_post :: "'BExp preds â‡’ 'Var â‡’ 'AExp â‡’ 'BExp preds"
  assumes assign_post_valid: "â‹€mem. pred P mem âŸ¹ pred (assign_post P x e) (mem(x := evâ‡©A mem e))"
  fixes dma_type :: "'Var â‡’ 'BExp set"
  assumes dma_correct:
    "dma mem x = (if (âˆ€eâˆˆdma_type x. evâ‡©B mem e) then Low else High)"
  assumes ğ’_vars_correct:
    "ğ’_vars x = (â‹ƒ(bexp_vars ` dma_type x))"
  fixes pred_False :: 'BExp
  assumes pred_False_is_False: "Â¬ evâ‡©B mem pred_False"
  assumes bexp_vars_pred_False: "bexp_vars pred_False = {}"
  

(* a more specialised form of the above locale useful for the examples that provides
   a brain-dead instantiation for the assignment postcondition transformer *)
locale sifum_types_assign =
  sifum_lang_no_dma evâ‡©A evâ‡©B aexp_vars bexp_vars + sifum_security dma ğ’_vars ğ’ evalâ‡©w undefined
  for evâ‡©A :: "('Var, 'Val) Mem â‡’ 'AExp â‡’ 'Val"
  and evâ‡©B :: "('Var, 'Val) Mem â‡’ 'BExp â‡’ bool"
  and aexp_vars :: "'AExp â‡’ 'Var set"
  and bexp_vars :: "'BExp â‡’ 'Var set"
  and dma :: "('Var,'Val) Mem â‡’ 'Var â‡’ Sec"
  and ğ’_vars :: "'Var â‡’ 'Var set"
  and ğ’ :: "'Var set" +
  (* we need to be able to negate predicates, when we explore the ELSE branch of an IF *)
  fixes bexp_neg :: "'BExp â‡’ 'BExp"
  assumes bexp_neg_negates: "â‹€mem e. (evâ‡©B mem (bexp_neg e)) = (Â¬ (evâ‡©B mem e))" 
  fixes dma_type :: "'Var â‡’ 'BExp set"
  assumes dma_correct:
    "dma mem x = (if (âˆ€eâˆˆdma_type x. evâ‡©B mem e) then Low else High)"
  assumes ğ’_vars_correct:
    "ğ’_vars x = (â‹ƒ(bexp_vars ` dma_type x))"
  fixes pred_False :: 'BExp
  assumes pred_False_is_False: "Â¬ evâ‡©B mem pred_False"
  assumes bexp_vars_pred_False: "bexp_vars pred_False = {}"
  (* we need to be able to say "variable x has value e" when we assign (the evaluation of e) to x *)
  fixes bexp_assign :: "'Var â‡’ 'AExp â‡’ 'BExp"
  assumes bexp_assign_eval: "â‹€mem e x. (evâ‡©B mem (bexp_assign x e)) = (mem x = (evâ‡©A mem e))"
  assumes bexp_assign_vars: "â‹€e x. (bexp_vars (bexp_assign x e)) = aexp_vars e âˆª {x}"

(* things needed by both sifum_types_assign and sifum_types, before we prove the former a sublocale *)
context sifum_lang_no_dma begin

definition
  stable :: "'Var Stable â‡’ 'Var â‡’ bool"
where
  "stable ğ’® x â‰¡ x âˆˆ (fst ğ’® âˆª snd ğ’®)"

definition
  add_pred :: "'BExp preds â‡’ 'Var Stable â‡’ 'BExp â‡’ 'BExp preds" ("_ +â‡©_ _" [120, 120, 120] 1000)
where
  "P +â‡©ğ’® e â‰¡ (if (âˆ€xâˆˆbexp_vars e. stable ğ’® x) then P âˆª {e} else P)"

lemma add_pred_subset:
  "P âŠ† P +â‡©ğ’® p"
  apply(clarsimp simp: add_pred_def)
  done


(* TODO: overloads the syntax for partial functions --- pick something else? *)
definition
  restrict_preds_to_vars :: "'BExp preds â‡’ 'Var set â‡’ 'BExp preds" ("_ |` _" [120, 120] 1000)
where
  "P |` V â‰¡ {e. e âˆˆ P âˆ§ bexp_vars e âŠ† V}"

end

context sifum_types_assign begin


text â€¹
  the most simple assignment postcondition transformer
â€º
definition
  assign_post :: "'BExp preds â‡’ 'Var â‡’ 'AExp â‡’ 'BExp preds"
where
  "assign_post P x e â‰¡ 
           (if x âˆˆ (aexp_vars e) then 
              (restrict_preds_to_vars P  (-{x})) 
            else 
              (restrict_preds_to_vars P  (-{x})) âˆª {bexp_assign x e})"
 
end

sublocale sifum_types_assign âŠ† sifum_types _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ assign_post
  apply(unfold_locales)
     using bexp_neg_negates apply blast
    apply(clarsimp simp: assign_post_def pred_def | safe)+
       using eval_vars_detâ‡©B
       unfolding restrict_preds_to_vars_def
       apply (metis (mono_tags, lifting) ComplD fun_upd_other mem_Collect_eq singletonI subset_eq)
      unfolding bexp_assign_eval
      using eval_vars_detâ‡©A
      apply fastforce
     using eval_vars_detâ‡©B
     apply (metis (mono_tags, lifting) ComplD fun_upd_other mem_Collect_eq singletonI subset_eq)
    using dma_correct apply blast
   using ğ’_vars_correct pred_False_is_False bexp_vars_pred_False apply blast+
  done

context sifum_types
begin

(* Redefined since Isabelle does not seem to be able to reuse the abbreviation from the old locale *)
abbreviation 
  mm_equiv_abv2 :: "(_, _, _) LocalConf â‡’ (_, _, _) LocalConf â‡’ bool"
  (infix "â‰ˆ" 60)
where 
  "mm_equiv_abv2 c c' â‰¡ mm_equiv_abv c c'"

abbreviation 
  eval_abv2 :: "(_, 'Var, 'Val) LocalConf â‡’ (_, _, _) LocalConf â‡’ bool"
  (infixl "â†" 70)
where
  "x â† y â‰¡ (x, y) âˆˆ evalâ‡©w"
  
abbreviation 
  eval_plus_abv :: "(_, 'Var, 'Val) LocalConf â‡’ (_, _, _) LocalConf â‡’ bool"
  (infixl "â†â‡§+" 70)
where
  "x â†â‡§+ y â‰¡ (x, y) âˆˆ evalâ‡©wâ‡§+"
  
abbreviation 
  no_eval_abv :: "(_, 'Var, 'Val) LocalConf â‡’ bool" 
  ("_ â† âŠ¥")
where
  "x â† âŠ¥ â‰¡ âˆ€ y. (x, y) âˆ‰ evalâ‡©w"

abbreviation 
  low_indistinguishable_abv :: "'Var Mds â‡’ ('Var, 'AExp, 'BExp) Stmt â‡’ (_, _, _) Stmt â‡’ bool"
  ("_ âˆ¼Ä± _" [100, 100] 80)
where
  "c âˆ¼â‡˜mdsâ‡™ c' â‰¡ low_indistinguishable mds c c'"


abbreviation
  vars_of_type :: "'BExp Type â‡’ 'Var set"
where
  "vars_of_type t â‰¡ â‹ƒ(bexp_vars ` t)"
  
definition
  type_wellformed :: "'BExp Type â‡’ bool"
where
  "type_wellformed t â‰¡ vars_of_type t âŠ† ğ’"

lemma dma_type_wellformed [simp]:
  "type_wellformed (dma_type x)"
  apply(clarsimp simp: type_wellformed_def  ğ’_def | safe)+
  using ğ’_vars_correct apply blast
  done
  
definition 
  to_total :: "('Var,'BExp) TyEnv â‡’ 'Var â‡’ 'BExp Type"
where 
  "to_total Î“ â‰¡ Î»v. if v âˆˆ dom Î“ then the (Î“ v) else dma_type v"

definition
  types_wellformed :: "('Var,'BExp) TyEnv â‡’ bool"
where
  "types_wellformed Î“ â‰¡ âˆ€xâˆˆdom Î“. type_wellformed (the (Î“ x))"
  
lemma to_total_type_wellformed:
  "types_wellformed Î“ âŸ¹
  type_wellformed (to_total Î“ x)"
  by(auto simp: to_total_def types_wellformed_def)
  
lemma Un_type_wellformed:
  "âˆ€tâˆˆts. type_wellformed t âŸ¹ type_wellformed (â‹ƒ ts)"
  apply(clarsimp simp: type_wellformed_def | safe)+
  by(fastforce simp: ğ’_def elim!: subsetCE)

inductive 
  type_aexpr :: "('Var,'BExp) TyEnv â‡’ 'AExp â‡’ 'BExp Type â‡’ bool" ("_ âŠ¢â‡©a _ âˆˆ _" [120, 120, 120] 1000)
where
  type_aexpr [intro!]: "Î“ âŠ¢â‡©a e âˆˆ â‹ƒ (image (Î» x. to_total Î“ x) (aexp_vars e))"

lemma type_aexprI:
  "t =  â‹ƒ (image (Î» x. to_total Î“ x) (aexp_vars e)) âŸ¹ Î“ âŠ¢â‡©a e âˆˆ t"
  apply(erule ssubst)
  apply(rule type_aexpr.intros)
  done

lemma type_aexpr_type_wellformed:
  "types_wellformed Î“ âŸ¹ Î“ âŠ¢â‡©a e âˆˆ t âŸ¹ type_wellformed t"
  apply(erule type_aexpr.cases)
  apply(erule ssubst, rule Un_type_wellformed)
  apply clarsimp
  apply(blast intro: to_total_type_wellformed)
  done
  
inductive_cases type_aexpr_elim [elim]: "Î“ âŠ¢â‡©a e âˆˆ t"

inductive
  type_bexpr :: "('Var,'BExp) TyEnv â‡’ 'BExp â‡’ 'BExp Type â‡’ bool" ("_ âŠ¢â‡©b _ âˆˆ _ " [120, 120, 120] 1000)
where
  type_bexpr [intro!]: "Î“ âŠ¢â‡©b e âˆˆ â‹ƒ (image (Î» x. to_total Î“ x) (bexp_vars e))"

lemma type_bexprI:
  "t =  â‹ƒ (image (Î» x. to_total Î“ x) (bexp_vars e)) âŸ¹ Î“ âŠ¢â‡©b e âˆˆ t"
  apply(erule ssubst)
  apply(rule type_bexpr.intros)
  done

lemma type_bexpr_type_wellformed:
  "types_wellformed Î“ âŸ¹ Î“ âŠ¢â‡©b e âˆˆ t âŸ¹ type_wellformed t"
  apply(erule type_bexpr.cases)
  apply(erule ssubst, rule Un_type_wellformed)
  apply clarsimp
  apply(blast intro: to_total_type_wellformed)
  done
  
inductive_cases type_bexpr_elim [elim]: "Î“ âŠ¢â‡©b e âˆˆ t"


text â€¹
  Define a sufficient condition for a type to be stable, assuming the type is wellformed.
  
  We need this because there is no point tracking the fact that e.g. variable @{term x}'s data has
  a classification that depends on some control variable @{term c} (where @{term c} might be
  the control variable for some other variable @{term y} whose value we've just assigned to
  @{term x}) if @{term c} can then go and be modified, since now the classification of
  the data in @{term x} no longer depends on the value of @{term c}, instead it depends on
  @{term c}'s \emph{old} value, which has now been lost.
  
  Therefore, if a type depends on @{term c}, then @{term c} had better be stable.
â€º
abbreviation
  pred_stable :: "'Var Stable â‡’ 'BExp â‡’ bool"
where
  "pred_stable ğ’® p â‰¡ âˆ€xâˆˆbexp_vars p. stable ğ’® x"

abbreviation
  type_stable :: "'Var Stable â‡’ 'BExp Type â‡’ bool"
where
  "type_stable ğ’® t â‰¡ (âˆ€pâˆˆt. pred_stable ğ’® p)"
  
lemma type_stable_is_sufficient:
  "âŸ¦type_stable ğ’® tâŸ§ âŸ¹
  âˆ€mem mem'. (âˆ€x. stable ğ’® x âŸ¶ mem x = mem' x) âŸ¶ (evâ‡©B mem) ` t = (evâ‡©B mem') ` t"
  apply(clarsimp simp: type_wellformed_def image_def)
  apply safe
   using eval_vars_detâ‡©B apply blast+
  done
  
definition 
  mds_consistent :: "'Var Mds â‡’ ('Var,'BExp) TyEnv â‡’ 'Var Stable â‡’ 'BExp preds â‡’ bool"
where 
  "mds_consistent mds Î“ ğ’® P â‰¡
    (ğ’® = (mds AsmNoWrite, mds AsmNoReadOrWrite)) âˆ§
    (dom Î“ = {x. x âˆ‰ ğ’ âˆ§ stable ğ’® x}) âˆ§
    (âˆ€p âˆˆ P. pred_stable ğ’® p)"

fun 
  add_anno_dom :: "('Var,'BExp) TyEnv â‡’ 'Var Stable â‡’ 'Var ModeUpd â‡’ 'Var set"
where
  "add_anno_dom Î“ ğ’® (Acq v AsmNoReadOrWrite) = (if v âˆ‰ ğ’ then dom Î“ âˆª {v} else dom Î“)" |
  "add_anno_dom Î“ ğ’® (Acq v AsmNoWrite) = (if v âˆ‰ ğ’ then dom Î“ âˆª {v} else dom Î“)" |
  "add_anno_dom Î“ ğ’® (Acq v _) = dom Î“" |
  "add_anno_dom Î“ ğ’® (Rel v AsmNoReadOrWrite) = (if v âˆ‰ fst ğ’® then dom Î“ - {v} else dom Î“)" |
  "add_anno_dom Î“ ğ’® (Rel v AsmNoWrite) = (if v âˆ‰ snd ğ’® then dom Î“ - {v} else dom Î“)" |
  "add_anno_dom Î“ ğ’® (Rel v _) = dom Î“"

definition 
  add_anno :: "('Var,'BExp) TyEnv â‡’ 'Var Stable â‡’ 'Var ModeUpd â‡’ ('Var,'BExp) TyEnv" ("_ âŠ•â‡©_ _" [120, 120, 120] 1000)
where
  "Î“ âŠ•â‡©ğ’® upd = restrict_map (Î»x. Some (to_total Î“ x)) (add_anno_dom Î“ ğ’® upd)"

lemma add_anno_acq_AsmNoReadOrWrite_idemp [simp]:
  "v âˆˆ dom Î“ âˆ¨ v âˆˆ ğ’ âŸ¹ Î“ âŠ•â‡©ğ’® (Acq v AsmNoReadOrWrite) = Î“"
  apply(safe | clarsimp simp: add_anno_def to_total_def)+
    apply(rule ext)
    apply(clarsimp simp: restrict_map_def | safe)+
    apply(case_tac "Î“ x", fastforce+)[5]
   apply(rule ext)
   apply(clarsimp simp: restrict_map_def | safe)+
   apply(case_tac "Î“ x", fastforce+)
  apply(safe | clarsimp simp: add_anno_def to_total_def)+
  apply(rule ext)
  apply(clarsimp simp: restrict_map_def | safe)+
  apply(case_tac "Î“ x", fastforce+)
  done

lemma add_anno_rel_AsmNoReadOrWrite_idemp [simp]:
  "âŸ¦v âˆ‰ dom Î“; v âˆ‰ fst ğ’®âŸ§ âŸ¹ Î“ âŠ•â‡©ğ’® (Rel v AsmNoReadOrWrite) = Î“"
  apply(subgoal_tac "v âˆ‰ dom Î“")
   apply(safe | clarsimp simp: add_anno_def to_total_def)+
  apply(clarsimp simp: restrict_map_def | safe)+
  apply(erule_tac P="(Î»x. if x âˆˆ dom Î“ âˆ§ x â‰  v
          then Some (if x âˆˆ dom Î“ then the (Î“ x) else dma_type x) else None) = Î“" in notE)
  apply(rule ext)
  apply(case_tac "Î“ x", fastforce+)
  done

lemma add_anno_acq_AsmNoReadOrWrite [simp]:
  assumes notin [simp]: "v âˆ‰ dom Î“"
  shows "v âˆ‰ ğ’ âŸ¹ Î“ âŠ•â‡©ğ’® (Acq v AsmNoReadOrWrite) = (Î“(v â†¦ dma_type v))"
  apply(safe | clarsimp simp: add_anno_def to_total_def)+
  apply(clarsimp simp: restrict_map_def | safe)+
  apply(rule ext)
  apply(auto intro: sym)
  done

lemma add_anno_rel_AsmNoReadOrWrite [simp]:
  assumes isin [simp]: "v âˆˆ dom Î“"
  shows "v âˆ‰ fst ğ’® âŸ¹ Î“ âŠ•â‡©ğ’® (Rel v AsmNoReadOrWrite) = restrict_map Î“ ((dom Î“) - {v})"
  apply(safe | clarsimp simp: add_anno_def to_total_def)+
  apply(clarsimp simp: restrict_map_def | safe)+
  apply(rule ext)
  apply(auto intro: sym)
  done

lemma add_anno_acq_AsmNoWrite_idemp [simp]:
  "v âˆˆ dom Î“ âˆ¨ v âˆˆ ğ’ âŸ¹ Î“ âŠ•â‡©ğ’® (Acq v AsmNoWrite) = Î“"
  apply(safe | clarsimp simp: add_anno_def to_total_def)+
    apply(rule ext)
    apply(clarsimp simp: restrict_map_def | safe)+
    apply(case_tac "Î“ x", fastforce+)[5]
   apply(rule ext)
   apply(clarsimp simp: restrict_map_def | safe)+
   apply(case_tac "Î“ x", fastforce+)
  apply(safe | clarsimp simp: add_anno_def to_total_def)+
  apply(rule ext)
  apply(clarsimp simp: restrict_map_def | safe)+
  apply(case_tac "Î“ x", fastforce+)
  done

lemma add_anno_rel_AsmNoWrite_idemp [simp]:
  "âŸ¦v âˆ‰ dom Î“; v âˆ‰ snd ğ’®âŸ§ âŸ¹ Î“ âŠ•â‡©ğ’® (Rel v AsmNoWrite) = Î“"
  apply(subgoal_tac "v âˆ‰ dom Î“")
   apply(safe | clarsimp simp: add_anno_def to_total_def)+
  apply(clarsimp simp: restrict_map_def | safe)+
  apply(erule_tac P="(Î»x. if x âˆˆ dom Î“ âˆ§ x â‰  v
          then Some (if x âˆˆ dom Î“ then the (Î“ x) else dma_type x) else None) = Î“" in notE)
  apply(rule ext)
  apply(case_tac "Î“ x", fastforce+)
  done

lemma add_anno_acq_AsmNoWrite [simp]:
  assumes notin [simp]: "v âˆ‰ dom Î“"
  shows "v âˆ‰ ğ’ âŸ¹ Î“ âŠ•â‡©ğ’® (Acq v AsmNoWrite) = (Î“(v â†¦ dma_type v))"
  apply(safe | clarsimp simp: add_anno_def to_total_def)+
  apply(clarsimp simp: restrict_map_def | safe)+
  apply(rule ext)
  apply(auto intro: sym)
  done

lemma add_anno_rel_AsmNoWrite [simp]:
  assumes isin [simp]: "v âˆˆ dom Î“"
  shows "v âˆ‰ snd ğ’® âŸ¹ Î“ âŠ•â‡©ğ’® (Rel v AsmNoWrite) = restrict_map Î“ ((dom Î“) - {v})"
  apply(safe | clarsimp simp: add_anno_def to_total_def)+
  apply(clarsimp simp: restrict_map_def | safe)+
  apply(rule ext)
  apply(auto intro: sym)
  done
  
fun 
  add_anno_stable :: "'Var Stable â‡’ 'Var ModeUpd â‡’ 'Var Stable"
where
  "add_anno_stable ğ’® (Acq v AsmNoReadOrWrite) = (fst ğ’®, snd ğ’® âˆª {v})" |
  "add_anno_stable ğ’® (Acq v AsmNoWrite) = (fst ğ’® âˆª {v}, snd ğ’®)" |
  "add_anno_stable ğ’® (Acq v _) = ğ’®" |
  "add_anno_stable ğ’® (Rel v AsmNoReadOrWrite) = (fst ğ’®, snd ğ’® - {v})" |
  "add_anno_stable ğ’® (Rel v AsmNoWrite) = (fst ğ’® - {v}, snd ğ’®)" |
  "add_anno_stable ğ’® (Rel v _) = ğ’®"

definition
  pred_entailment :: "'BExp preds â‡’ 'BExp preds â‡’ bool" (infix "âŠ¢" 70)
where
  "P âŠ¢ P' â‰¡ âˆ€mem. pred P mem âŸ¶ pred P' mem"

text â€¹
  We give a predicate interpretation of subtype and then prove it has the correct
  semantic property.
â€º
definition
  subtype :: "'BExp Type â‡’ 'BExp preds â‡’ 'BExp Type â‡’ bool" ("_ â‰¤:â‡©_ _" [120, 120, 120] 1000)
where
  "t â‰¤:â‡©P t' â‰¡ (P âˆª t') âŠ¢ t"

definition
  type_max :: "'BExp Type â‡’ ('Var,'Val) Mem â‡’ Sec"
where
  "type_max t mem â‰¡ if (âˆ€pâˆˆt. evâ‡©B mem p) then Low else High"

lemma type_stable_is_sufficient':
  "âŸ¦type_stable ğ’® tâŸ§ âŸ¹
  âˆ€mem mem'. (âˆ€x. stable ğ’® x âŸ¶ mem x = mem' x) âŸ¶ type_max t mem = type_max t mem'"
  using type_stable_is_sufficient
  unfolding type_max_def image_def
  by (metis (no_types, lifting) eval_vars_detâ‡©B)

lemma subtype_sound:
  "t â‰¤:â‡©P t' âŸ¹ âˆ€mem. pred P mem âŸ¶ type_max t mem â‰¤ type_max t' mem"
  apply(fastforce simp: subtype_def pred_entailment_def pred_def type_max_def less_eq_Sec_def)
  done

lemma subtype_complete:
  assumes a: "â‹€mem. pred P mem âŸ¹ type_max t mem â‰¤ type_max t' mem"
  shows "t â‰¤:â‡©P t'"
unfolding subtype_def pred_entailment_def
proof (clarify)
  fix mem
  assume p: "pred (P âˆª t') mem"
  hence "pred P mem"
    unfolding pred_def by blast
  with a have tmax: "type_max t mem â‰¤ type_max t' mem" by blast
  from p have t': "pred t' mem"
    unfolding pred_def by blast
  from t' have "type_max t' mem = Low"
    unfolding type_max_def pred_def by force
  with tmax have "type_max t mem â‰¤ Low"
    by simp
  hence "type_max t mem = Low"
    unfolding less_eq_Sec_def by blast
  thus "pred t mem"
    unfolding type_max_def pred_def by (auto split: if_splits)
qed

lemma subtype_correct:
  "(t â‰¤:â‡©P t')  = (âˆ€mem. pred P mem âŸ¶ type_max t mem â‰¤ type_max t' mem)"
  apply(rule iffI)
   apply(simp add: subtype_sound)
  apply(simp add: subtype_complete)
  done

definition
  type_equiv :: "'BExp Type â‡’ 'BExp preds â‡’ 'BExp Type â‡’ bool" ("_ =:â‡©_ _" [120, 120, 120] 1000)
where
  "t =:â‡©P t' â‰¡ t â‰¤:â‡©P t' âˆ§ t' â‰¤:â‡©P t"
  

lemma subtype_refl [simp]:
  "t â‰¤:â‡©P t"
  by(simp add: subtype_def pred_entailment_def pred_def)

lemma type_equiv_refl [simp]:
  "t =:â‡©P t"
  by (simp add: type_equiv_def)
  
definition
  anno_type_stable :: "('Var,'BExp) TyEnv â‡’ 'Var Stable â‡’ 'Var ModeUpd â‡’ bool"
where
  "anno_type_stable Î“ ğ’® upd â‰¡ (case upd of (Rel v m) â‡’
                                 (v âˆˆ ğ’ âˆ§ v âˆ‰ add_anno_dom Î“ ğ’® upd) âŸ¶
                                    (âˆ€xâˆˆdom Î“. v âˆ‰ vars_of_type (the (Î“ x)))
                                          | (Acq v m) â‡’ 
                                    (v âˆ‰ ğ’ âˆ§ vâˆˆadd_anno_dom Î“ ğ’® upd - dom Î“) âŸ¶
                                      (âˆ€xâˆˆğ’_vars v. stable ğ’® x))"

definition
  anno_type_sec :: "('Var,'BExp) TyEnv â‡’ 'Var Stable â‡’  'BExp preds â‡’ 'Var ModeUpd â‡’ bool"
where
  "anno_type_sec Î“ ğ’® P upd â‰¡ (case upd of (Rel v AsmNoReadOrWrite) â‡’
                                (v âˆˆ add_anno_dom Î“ ğ’® upd âŸ¶ (the (Î“ v)) â‰¤:â‡©P (dma_type v))
                                          |  _ â‡’ True)"

definition
  types_stable :: "('Var,'BExp) TyEnv â‡’ 'Var Stable â‡’ bool"
where
  "types_stable Î“ ğ’® â‰¡ âˆ€xâˆˆdom Î“. type_stable ğ’® (the (Î“ x))"
  
definition
  tyenv_wellformed :: "'Var Mds â‡’ ('Var,'BExp) TyEnv â‡’ 'Var Stable â‡’ 'BExp preds â‡’ bool"
where
  "tyenv_wellformed mds Î“ ğ’® P â‰¡ 
      mds_consistent mds Î“ ğ’® P âˆ§
      types_wellformed Î“ âˆ§ types_stable Î“ ğ’®"

lemma subset_entailment:
  "P' âŠ† P âŸ¹ P âŠ¢ P'"
  apply(auto simp: pred_entailment_def pred_def)
  done

lemma pred_entailment_refl [simp]:
  "P âŠ¢ P"
  by(simp add: pred_entailment_def)

lemma pred_entailment_mono:
  "P âŠ¢ P' âŸ¹ P âŠ† P'' âŸ¹ P'' âŠ¢ P'"
  by(auto simp: pred_entailment_def pred_def)
  
lemma type_equiv_subset:
  "type_equiv t P t' âŸ¹ P âŠ† P' âŸ¹ type_equiv t P' t'"
  apply(auto simp: type_equiv_def subtype_def intro: pred_entailment_mono)
  done
  
definition
  context_equiv :: "('Var,'BExp) TyEnv â‡’ 'BExp preds â‡’ ('Var,'BExp) TyEnv â‡’ bool" ("_ =:â‡©_ _" [120, 120, 120] 1000)
where
  "Î“ =:â‡©P Î“' â‰¡ dom Î“ = dom Î“' âˆ§
                           (âˆ€xâˆˆdom Î“'. type_equiv (the (Î“ x)) P (the (Î“' x)))"

lemma context_equiv_refl[simp]:
  "context_equiv Î“ P Î“"
  by(simp add: context_equiv_def)

lemma context_equiv_subset:
  "context_equiv Î“ P Î“' âŸ¹ P âŠ† P' âŸ¹ context_equiv Î“ P' Î“'"
  apply(auto simp: context_equiv_def intro: type_equiv_subset)
  done

lemma pred_entailment_trans:
  "P âŠ¢ P' âŸ¹ P' âŠ¢ P'' âŸ¹ P âŠ¢ P''"
  by(auto simp: pred_entailment_def)

lemma pred_un [simp]:
  "pred (P âˆª P') mem = (pred P mem âˆ§ pred P' mem)"
  apply(auto simp: pred_def)
  done
  
lemma pred_entailment_un:
  "P âŠ¢ P' âŸ¹ P âŠ¢ P'' âŸ¹ P âŠ¢ (P' âˆª P'')"
  apply(subst pred_entailment_def)
  apply clarsimp
  apply(fastforce simp: pred_entailment_def)
  done

lemma pred_entailment_mono_un:
  "P âŠ¢ P' âŸ¹ (P âˆª P'') âŠ¢ (P' âˆª P'')"
  apply(auto simp: pred_entailment_def pred_def)
  done
  
lemma subtype_trans:
  "t â‰¤:â‡©P t' âŸ¹ t' â‰¤:â‡©P' t'' âŸ¹ P âŠ¢ P' âŸ¹ t â‰¤:â‡©P t''"
  "t â‰¤:â‡©P' t' âŸ¹ t' â‰¤:â‡©P t'' âŸ¹ P âŠ¢ P' âŸ¹ t â‰¤:â‡©P t''"
   apply(clarsimp simp: subtype_def)
   apply(rule pred_entailment_trans)
    prefer 2
    apply assumption
   apply(rule pred_entailment_un)
    apply(blast intro: subset_entailment)
   apply(rule pred_entailment_trans)
    prefer 2
    apply assumption
   apply(blast intro: pred_entailment_mono_un)
  apply(clarsimp simp: subtype_def)
  apply(rule pred_entailment_trans)
   prefer 2
   apply assumption
  apply(rule pred_entailment_un)
   apply(blast intro: pred_entailment_mono)
  apply(blast intro: subset_entailment)
  done
  
lemma type_equiv_trans:
  "type_equiv t P t' âŸ¹ type_equiv t' P' t'' âŸ¹ P âŠ¢ P' âŸ¹ type_equiv t P t''"
  apply(auto simp: type_equiv_def intro: subtype_trans)
  done

lemma context_equiv_trans:
  "context_equiv Î“ P Î“' âŸ¹ context_equiv Î“' P' Î“'' âŸ¹ P âŠ¢ P' âŸ¹ context_equiv Î“ P Î“''"
  apply(force simp: context_equiv_def intro: type_equiv_trans)
  done

lemma un_pred_entailment_mono:
  "(P âˆª P') âŠ¢ P'' âŸ¹ P''' âŠ¢ P âŸ¹ (P''' âˆª P') âŠ¢ P''"
  unfolding pred_entailment_def pred_def
  apply blast
  done
  
lemma subtype_entailment:
  "t â‰¤:â‡©P t' âŸ¹ P' âŠ¢ P âŸ¹ t â‰¤:â‡©P' t'"
  apply(auto simp: subtype_def intro: un_pred_entailment_mono)
  done
  
lemma type_equiv_entailment:
  "type_equiv t P t' âŸ¹ P' âŠ¢ P âŸ¹ type_equiv t P' t'"
  apply(auto simp: type_equiv_def intro: subtype_entailment)  
  done
  
lemma context_equiv_entailment:
  "context_equiv Î“ P Î“' âŸ¹ P' âŠ¢ P âŸ¹ context_equiv Î“ P' Î“'"
  apply(auto simp: context_equiv_def intro: type_equiv_entailment)
  done


  
  
inductive 
  has_type :: "('Var,'BExp) TyEnv â‡’ 'Var Stable â‡’ 'BExp preds â‡’ ('Var, 'AExp, 'BExp) Stmt â‡’ ('Var,'BExp) TyEnv â‡’ 'Var Stable â‡’ 'BExp preds â‡’ bool"
  ("âŠ¢ _,_,_ {_} _,_,_" [120, 120, 120, 120, 120, 120, 120] 1000)
where
  stop_type [intro]: "âŠ¢ Î“,ğ’®,P {Stop} Î“,ğ’®,P" |
  skip_type [intro] : "âŠ¢ Î“,ğ’®,P {Skip} Î“,ğ’®,P" |
  assignâ‡©ğ’ : 
  "âŸ¦x âˆˆ ğ’; Î“ âŠ¢â‡©a e âˆˆ t; P âŠ¢ t; (âˆ€vâˆˆdom Î“. x âˆ‰ vars_of_type (the (Î“ v))); 
    P' = restrict_preds_to_vars (assign_post P x e) {v. stable ğ’® v}; 
    âˆ€v. x âˆˆ ğ’_vars v âˆ§ v âˆ‰ snd ğ’® âŸ¶ P âŠ¢ (to_total Î“ v) âˆ§ 
                                      (to_total Î“ v) â‰¤:â‡©P' (dma_type v) âŸ§ âŸ¹ 
   âŠ¢ Î“,ğ’®,P {x â† e} Î“,ğ’®,P'" | 
  assignâ‡©1 : 
  "âŸ¦ x âˆ‰ dom Î“ ; x âˆ‰ ğ’; Î“ âŠ¢â‡©a e âˆˆ t; t â‰¤:â‡©P (dma_type x); 
     P' = restrict_preds_to_vars (assign_post P x e)  {v. stable ğ’® v} âŸ§ âŸ¹ 
   âŠ¢ Î“,ğ’®,P {x â† e} Î“,ğ’®,P'" |
  assignâ‡©2 : 
  "âŸ¦ x âˆˆ dom Î“ ; Î“ âŠ¢â‡©a e âˆˆ t;  type_stable ğ’® t; P' = restrict_preds_to_vars (assign_post P x e) {v. stable ğ’® v}; 
     x âˆ‰ snd ğ’® âŸ¶ t â‰¤:â‡©P' (dma_type x) âŸ§ âŸ¹ 
   has_type Î“ ğ’® P (x â† e) (Î“ (x := Some t)) ğ’® P'" |
  if_type [intro]: 
  "âŸ¦ Î“ âŠ¢â‡©b e âˆˆ t; P âŠ¢ t; 
     âŠ¢ Î“,ğ’®,(P +â‡©ğ’® e) { câ‡©1 } Î“',ğ’®',P'; âŠ¢ Î“,ğ’®,(P +â‡©ğ’® (bexp_neg e)) { câ‡©2 } Î“'',ğ’®',P''; 
     context_equiv Î“' P' Î“'''; context_equiv Î“'' P'' Î“'''; P' âŠ¢ P'''; P'' âŠ¢ P'''; 
     âˆ€mds. tyenv_wellformed mds Î“' ğ’®' P' âŸ¶ tyenv_wellformed mds Î“''' ğ’®' P'''; 
     âˆ€mds. tyenv_wellformed mds Î“'' ğ’®' P'' âŸ¶ tyenv_wellformed mds Î“''' ğ’®' P''' âŸ§ âŸ¹ 
   âŠ¢ Î“,ğ’®,P { If e câ‡©1 câ‡©2 } Î“''',ğ’®',P'''" | 
  while_type [intro]: "âŸ¦ Î“ âŠ¢â‡©b e âˆˆ t ; P âŠ¢ t; âŠ¢ Î“,ğ’®,(P +â‡©ğ’® e) { c } Î“,ğ’®,P âŸ§ âŸ¹ âŠ¢ Î“,ğ’®,P { While e c } Î“,ğ’®,P" |
  anno_type [intro]: "âŸ¦ Î“' = Î“ âŠ•â‡©ğ’® upd ; ğ’®' = add_anno_stable ğ’® upd; P' = restrict_preds_to_vars P {v. stable ğ’®' v};
                 âŠ¢ Î“',ğ’®',P' { c } Î“'',ğ’®'',P'' ; c â‰  Stop ;
                 (â‹€ x. (to_total Î“ x) â‰¤:â‡©P' (to_total Î“' x));
                 anno_type_stable Î“ ğ’® upd; anno_type_sec Î“ ğ’® P updâŸ§ âŸ¹ âŠ¢ Î“,ğ’®,P { c@[upd] } Î“'',ğ’®'',P''" |
  seq_type [intro]: "âŸ¦ âŠ¢ Î“,ğ’®,P { câ‡©1 } Î“',ğ’®',P' ; âŠ¢ Î“',ğ’®',P' { câ‡©2 } Î“'',ğ’®'',P'' âŸ§ âŸ¹ âŠ¢ Î“,ğ’®,P { câ‡©1 ;; câ‡©2 } Î“'',ğ’®'',P''" |
  sub : "âŸ¦ âŠ¢ Î“â‡©1,ğ’®,Pâ‡©1 { c } Î“â‡©1',ğ’®',Pâ‡©1' ; context_equiv Î“â‡©2 Pâ‡©2 Î“â‡©1 ; (âˆ€mds. tyenv_wellformed mds Î“â‡©2 ğ’® Pâ‡©2 âŸ¶ tyenv_wellformed mds Î“â‡©1 ğ’® Pâ‡©1);
           (âˆ€mds. tyenv_wellformed mds Î“â‡©1' ğ’®' Pâ‡©1' âŸ¶ tyenv_wellformed mds Î“â‡©2' ğ’®' Pâ‡©2'); context_equiv Î“â‡©1' Pâ‡©1' Î“â‡©2'; Pâ‡©2 âŠ¢ Pâ‡©1; Pâ‡©1' âŠ¢ Pâ‡©2' âŸ§ âŸ¹ âŠ¢ Î“â‡©2,ğ’®,Pâ‡©2 { c } Î“â‡©2',ğ’®',Pâ‡©2'" |
 await_type [intro]: 
  "âŸ¦ Î“ âŠ¢â‡©b e âˆˆ t; P âŠ¢ t; 
     âŠ¢ Î“,ğ’®,(P +â‡©ğ’® e) { c } Î“',ğ’®',P' âŸ§ âŸ¹ 
   âŠ¢ Î“,ğ’®,P { Await e c } Î“',ğ’®',P'"

lemma sub':
  "âŸ¦ context_equiv Î“â‡©2 Pâ‡©2 Î“â‡©1 ;
    (âˆ€mds. tyenv_wellformed mds Î“â‡©2 ğ’® Pâ‡©2 âŸ¶ tyenv_wellformed mds Î“â‡©1 ğ’® Pâ‡©1);
    (âˆ€mds. tyenv_wellformed mds Î“â‡©1' ğ’®' Pâ‡©1' âŸ¶ tyenv_wellformed mds Î“â‡©2' ğ’®' Pâ‡©2');
    context_equiv Î“â‡©1' Pâ‡©1' Î“â‡©2';
    Pâ‡©2 âŠ¢ Pâ‡©1;
    Pâ‡©1' âŠ¢ Pâ‡©2';
    âŠ¢ Î“â‡©1,ğ’®,Pâ‡©1 { c } Î“â‡©1',ğ’®',Pâ‡©1' âŸ§ âŸ¹
  âŠ¢ Î“â‡©2,ğ’®,Pâ‡©2 { c } Î“â‡©2',ğ’®',Pâ‡©2'"
  by(rule sub)

lemma assignâ‡©2_helper:
  "âŸ¦Î“ x = Some t; has_type Î“ ğ’® P (x â† e) (Î“(x â†¦ t)) ğ’® P'âŸ§ âŸ¹ has_type Î“ ğ’® P (x â† e) Î“ ğ’® P'"
  by (simp add:map_upd_triv)

lemma conc':
  "âŸ¦ âŠ¢ Î“â‡©1,ğ’®,P { c } Î“',ğ’®',P'; 
    Î“â‡©1 = (Î“â‡©2(x â†¦ t)); 
    x âˆˆ dom Î“â‡©2; 
    type_equiv (the (Î“â‡©2 x)) P t; 
    type_wellformed t; 
    type_stable ğ’® t  âŸ§ âŸ¹ 
  âŠ¢ Î“â‡©2,ğ’®,P { c } Î“',ğ’®',P'"  
  apply(erule sub)
      apply(fastforce simp: context_equiv_def)
     apply(clarsimp simp: tyenv_wellformed_def mds_consistent_def)
     apply(rule conjI)
      apply fastforce
     apply(rule conjI)
      apply(fastforce simp: types_wellformed_def)
     apply(fastforce simp: types_stable_def)
     apply blast
    apply simp+
  done

lemma tyenv_wellformed_subset:
  "tyenv_wellformed mds Î“ ğ’® P âŸ¹ P' âŠ† P âŸ¹ tyenv_wellformed mds Î“ ğ’® P'"
  apply(auto simp: tyenv_wellformed_def mds_consistent_def)
  done

lemma if_type':
  "âŸ¦ Î“ âŠ¢â‡©b e âˆˆ t; 
    P âŠ¢ t; 
    âŠ¢ Î“,ğ’®,(P +â‡©ğ’® e) { câ‡©1 } Î“',ğ’®',P'; 
    âŠ¢ Î“,ğ’®,(P +â‡©ğ’® (bexp_neg e)) { câ‡©2 } Î“',ğ’®',P''; 
    P''' âŠ† P' âˆ© P'' âŸ§ âŸ¹ 
  âŠ¢ Î“,ğ’®,P { If e câ‡©1 câ‡©2 } Î“',ğ’®',P'''"
  apply(erule (3) if_type)
       apply(rule context_equiv_refl)
      apply(rule context_equiv_refl)
     apply(blast intro: subset_entailment)+
   apply(blast intro: tyenv_wellformed_subset)+
  done

lemma skip_type':
  "âŸ¦Î“ = Î“'; ğ’® = ğ’®'; P = P'âŸ§ âŸ¹ âŠ¢ Î“,ğ’®,P {Skip} Î“',ğ’®',P'"
  using skip_type by simp

text â€¹
  Some helper lemmas to discharge the assumption of the @{thm anno_type} rule.
â€º
lemma anno_type_helpers [simp]:
  "(to_total Î“ x) â‰¤:â‡©P (to_total (add_anno Î“ ğ’® (buffer +=â‡©m AsmNoWrite)) x)"
  "(to_total Î“ x) â‰¤:â‡©P (to_total (add_anno Î“ ğ’® (buffer +=â‡©m AsmNoReadOrWrite)) x)"
  apply(auto simp: to_total_def add_anno_def subtype_def intro: subset_entailment)
  done

subsection â€¹Typing Soundnessâ€º

text â€¹The following predicate is needed to exclude some pathological
  cases, that abuse the @{term Stop} command which is not allowed to
  occur in actual programs.â€º


inductive_cases has_type_elim: "âŠ¢ Î“,ğ’®,P { c } Î“',ğ’®',P'"
inductive_cases has_type_stop_elim: "âŠ¢ Î“,ğ’®,P { Stop } Î“',ğ’®',P'"

definition tyenv_eq :: "('Var,'BExp) TyEnv â‡’ ('Var, 'Val) Mem â‡’ ('Var, 'Val) Mem â‡’ bool"
  (infix "=Ä±" 60)
  where "memâ‡©1 =â‡˜Î“â‡™ memâ‡©2 â‰¡ âˆ€ x. (type_max (to_total Î“ x) memâ‡©1 = Low âŸ¶ memâ‡©1 x = memâ‡©2 x)"

lemma type_max_dma_type [simp]:
  "type_max (dma_type x) mem = dma mem x"
  using dma_correct unfolding type_max_def apply auto
  done

  
text â€¹
  This result followed trivially for Mantel et al., but we need to know that the
  type environment is wellformed.
â€º
lemma tyenv_eq_sym': 
  "dom Î“ âˆ© ğ’ = {} âŸ¹ types_wellformed Î“ âŸ¹ memâ‡©1 =â‡˜Î“â‡™ memâ‡©2 âŸ¹ memâ‡©2 =â‡˜Î“â‡™ memâ‡©1"
proof(clarsimp simp: tyenv_eq_def)
  fix x
  assume a: "âˆ€x. type_max (to_total Î“ x) memâ‡©1 = Low âŸ¶ memâ‡©1 x = memâ‡©2 x"
  assume b: "dom Î“ âˆ© ğ’ = {}"
  from a b have eq_ğ’: "âˆ€xâˆˆğ’. memâ‡©1 x = memâ‡©2 x"
    by (fastforce simp: to_total_def ğ’_Low type_max_dma_type split: if_splits)
  hence "dma memâ‡©1 = dma memâ‡©2"
    by (rule dma_ğ’)
  hence dma_type_eq: "type_max (dma_type x) memâ‡©1 = type_max (dma_type x) memâ‡©2"
    by(simp)
  assume c: "types_wellformed Î“"
  
  assume d: "type_max (to_total Î“ x) memâ‡©2 = Low"
  show "memâ‡©2 x = memâ‡©1 x"
  proof(cases "x âˆˆ dom Î“")
    assume in_dom: "x âˆˆ dom Î“"
    from this obtain t where t: "Î“ x = Some t" by blast
    from this in_dom c have "type_wellformed t" by (force simp: types_wellformed_def)
    hence "âˆ€xâˆˆvars_of_type t. memâ‡©1 x = memâ‡©2 x"
      using eq_ğ’ unfolding type_wellformed_def by blast
    hence t_eq: "type_max t memâ‡©1 = type_max t memâ‡©2" 
      unfolding type_max_def using eval_vars_detâ‡©B
      by fastforce
    with in_dom t have "to_total Î“ x = t"
      by (auto simp: to_total_def)
    with t_eq have "type_max (to_total Î“ x) memâ‡©2 = type_max (to_total Î“ x) memâ‡©1" by simp
    with d have "type_max (to_total Î“ x) memâ‡©1 = Low" by simp
    with a show ?thesis by (metis sym)
  next
    assume "x âˆ‰ dom Î“"
    hence "to_total Î“ x = dma_type x"
      by (auto simp: to_total_def)
    with dma_type_eq have "type_max (to_total Î“ x) memâ‡©2 = type_max (to_total Î“ x) memâ‡©1" by simp
    with d have "type_max (to_total Î“ x) memâ‡©1 = Low" by simp
    with a show ?thesis by (metis sym)
  qed
qed

lemma tyenv_eq_sym:
  "tyenv_wellformed mds Î“ ğ’® P âŸ¹ memâ‡©1 =â‡˜Î“â‡™ memâ‡©2 âŸ¹ memâ‡©2 =â‡˜Î“â‡™ memâ‡©1"
  apply(rule tyenv_eq_sym')
